synonyms: dystroglycanopathy; alpha-dystroglycanopathy

label: qualitative or quantitative defects of alpha-actin
qualitative or quantitative defects of TRIM32
qualitative or quantitative defects of FKRP
pyruvate metabolism disorder
definition: An inherited metabolic disease that is has its basis in the disruption of pyruvate metabolic process.
synonyms: inborn pyruvate metabolic process disorder; inborn error of pyruvate metabolic process; rare inborn error of pyruvate metabolic process

label: pyrimidine metabolism disease
definition: A disease that has its basis in the disruption of pyrimidine nucleobase metabolic process.
synonyms: pyrimidine nucleobase metabolic process disease; disorder of pyrimidine metabolism; disorder of pyrimidine nucleobase metabolic process

label: pyometritis
definition: Inflammation of uterine musculature associated with pus in the uterine cavity.
synonyms: inflammation of myometrium; pyometra; myometrium inflammation

label: pylorus cancer
definition: A malignant neoplasm involving the pylorus.
synonyms: malignant tumor of pylorus; pylorus cancer; malignant neoplasm of pylorus of stomach; malignant pylorus neoplasm; Ca pylorus - stomach; malignant neoplasm of pylorus; malignant tumour of pylorus; malignant neoplasm of Prepylorus; cancer of pylorus

label: pyloric stenosis
definition: Narrowing of the pyloric lumen caused either by hypertrophy of the surrounding muscles or tissue scarring due to a chronic peptic ulcer.
synonyms: pyloric stenosis (disease); GOO; gastric outlet obstruction; pyloric stenosis; gastric outflow obstruction

label: pyelonephritis
definition: An inflammatory process affecting the kidney. The cause is most often bacterial, but may also be fungal in nature. Signs and symptoms may include fever, chills, flank pain, painful and frequent urination, cloudy or bloody urine, and confusion.
synonyms: kidney infection

label: pyelitis
definition: Inflammation of the renal pelvis.
synonyms: inflammation of renal pelvis; renal pelvis inflammation

label: purpura fulminans
definition: A severe, rapidly fatal reaction occurring most commonly in children following an infectious illness. It is characterized by large, rapidly spreading skin hemorrhages, fever, or shock. Purpura fulminans often accompanies or is triggered by disseminated intravascular coagulation.
synonyms: purpura gangrenosa
crossreferences: SCTID:13507004; MEDGEN:88448; DOID:0060538; UMLS:C0085650; MESH:D055665; icd11.foundation:1293848111

label: purpura
definition: A small blood vessel hemorrhage into the skin and/or mucous membranes. Newer lesions appear reddish in color. Older lesions are usually a darker purple color and eventually become a brownish-yellow color.
synonyms: purpuric disorder; purpura; purpura (disease)

label: purine metabolism disease
definition: A disease that has its basis in the disruption of purine nucleobase metabolic process.
synonyms: purine nucleobase metabolic process disease; disorder of purine metabolism; disorder of purine nucleobase metabolic process

label: pure red-cell aplasia
definition: A disease characterized by normocytic, normochromic anemia, low hematocrit, reticulocytopenia, and selective erythroid hypoplasia.
synonyms: red cell hypoplasia; Pure Red Cell Aplasia, Acquired; primary red cell aplasia; PRCA; pure red cell aplasia

label: pupil disorder
definition: A disease involving the pupil.
synonyms: disorder of pupil; pupil disease; disease or disorder of pupil; pupil disease or disorder; pupillary disorder; disease of pupil

label: punctate palmoplantar keratoderma
definition: A palmoplantar keratosis characterized by keratoses with a \raindrop\" pattern on the palmoplantar surface, skin lesions which may involve the whole of the palmoplantar surface, or may be more restricted in their distribution."
synonyms: punctate PPK; punctate keratosis palmoplantaris; punctate palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
subsets: mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:otar; mondo:rare; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders
crossreferences: SCTID:402773000; MEDGEN:870406; Orphanet:307967; UMLS:C4024851; GARD:21297; DOID:0060361; icd11.foundation:1212361548

label: pulmonary valve stenosis
definition: The pathologic narrowing of the orifice of the pulmonary valve. This lesion restricts blood outflow from the right ventricle to the pulmonary artery. When the trileaflet valve is fused into an imperforate membrane, the blockage is complete.

label: pulmonary valve disorder
definition: A disease involving the pulmonary valve.
synonyms: disorder of pulmonary valve; pulmonary valve disorder; pulmonary valve disease; disease of pulmonary valve; pulmonary valve disease or disorder; disease or disorder of pulmonary valve

label: pulmonary valve agenesis
definition: Pulmonary valve agenesis is a rare congenital heart malformation characterized by a total or partial absence of the pulmonary valve leaflets associated with stenosis of the pulmonary artery orifice and aneurysmal dilatation of the pulmonary arteries. It usually occurs in association with additional cardiovascular malformations such as teralogy of fallot or ventricular septal defect, or can occur as part of a syndrome (e.g. 22q11.2 deletion syndrome). Clinical features depend on the presence of associated cardiac malformations and include pulmonary insufficiency, bronchial obstruction (secondary to compression by aneurysmally dilated pulmonary arteries), pulmonary stenosis, cyanosis, and cardiac failure.3424
synonyms: absent pulmonary valve syndrome; PVA; congenital absence of the pulmonary valve
crossreferences: SCTID:6996004; NANDO:2100095; MEDGEN:576671; GARD:4597; Orphanet:982; UMLS:C0344983; NANDO:2200280

label: pulmonary tuberculosis
definition: A bacterial infection that affects the lungs and is caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis. Most patients with tuberculosis do not have symptoms (latent tuberculosis) and are not contagious. When signs and symptoms occur (active tuberculosis), patients become contagious. The signs and symptoms include chronic cough with blood-tinged sputum, night sweats, fever, fatigue, and weight loss.
synonyms: lung tuberculosis; pulmonary TB; lung TB

label: pulmonary sulcus neoplasm
definition: A neoplasm originating from the apical lung. Most superior sulcus neoplasms are bronchogenic carcinomas. This tumor may be associated with Pancoast syndrome. It is also known as Pancoast tumor.
synonyms: pulmonary sulcus tumour; pulmonary sulcus neoplasm; pulmonary sulcus tumor

label: pulmonary mucoepidermoid carcinoma
definition: A lung carcinoma characterized by the presence of malignant non-keratinizing squamoid cells, mucin-producing cells and intermediate type cells.
synonyms: lung mucoepidermoid cancer; lung mucoepidermoid carcinoma
crossreferences: DOID:0050932; MEDGEN:310949; NCIT:C45544; EFO:0006740; ONCOTREE:LUMEC; UMLS:C1708778

label: pulmonary large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma
definition: A large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma that involves the lung(s).
synonyms: large cell lung neuroendocrine carcinoma; large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma of the lung; lung large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma; large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma of lung; large cell lung carcinoma with neuroendocrine differentiation; LCNEC of the lung; pulmonary large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma

label: pulmonary hypertension
definition: Increased pressure within the pulmonary circulation due to lung or heart disorder.
crossreferences: MedDRA:10037400; SCTID:70995007; DOID:6432; icd11.foundation:1496633964; MESH:D006976; UMLS:C0020542; MEDGEN:9376

label: pulmonary fibrosis and/or bone marrow failure, telomere-related
pulmonary fibrosis
definition: Chronic progressive interstitial lung disorder characterized by the replacement of the lung tissue by connective tissue, leading to progressive dyspnea, respiratory failure, or right heart failure. Causes include chronic inflammatory processes, exposure to environmental irritants, radiation therapy, autoimmune disorders, certain drugs, or it may be idiopathic (no identifiable cause).
synonyms: pulmonary interstitial fibrosis; fibrosis of lung

label: pulmonary eosinophilia
definition: A condition characterized by infiltration of the lung with eosinophils due to inflammation or other disease processes. Major eosinophilic lung diseases are the eosinophilic pneumonias caused by infections, allergens, or toxic agents.

label: pulmonary emphysema
definition: A subcategory of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). It occurs in people who smoke and suffer from chronic bronchitis. It is characterized by inflation of the alveoli, alveolar wall damage, and reduction in the number of alveoli, resulting in difficulty breathing.
synonyms: emphysema; emphysema, pulmonary

label: pulmonary embolism
definition: The obstruction of the pulmonary artery or one of its branches by an embolus, sometimes associated with infarction of the lung.
synonyms: pulmonary embolism; embolism, pulmonary; pulmonary embolus; pulmonary embolism (disease); pulmonary artery embolism

label: pulmonary edema
definition: Accumulation of fluid in the lung tissues causing disturbance of the gas exchange that may lead to respiratory failure. It is caused by direct injury to the lung parenchyma or congestive heart failure. The symptoms may appear suddenly or gradually. Suddenly appearing symptoms include difficulty breathing, feeling of suffocation, and coughing associated with frothy sputum. Gradually appearing symptoms include difficulty breathing while lying in bed, shortness of breath during activity, and weight gain (in patients with congestive heart failure).
synonyms: edema, pulmonary

label: pulmonary aspergilloma
definition: A aspergillosis that involves the lung.
synonyms: lung aspergillosis

label: pulmonary alveolar proteinosis
definition: A rare lung disorder characterized by the filling of the pulmonary alveoli with proteinaceous material which stains positive with periodic acid-Schiff stain. It may be idiopathic or secondary due to hematologic malignancies or the inhalation of mineral dusts. Signs and symptoms include dyspnea, cough and low grade fever.
synonyms: pulmonary alveolar proteinosis

label: puerperal disorder
definition: Disorders or diseases associated with puerperium, the six-to-eight-week period immediately after parturition in humans.
synonyms: disorder of puerperium; puerperal disorder

label: ptosis
definition: The drooping of the upper eyelid.
synonyms: drooping eyelid; ptosis (disease); ptosis; eyelid ptosis; blepharoptosis

label: psychotic disorder
definition: An abnormal condition of the mind that involves a loss of contact with reality. People experiencing psychosis may exhibit personality changes and thought disorder. Depending on its severity, this may be accompanied by unusual or bizarre behavior, as well as difficulty with social interaction and impairment in carrying out daily life activities.
synonyms: psychosis

label: psychiatric disorder
definition: A disorder characterized by behavioral and/or psychological abnormalities, often accompanied by physical symptoms. The symptoms may cause clinically significant distress or impairment in social and occupational areas of functioning. Representative examples include anxiety disorders, cognitive disorders, mood disorders and schizophrenia.
synonyms: Psychiatric disorder; Psychiatric disease

label: psoriatic arthritis
definition: Joint inflammation associated with psoriasis.
synonyms: arthritis psoriatica; arthropathic psoriasis
crossreferences: icd11.foundation:868183264; ICD9:696.0; MESH:D015535; MEDGEN:2077; UMLS:C0003872; NANDO:2201059; SCTID:156370009; EFO:0003778; DOID:9008; NCIT:C61277; Orphanet:40050

label: psoriasis
definition: An autoimmune condition characterized by red, well-delineated plaques with silvery scales that are usually on the extensor surfaces and scalp. They can occasionally present with these manifestations: pustules; erythema and scaling in intertriginous areas, and erythroderma, that are often distributed on extensor surfaces and scalp.

label: pseudoxanthoma elasticum (inherited or acquired)
definition: An inherited disorder that causes calcium and other minerals to accumulate in the elastic fibers of the skin, eyes, and blood vessels, and less frequently in other areas such as the digestive tract.
synonyms: pseudoxanthoma elasticum; PXE

label: pseudomembranous conjunctivitis
definition: Conjunctivitis that is characterized by formation of a pseudomembrane.
synonyms: conjunctivitis with pseudomembrane

label: pseudohypoaldosteronism
definition: An inherited or acquired disorder of electrolyte metabolism, characterized by the inability of the renal tubules to respond to aldosterone. It is manifested by hyperkalemic metabolic acidosis, urinary salt wasting, normal or increased aldosterone secretion and normal glomerular filtration rate.

label: pseudoallergy
synonyms: non-allergic hypersensitivity to substance; pseudoallergy to substance

label: proximal-type epithelioid sarcoma
definition: An epithelioid sarcoma predominantly involving the pelvis, perineum, and genital organs. It tends to have a more aggressive clinical course as compared to the more frequently seen distal-type epithelioid sarcoma.
synonyms: central epithelioid sarcoma; proximal-type epithelioid sarcoma

label: protozoal dysentery
definition: A dysentery that involves protozoan infection.

label: protozoa infectious disease
definition: An infection that is caused by protozoans.
synonyms: protozoal infection

label: proteostasis deficiencies
definition: Disorders caused by imbalances in the protein homeostasis network - synthesis, folding, and transport of proteins; post-translational modifications; and degradation or clearance of misfolded proteins.
synonyms: Proteostasis dysfunctions; Proteostasis dysfunction; deficiencies, Proteostasis; deficiency, Proteostasis; dysfunctions, Proteostasis; Proteostasis deficiency; dysfunction, Proteostasis

label: proteinuria
definition: The presence of abnormal amounts of protein in the urine.
crossreferences: icd11.foundation:930895737; MEDGEN:10976; ICD9:791.0; MESH:D011507; ICD10CM:R80; UMLS:C0033687; DOID:576

label: protein-energy malnutrition
definition: A nutritional deficit that is caused by inadequate protein or calorie intake.
synonyms: Protein energy malnutrition

label: protein S deficiency
definition: Protein S deficiency is a disorder that causes abnormal blood clotting. When someone bleeds, the blood begins a complicated series of rapid chemical reactions involving proteins called blood coagulation factors to stop the bleeding. Other proteins in the blood, such as protein S, usually regulate these chemical reactions to prevent excessive clotting. When protein S is missing (deficient), clotting may not be regulatednormally and affected individuals have an increased risk of forming a blood clot called a thrombosis. People at risk to haveprotein S deficiency are those with an individual or family history of multiple blood clots in the veins. Treatment may include taking medication known as blood thinners to decrease the chance of developing a blood clot.
synonyms: Protein S deficiency disease; Protein S deficiency

label: prostatitis
definition: An infectious or non-infectious inflammatory process affecting the prostate gland.
synonyms: prostatitis (disease); prostate gland inflammation; prostatitis; inflammation of prostate gland

label: prostatic urethral cancer
definition: A male urethral cancer that involves the prostatic urethra.
synonyms: prostatic urethra male urethral cancer; prostatic urethral malignant neoplasm; male urethral cancer of prostatic urethra

label: prostatic acinar adenocarcinoma
definition: An invasive adenocarcinoma of the prostate gland composed of secretory cells. It is the most common histologic type of prostate adenocarcinoma. Several morphologic variants exist, including atrophic, pseudohyperplastic, foamy gland, and oncocytic variants.
synonyms: prostate acinar adenocarcinoma; acinar prostate adenocarcinoma; acinar adenocarcinoma of prostate; prostatic acinar adenocarcinoma; acinar adenocarcinoma of the prostate

label: prostate squamous cell carcinoma
definition: An invasive prostate carcinoma characterized by the presence of squamous differentiation of the malignant cellular infiltrate. There is no evidence of glandular differentiation.
synonyms: squamous cell carcinoma of prostate; squamous cell carcinoma of the prostate; prostate squamous cell carcinoma; prostate gland squamous cell carcinoma
crossreferences: NCIT:C5536; UMLS:C1302530; ONCOTREE:PRSC; MEDGEN:226996; SCTID:399590005; DOID:10287

label: prostate sarcoma
definition: A rare malignant soft tissue neoplasm that arises from the prostate gland. Representative examples include leiomyosarcoma, rhabdomyosarcoma, and stromal sarcoma.
synonyms: sarcoma of the prostate; sarcoma of prostate gland; prostate sarcoma; sarcoma of prostate; prostate gland sarcoma

label: prostate rhabdomyosarcoma
definition: A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm with skeletal muscle differentiation affecting the prostate.
synonyms: rhabdomyosarcoma (disease) of prostate gland; rhabdomyosarcoma of the prostate; prostate gland rhabdomyosarcoma; prostate rhabdomyosarcoma; rhabdomyosarcoma of prostate; prostate gland rhabdomyosarcoma (disease)

label: prostate neuroendocrine neoplasm
definition: A neoplasm with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the prostate gland. This category includes carcinoid tumors and small cell carcinomas.
synonyms: neuroendocrine neoplasm of prostate; prostate gland NET; prostate neuroendocrine neoplasm; prostate gland neuroendocrine neoplasm; neuroendocrine tumour of the prostate; neuroendocrine tumor of the prostate; neuroendocrine neoplasm of the prostate; prostate gland neuroendocrine tumor, well differentiated, low or intermediate grade; neuroendocrine neoplasm of prostate gland; prostate gland neuroendocrine tumour; prostate gland neuroendocrine tumor

label: prostate neoplasm
definition: A neoplasm (disease) that involves the prostate gland.
synonyms: prostate gland tumor; tumor of the prostate; prostate gland neoplasm; prostate gland neoplasm (disease); tumour of prostate gland; tumor of prostate; neoplasm of the prostate; tumor of prostate gland; prostate gland tumour; neoplasm of prostate gland; tumour of prostate; prostate tumor; prostate tumour; tumour of the prostate; neoplasm of prostate
crossreferences: UMLS:C0033578; ICD9:600.1; ONCOTREE:PROSTATE; DOID:13206; MEDGEN:18697; NCIT:C3343

label: prostate intraepithelial neoplasia
definition: A neoplastic proliferation of the epithelial cells that line the acini and the ducts of the prostate gland. The neoplastic epithelial cells are confined within the acini and the ducts and they do not invade the surrounding prostatic stroma. Morphologically, it is classified as low or high grade.
synonyms: prostate intraepithelial neoplasia (pin); pin; prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia; pin - prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia; prostate intraepithelial neopl.

label: prostate disorder
definition: A disease involving the prostate gland.
synonyms: prostate gland disease or disorder; prostate disease; disease or disorder of prostate gland; prostate gland disease; disorder of prostate gland; disease of prostate gland; prostate disorder

label: prostate carcinoma
definition: A carcinoma that arises from epithelial cells of the prostate gland.
synonyms: carcinoma of the prostate; prostate carcinoma; prostate gland carcinoma; carcinoma of prostate; carcinoma of prostate gland

label: prostate cancer
definition: A primary or metastatic malignant tumor involving the prostate gland. The vast majority are carcinomas.
synonyms: malignant prostate gland neoplasm; NGP - new growth of prostate; malignant tumour of prostate; malignant tumour of the prostate; malignant tumor of prostate; malignant neoplasm of prostate gland; malignant tumor of the prostate; malignant prostate tumour; malignant neoplasm of prostate; malignant prostate neoplasm; cancer of prostate gland; malignant neoplasm of the prostate; malignant prostate tumor; prostatic cancer; prostate gland cancer

label: prostate adenocarcinoma
definition: A carcinoma that arises from glandular epithelial cells of the prostate gland
synonyms: adenocarcinoma of prostate; adenocarcinoma of the prostate; prostate adenocarcinoma; prostate gland adenocarcinoma
crossreferences: UMLS:C0007112; SCTID:399490008; EFO:0000673; DOID:2526; NCIT:C2919; ONCOTREE:PRAD; MEDGEN:764

label: prosopagnosia
definition: Impaired ability to recognize other human faces in the absence of a vision disorder. It may be a congenital disorder or the result of brain injury.
synonyms: face blindness; prosopagnosia (disease); prosopagnosia
crossreferences: UMLS:C0234512; DOID:4970; icd11.foundation:858616900; NCIT:C85031; MESH:D020238; MEDGEN:65884; HP:0010528

label: prolymphocytic leukemia
definition: A mature B- or T- cell leukemia with progressive clinical course. It is characterized by the presence of medium-sized lymphocytes with visible nucleoli (prolymphocytes) in the peripheral blood, bone marrow, and spleen.
synonyms: prolymphocytic leukemia (B or T-cell); prolymphocytic leukemia (B or T); prolymphocytic leukaemia (B or T); PLL; prolymphocytic leukemia; prolymphocytic leukaemia (B or T-cell)

label: proliferative vitreoretinopathy
definition: Vitreoretinal membrane shrinkage or contraction secondary to the proliferation of primarily retinal pigment epithelial cells and glial cells, particularly fibrous astrocytes, followed by membrane formation. The formation of fibrillar collagen and cellular proliferation appear to be the basis for the contractile properties of the epiretinal and vitreous membranes.

label: proliferative glomerulonephritis
definition: A constellation of renal disorders characterized by an increase number of cells in the glomerulus; these disorders generally present with nephrotic syndrome, and generally progress to end stage renal failure over a matter of weeks to years, depending on the etiology. Examples include IgA nephropathy, membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis, and rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis.

label: prolactin producing pituitary tumor
definition: An adenoma or carcinoma of the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland that produces prolactin.
synonyms: prolactin secreting tumor of the pituitary; prolactin-producing pituitary gland tumor; prolactin secreting pituitary gland tumour; prolactin producing tumor of the pituitary; prolactin producing neoplasm of the pituitary; prolactin secreting pituitary gland neoplasm; prolactin-producing pituitary gland tumour; prolactin producing tumor of the pituitary gland; prolactin-producing pituitary gland neoplasm; prolactin producing tumour of the pituitary gland; prolactin secreting tumour of pituitary; prolactin secreting neoplasm of pituitary; prolactin secreting tumour of the pituitary; prolactin secreting tumour of pituitary gland; prolactin producing tumour of pituitary gland; prolactin producing neoplasm of pituitary gland; prolactin secreting tumor of pituitary gland; prolactin secreting tumour of the pituitary gland; PRL producing pituitary gland neoplasm; prolactin producing pituitary tumor; prolactin secreting neoplasm of pituitary gland; prolactin producing tumor of pituitary; prolactin producing tumour of pituitary; prolactin secreting pituitary neoplasm; prolactin secreting tumor of pituitary; prolactin secreting neoplasm of the pituitary gland; prolactin producing neoplasm of the pituitary gland; prolactin secreting tumor of the pituitary gland; prolactin secreting pituitary gland tumor; prolactin secreting neoplasm of the pituitary; prolactin producing pituitary gland neoplasm; prolactin secreting pituitary tumour; prolactin producing tumor of pituitary gland; prolactin producing pituitary gland tumor; prolactin producing tumour of the pituitary; prolactin producing pituitary neoplasm; prolactin producing neoplasm of pituitary; prolactin producing pituitary gland tumour; prolactin secreting pituitary tumor

label: progressive muscular dystrophy
synonyms: progressive muscular dystrophy
subsets: mondo:otar; mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:matrix_excluded; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:clingen; mondo:rare

label: progressive external ophthalmoplegia with mitochondrial DNA deletions
synonyms: progressive external ophthalmoplegia with mtDNA deletions

label: progeroid syndrome
definition: A group of rare genetic disorders which mimic physiological aging, making affected individuals appear to be older than they are.

label: prion disease
definition: A transmissible disease that is caused by a protein that is able to induce abnormal folding of normal cellular proteins, leading to characteristic spongiform brain changes, which are associated with neuronal loss without an inflammatory response. Such disorders have typically long incubation periods, but are then generally rapidly progressive and are uniformly fatal.
synonyms: prion induced disorder; prion protein disease; spongiform encephalopathy; prion disease pathway

label: primordial dwarfism and slender bone disorder
definition: A skeletal dysplsia characterized by primordial dwarfism, an extreme growth deficiency disorder that has its onset during embryonic development and persists throughout life and slender bone disorder, a heterogeneous group of neonatal dwarfism syndromes, usually of unknown etiology, associated with gracile (thin) bones, multiple fractures, and prenatal or early postnatal death.

label: primitive neuroectodermal tumor
definition: A malignant neoplasm that originates in the neuroectoderm. The neuroectoderm constitutes the portion of the ectoderm of the early embryo that gives rise to the central and peripheral nervous systems and includes some glial cell precursors.
synonyms: primitive neuroectodermal tumour (PNET); neuroectodermal tumor; primitive neuroectodermal tumor (PNET); PNET; primitive neuroectodermal neoplasm; primitive neuroectodermal tumor; neuroectodermal tumour; neuroectodermal neoplasm
crossreferences: NCIT:C3716; ICDO:9503/3; EFO:0005235; ONCOTREE:PNET; UMLS:C0206663; MESH:D017599; ICDO:9473/3; MEDGEN:64627; DOID:171

label: primary viral infectious disease
definition: The initial viral infectious disase that causes illness.

label: primary systemic mycosis
definition: A systemic mycosis that arises from infection in an immunologically normal host.

label: primary prostate urothelial carcinoma
definition: An urothelial carcinoma that arises from the urothelial lining of the prostatic ducts or the prostatic urethra.
synonyms: transitional cell carcinoma of prostate; prostate gland transitional cell carcinoma; primary prostate urothelial carcinoma; prostate transitional cell carcinoma; primary prostate urothelial cancer; prostate urothelial carcinoma; transitional cell carcinoma of the prostate

label: primary progressive aphasia
definition: Primary progressive aphasia (PPA) is a neurodegenerative disorder, characterized by a primary dissolution of language, with relative sparing of other mental faculties for at least the first 2 years of illness. PPA is recognized as the language variant in the frontotemporal dementia (FTD) spectrum of disorders. PPA can be classified into 3 subtypes based on specific speech and language features: semantic dementia (SD), progressive non-fluent aphasia (PNFA) and logopenic progressive aphasia (lv-PPA).
synonyms: PPA; Mesulam syndrome

label: primary polydipsia
definition: A form of polydipsia characterized by excessive fluid intake in the absence of physiological stimuli to drink.

label: primary pigmented nodular adrenocortical disease
definition: A form of bilateral adrenocortical hyperplasia that is often associated with adrenocorticotrophin hormone (ACTH) independent Cushing syndrome and is characterized by small to normal sized adrenal glands containing multiple small cortical pigmented nodules (less than 1 cm in diameter).
synonyms: pigmented nodular adrenocortical disease; PPNAD; primary pigmented nodular adrenal dysplasia; pigmented nodular adrenocortical disease, primary
crossreferences: UMLS:C4304832; MEDGEN:930501; GARD:10906; icd11.foundation:2003695246; OMIMPS:610489; Orphanet:189439; DOID:0060280; NCIT:C131196; SCTID:719274008

label: primary peritoneal serous adenocarcinoma
definition: A rare, serous adenocarcinoma that diffusely involves the pelvic peritoneum seen predominantly in elderly postmenopausal women. Exclusion of serous carcinoma arising from the ovary and fimbrial end of fallopian tube is required to diagnose the above entity.
synonyms: primary peritoneal serous adenocarcinoma

label: primary orthostatic hypotension
definition: Primary orthostatic hypotension is a rare type of orthostatic hypotension. It is not a disease per se, but a condition caused by several disorders that affect a specific part of the autonomic nervous system, such as multiple system atrophy, young-onset Parkinson's disease, pure autonomic failure, dopamine beta-hydroxylase deficiency, familial dysautonomia, and pure autonomic failure among others. The autonomic nervous system is the part of the nervous system that regulates certain involuntary body functions such as heart rate, blood pressure, sweating, and bowel and bladder control. Orthostatic hypotension is a form of low blood pressure that happens when standing-up from sitting or lying down. Common symptoms may include dizziness, lightheadedness, generalized weakness, leg buckling, nausea, blurry vision, fatigue, and headaches. Additional symptoms can include chest pain (angina), head and neck pain (often affecting neck and shoulders with a coat hanger distribution), decline in cognitive functioning such as difficulty concentrating, temporary loss of consciousness or “blackout”. Some people with primary orthostatic hypotension may also have high blood pressure when lying down. The treatment depends upon several factors including the specific underlying cause including The treatment depends upon several factors including the specific underlying cause and may include physical counter-maneuvers like lying down, sitting down, squatting clenching buttocks, leg crossing, and support garment and medication.

label: primary lymphedema
definition: A congenital condition that results in swelling in the arms or legs, and can occur during adolescence or adulthood. Loss of motion and pain may also accompany the swelling. Protein-rich lymphatic fluid accumulates in tissues, engorging and enlarging vessels and often causing visible swelling, tenderness, and pain. Left untreated, the affected tissues may continue to swell, and can become hardened or fibrotic and susceptible to infection.
synonyms: Troncular lymphatic malformation; primary lymphedema
crossreferences: Orphanet:77240; MEDGEN:1804666; GARD:18932; icd11.foundation:794588197; NCIT:C48829; UMLS:C5576443; NANDO:2201031

label: primary interstitial lung disease specific to childhood
synonyms: primary interstitial lung disease specific to childhood; primary ILD specific to childhood

label: primary hypophysitis
definition: Immune-mediated inflammation of the pituitary gland often associated with other autoimmune diseases (e.g., hashimoto disease; graves disease; and addison disease).
synonyms: autoimmune hypophysitis; lymphocytic hypophysitis

label: primary hypertrophic osteoarthropathy
definition: A genetically and clinically heterogeneous inherited disorder characterized by digital clubbing and osteoarthropathy, with variable features of pachydermia, delayed closure of the fontanels, and congenital heart disease. There are two types of PHO: pachydermoperiostosis and cranio-osteoarthropathy.
synonyms: pachydermoperiostosis; pachydermoperiostosis of nail [ambiguous]; PDP; idiopathic hypertrophic osteoarthropathy; Touraine Solente Gole syndrome; pachydermoperiostosis of nail; hypertropic osteoarthropathy, primary; PHO; hypertrophic osteoarthropathy, primary, autosomal recessive, type 1; hypertrophic osteoarthropathy, primary; Touraine-Solente-Gole syndrome; pachydermoperiostosis syndrome
subsets: mondo:rare; mondo:otar; mondo:ordo_disorder; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:orphanet_rare; mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:ordo_malformation_syndrome; mondo:nord_rare
crossreferences: NCIT:C85023; MESH:D010004; NANDO:1200642; MedDRA:10051686; Orphanet:248095; GARD:20667; OMIMPS:259100; UMLS:C0029411; NANDO:2100288; NANDO:2201004; MEDGEN:18210; DOID:14283; Orphanet:2796; icd11.foundation:792225761; SCTID:88220006

label: primary hyperparathyroidism
definition: Hyperfunction of the parathyroid glands resulting in the overproduction of parathyroid hormone. It is caused by parathyroid adenoma, parathyroid hyperplasia, parathyroid carcinoma, and multiple endocrine neoplasia. It is associated with hypercalcemia and hypophosphatemia. Signs and symptoms include weakness, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, constipation, depression, bone pain, osteoporosis, cystic bone lesions, and kidney stones.
synonyms: primary hyperparathyroidism (disease); primary hyperparathyroidism

label: primary dysautonomia
definition: Disorders of the autonomic nervous system occurring as a primary condition. Manifestations can involve any or all body systems but commonly affect the blood pressure and heart rate.
synonyms: primary dysautonomia

label: primary cutis verticis gyrata
definition: Cutis verticis gyrata (CVG) is a progressive cutaneous disorder predominantly affecting males and characterized by hypertrophy and thickening of the skin of the scalp forming convoluted furrows with deep, tender, and cerebriform cutaneous folds. Hair is usually normal in the furrows and sparse on the folds. CG can be isolated (essential CVG) or associated with other abnormalities such as intellectual deficit, epilepsy, cataract, blindness, and deafness (non essential CVG).
synonyms: cutis verticis gyrata
subsets: mondo:nord_rare; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:otar; mondo:rare; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders
crossreferences: GARD:1643; UMLS:C0263417; ICD9:757.39; MEDGEN:78095; Orphanet:671; SCTID:51603000; icd11.foundation:71926572

label: primary cutaneous lymphoma
definition: Cutaneous lymphoma is a heterogeneous entity with respect to its clinical and pathological features, evolutive profile, prognosis, molecular etiology and response to therapy. These specifications have been taken into account in recent classifications, which have placed particular importance on the prognostic implications of these different entities.
synonyms: cutaneous (skin) lymphoma; primary cutaneous lymphoma; primary skin lymphoma
subsets: mondo:gard_rare; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:otar; mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:rare
crossreferences: MEDGEN:220981; Orphanet:542; MedDRA:10051708; SCTID:400001003; UMLS:C1302772; GARD:18698; NCIT:C7162

label: primary cutaneous T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma
definition: A T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma arising from the skin. Representative examples include mycosis fungoides and primary cutaneous anaplastic large cell lymphoma.
synonyms: cutaneous T-cell lymphoma; skin T-cell non-Hodgkin's lymphoma; CTCL; cutaneous T cell lymphoma; T-cell non-Hodgkin's lymphoma of the skin; T-cell non-Hodgkin's lymphoma of skin; primary cutaneous T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma; primary cutaneous T-cell non-Hodgkin's lymphoma; cutaneous T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma; cutaneous T-cell non-Hodgkin's lymphoma; PCTCL

label: primary cutaneous T-cell lymphoma
subsets: mondo:nord_rare; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:rare; mondo:otar
crossreferences: GARD:6226; MedDRA:10011677; Orphanet:171901; MEDGEN:36336; MESH:D016410; UMLS:C0079773

label: primary cutaneous CD30+ T-cell lymphoproliferative disease
synonyms: primary cutaneous Ki-1+ T-cell lymphoproliferative disease
crossreferences: UMLS:C5679826; MEDGEN:1843249; Orphanet:541; icd11.foundation:1046496266; MedDRA:10065863; GARD:18697

label: primary congenital glaucoma
definition: Primary congenital glaucoma (PCG) is characterized by elevated intraocular pressure (IOP), enlargement of the globe (buphthalmos), edema, and opacification of the cornea with rupture of Descemet's membrane (Haab's striae), thinning of the anterior sclera and iris atrophy, anomalously deep anterior chamber, and structurally normal posterior segment except for progressive glaucomatous optic atrophy. Symptoms include photophobia, blepharospasm, and excessive tearing. Typically, the diagnosis is made in the first year of life. Depending on when treatment is instituted, visual acuity may be reduced and/or visual fields may be restricted. In untreated individuals, blindness invariably occurs.
synonyms: primary congenital glaucoma; primary congenital glaucoma (disease)

label: primary brain neoplasm
synonyms: primary brain tumor; primary brain neoplasm; primary brain tumour

label: primary avascular necrosis
synonyms: primary AVN

label: primary adrenal insufficiency
definition: A hormonal disorder that occurs when the adrenal glands fail to release adequate amounts of glucocorticoids (cortisol), mineralocorticoids (aldosterone, 11-deoxycorticosterone), and androgens (dehydroepiandrosterone) to meet physiologic needs, despite release of ACTH from the pituitary.
crossreferences: GARD:19802; MEDGEN:854614; MedDRA:10052381; NCIT:C113172; Orphanet:101958; UMLS:C3887896

label: primary acquired red cell aplasia
synonyms: primary autoimmune red cell aplasia

label: presbycusis
definition: Bilateral hearing loss caused by progressive degeneration of cochlear structures and central auditory pathways, typically associated with the aging process.
synonyms: ARHI; presbycusis; age-related hearing impairment
crossreferences: NCIT:C116367; UMLS:C0033074; icd11.foundation:1569854675; MESH:D011304; MEDGEN:10911; SCTID:49526009

label: premature aging syndrome
definition: Changes in the organism associated with senescence, occurring at an accelerated rate.
crossreferences: GARD:19017; UMLS:C0231341; MESH:D019588; MEDGEN:65416; Orphanet:79389; MedDRA:10063493

label: premalignant hematological system disease
definition: A hematologic disorder which does not display the morphologic and/or clinical characteristics of an overt malignancy. Representative examples include atypical lymphoproliferative disorders and myelodysplastic syndromes.
synonyms: premalignant hematologic condition

label: prelingual non-syndromic genetic hearing loss
definition: A rare, genetically highly heterogeneous otorhinolaryngologic disease, resulting from inner and/or middle ear or hearing nerve anomalies, typically characterized by bilateral, severe to profound hearing loss (mean sensorineural hearing impairment of 60 dB or more for 500-, 1,000-, and 2,000-Hz frequency tones in the better ear) which occurs before the onset of speech development and is not associated with visible external ear abnormalities or any other medical problems. It is usually nonprogressive and impedes oral language acquisition.
synonyms: prelingual non-syndromic genetic hearing loss

label: prekallikrein deficiency
definition: A condition characterized by the congenital or acquired deficiency of prekallikrein. This deficiency is usually not associated with bleeding. The congenital deficiency is very rare. Acquired deficiency may occur in diffuse intravascular coagulation, infections, and sickle cell disease.
synonyms: prekallikrein deficiency

label: pregnancy disorder
definition: A disorder that is related to pregnancy. Representative examples include ectopic pregnancy, toxemia of pregnancy, and gestational trophoblastic tumor.
synonyms: disorder of pregnancy, childbirth, or puerperium; complication of pregnancy or childbirth; pregnancy disease; disorder of pregnancy; pregnancy disorder

label: precursor lymphoblastic lymphoma/leukemia
definition: A neoplasm of immature malignant lymphocytes (lymphoblasts) committed to the B-cell or T-cell lineage. Neoplasms involving the bone marrow and the peripheral blood are called precursor lymphoblastic leukemias or acute lymphoblastic leukemias. Neoplasms involving primarily lymph nodes or extranodal sites are called lymphoblastic lymphomas. -- 2003
synonyms: precursor lymphoblastic leukemia/lymphoma; precursor lymphoblastic lymphoma/leukemia; precursor lymphoid neoplasm

label: precursor T-lymphoblastic lymphoma/leukemia
definition: A neoplasm of lymphoblasts committed to the T-cell lineage, typically composed of small to medium-sized blast cells. When the neoplasm involves predominantly the bone marrow and the peripheral blood, it is called T acute lymphoblastic leukemia. When it involves nodal or extranodal sites it is called T lymphoblastic lymphoma. (WHO, 2001)
synonyms: precursor T lymphoblastic lymphoma/leukemia; precursor T lymphoblastic leukemia/lymphoma; T lymphoblastic leukemia/lymphoma; precursor T-lymphoblastic lymphoma/leukemia

label: precancerous condition
definition: A pathological process with signs indicating it may become cancerous. Representative examples include leukoplakia, dysplastic nevus, actinic keratosis, xeroderma pigmentosum, and intraepithelial neoplasia.
synonyms: premalignant state; precancerous state; premalignant condition; precancerous condition

label: preaxial polydactyly of fingers
definition: Preaxial polydactyly of fingers is a limb malformation syndrome characterized by the attachment of a superfluous digit on the first digit. Four types have been defined: Type I (PPD1 or biphalangeal thumb polydactyly) which shows duplication of one or more skeletal components of a biphalangeal thumb; type II (PPD2 or polydactyly of a triphalangeal thumb) which involves the presence of a usually opposable triphalangeal thumb with or without additional duplication of thumb; type III (PPD3 or polydactyly of an index finger) where the thumb is replaced by one or two triphalangeal digits with dermatoglyphic pattern specific for the index finger; and type IV (PPD4 or polysyndactyly) which shows variably mild degrees of thumb duplication and variable syndactyly between 3rd and 4th fingers. Among the four types, PPD1 is the most frequent form. Preaxial polydactyly of fingers is caused by disruptions to the developmental patterning of the limb along the anterior-posterior axis that lead to changes in digit number and identity.
synonyms: preaxial polydactyly of hand
crossreferences: Orphanet:294939; UMLS:C0345354; GARD:12767; OMIMPS:174400; icd11.foundation:1066753144; MEDGEN:87498

label: pre-malignant neoplasm
definition: A disease of cellular proliferation that results in abnormal growths in the body, which do not invade or destroy the surrounding tissue but, given enough time, will transform into a cancer.

label: postlingual non-syndromic genetic hearing loss
definition: Postlingual non-syndromic genetic deafness is a rare, genetically highly heterogeneous otorhinolaryngologic disease, resulting from inner and/or middle ear or hearing nerve anomalies, typically characterized by progressive, bilateral, moderate to profound hearing loss (mean sensorineural hearing impairment equal to 40 dB or more for 500-, 1,000-, and 2,000-Hz frequency tones in the better ear) which occurs after the onset of speech development and is not associated with visible external ear abnormalities or any other medical problems. Language development is not initially significantly delayed.

label: posthitis
definition: An inflammatory disease involving a pathogenic inflammatory response in the prepuce of penis.
synonyms: prepuce of penis inflammation; inflammation of prepuce of penis

label: postgastrectomy syndrome
definition: Sequelae of gastrectomy from the second week after operation on. Include recurrent or anastomotic ulcer, postprandial syndromes (dumping syndrome and late postprandial hypoglycemia), disordered bowel action, and nutritional deficiencies.
synonyms: postgastric surgery syndrome

label: posterior uveitis
definition: Inflammation of the choroid as well as the retina and vitreous body. Some form of visual disturbance is usually present. The most important characteristics of posterior uveitis are vitreous opacities, choroiditis, and chorioretinitis.
synonyms: uveitis, posterior; chorioretinal region inflammation; inflammation of chorioretinal region

label: posterior pituitary gland neoplasm
definition: A low-grade neoplasm that arises from the neurohypophysis. It includes the granular cell tumor of the neurohypophysis and pituicytoma.
synonyms: PITUICYTOMA, benign; posterior pituitary gland tumor; posterior pituitary gland neoplasm; tumour of neurohypophysis; neurohypophysis tumour; neurohypophysis tumor; posterior pituitary tumour; neoplasm of neurohypophysis; posterior pituitary gland tumour; Neurohypophysis tumour; Neurohypophysis neoplasm; posterior pituitary tumor; posterior pituitary neoplasm; Neurohypophysis tumor; tumor of neurohypophysis; neurohypophysis neoplasm (disease); neurohypophysis neoplasm

label: posterior fossa ependymoma
definition: A high grade ependymoma that is located within the posterior fossa.

label: posterior cranial fossa meningioma
definition: A meningioma that affects the posterior cranial fossa.
synonyms: posterior cranial fossa meningioma (disease); meningioma of posterior cranial fossa; meningioma of the posterior cranial fossa; meningioma (disease) of posterior cranial fossa

label: posterior corneal dystrophy
definition: Posterior corneal dystrophies refers to a group of rare genetically determined corneal dystrophies (CDs) characterized by lesions affecting the corneal endothelium and Descemet membrane, and variable effects on vision depending on the type of dystrophy.
subsets: mondo:gard_rare; mondo:rare; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:otar; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders

label: post-viral disorder
definition: A post-infectious disorder that follows viral infection but is distinct from the viral infection itself and its usual manifestations.
synonyms: sequela of viral disease

label: post-infectious neuralgia
synonyms: postinfectious neuralgia

label: post-infectious disorder
definition: A disorder that follows infection but is distinct from the infection itself and its usual manifestations.
synonyms: sequela of infectious disorder

label: post-COVID-19 disorder
definition: A SARS-CoV-2-related disease that is caused by infection by SARS-CoV-2, and manifests after the original primary infection.

label: porphyrin metabolism disease
definition: A disease that has its basis in the disruption of porphyrin-containing compound metabolic process.
synonyms: disorder of porphyrin-containing compound metabolic process; porphyrin-containing compound metabolic process disease; disorder of porphyrin metabolism

label: porphyria
definition: Porphyria is a group of diseases in which substances called porphyrins build up, negatively affecting the skin or nervous system. Most types are inherited, but porphyria cutanea tarda may also be due to increased iron in the liver, hepatitis C, alcohol, or HIV/AIDS.
synonyms: porphyria

label: porokeratosis
definition: A clonal proliferation of abnormal keratinocytes characterized by the development of localized or multiple atrophic skin patches surrounded by an annular keratotic ring called cornoid lamella.
synonyms: porokeratosis; porokeratosis (disease)
subsets: mondo:nord_rare; mondo:rare; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:otar; mondo:disease_grouping

label: popliteal pterygium syndrome
definition: A rare, autosomal dominant inherited syndrome caused by mutations in the IRF6 gene. It is characterized by the presence of cleft palate, cleft lip, pits in the lower lip, web behind the knee (popliteal pterygium), syndactyly, cryptorchidism, scrotal malformation, and hypoplasia of the labia majora.
synonyms: facio-genito-popliteal syndrome; PPS
subsets: mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:rare; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:otar; mondo:disease_grouping

label: pontocerebellar hypoplasia
definition: Pontocerebellar hypoplasias (PCH) are a rare heterogeneous group of diseases characterized by hypoplasia and atrophy and/or early neurodegeneration of the cerebellum and pons. Eight subtypes named type 1-8 have been described, generally inherited in an autosomal recessive pattern.
synonyms: pontocerebellar hypoplasia; pontoneocerebllar hypoplasia; PCH; pontoneocerebellar atrophy
subsets: mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:rare; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:otar

label: polyradiculoneuropathy
definition: Diseases characterized by injury or dysfunction involving multiple peripheral nerves and nerve roots. The process may primarily affect myelin or nerve axons. Two of the more common demyelinating forms are acute inflammatory polyradiculopathy (guillain-barre syndrome) and polyradiculoneuropathy, chronic inflammatory demyelinating. Polyradiculoneuritis refers to inflammation of multiple peripheral nerves and spinal nerve roots.

label: polyposis
synonyms: multiple polyps; polyposis

label: polyploidy
definition: Chromosomal disorder in which the chromosomal constitution of a cell containing multiples of the normal number of chromosomes; includes triploidy (symbol: 3N), tetraploidy (symbol: 4N), etc.
crossreferences: SCTID:72991005; MEDGEN:18567; UMLS:C0032578; GARD:19348; icd11.foundation:1286128770; MESH:D011123; Orphanet:96321

label: polyp of rectum
definition: A polyp that involves the rectum.
synonyms: polyp of the rectum; rectum polyp; rectal polyp

label: polyp of large intestine
definition: A polyp that involves the large intestine.
synonyms: polyp of large bowel; polyp of the large intestine; polyp of the large bowel; colorectal polyp; large intestine polyp; large bowel polyp

label: polyp of gallbladder
definition: A polyp that involves the gall bladder.
synonyms: gall bladder polyp; gallbladder polyp; polyp of the gallbladder

label: polyp
definition: A usually exophytic mass attached to the underlying tissue by a broad base or a thin stalk. Polyps can be neoplastic or non-neoplastic. Neoplastic polyps usually represent proliferations of the epithelium, and are commonly seen in the gastrointestinal tract. Polyps of the gastrointestinal tract are often called adenomas, are associated with dysplasia, and may eventually transform into carcinomas. Non-neoplastic polyps may be inflammatory, degenerative, or the result of malformations.
synonyms: polyp

label: polyneuropathy
definition: A disease or disorder affecting more than one nerve.
synonyms: polyneuropathy

label: polymorphic ventricular tachycardia
definition: A ventricular tachycardia that is irregular in rate and rhythm.
synonyms: ventricular tachycardia, polymorphic; polymorphic ventricular tachycardia

label: polymicrogyria
definition: A developmental brain abnormality characterized by an excessive amount of small convolutions on the surface of the brain and cognitive dysfunction.
subsets: mondo:otar; mondo:rare; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders

label: polydactyly-syndactyly-triphalangism
definition: Any skeletal dysplasia that is characterizedby polydactyly, syndactyly and triphalangism, where a digit has three phalanges instead of two.

label: polycythemia
definition: Abnormally high mass or concentration of red blood cells in the blood, either due to an increase in erythropoiesis or a decrease in plasma volume.

label: polyarticular juvenile idiopathic arthritis
synonyms: juvenile polyarticular arthritis; juvenile polyarthritis; polyarticular JIA

label: polyarticular arthritis
definition: An arthritis affecting five or more separate joints.
synonyms: polyarthritis; polyarticular arthritis

label: poliovirus infection
definition: An disease or disorder caused by infection with Enterovirus C.
synonyms: infection caused by human poliovirus; human poliovirus infection; Enterovirus C caused disease or disorder; Enterovirus C disease or disorder; Enterovirus C infectious disease

label: poisoning
definition: A condition or physical state produced by the ingestion, injection, inhalation of or exposure to a deleterious agent.

label: pneumothorax
definition: Abnormal presence of air in the pleural cavity.
synonyms: pneumothorax; pneumothorax (disease)

label: pneumonitis
definition: An inflammatory process affecting the lung parenchyma. It is a milder form of lung inflammation compared to pneumonia.
synonyms: inflammation of lung parenchyma; pneumonitis; lung parenchyma inflammation

label: pneumonia caused by gram negative bacteria
synonyms: pneumonia due to gramme negative bacteria; pneumonia caused by gram negative bacteria; pneumonia due to gram negative bacteria

label: pneumoconiosis
definition: An occupational lung disorder caused by inhalation of dust particles. It is characterized by bilateral interstitial lung infiltrates. Representative examples include asbestosis, silicosis, anthracosis, and talc pneumoconiosis.

label: pneumococcal infection
definition: Infections with bacteria of the species streptococcus pneumoniae.
synonyms: pneumococcal infection; Streptococcus pneumoniae infectious disease; Streptococcus pneumoniae disease or disorder; Streptococcus pneumoniae caused disease or disorder

label: pleural solitary fibrous tumor
definition: A localized neoplasm of probable fibroblastic derivation, that arises from the pleura. It is characterized by the presence of round to spindle-shaped cells, hylanized stroma formation, thin-walled branching blood vessels, and thin bands of collagen.

label: pleural neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that involves the serous membrane that lines the lungs and thoracic cavity. Most pleural neoplasms are metastatic. Diffuse malignant mesothelioma is the most common primary malignant neoplasm of the pleura.

label: pleural mesothelioma
definition: A neoplasm that arises from the mesothelial cells of the pleura. The primary cause is exposure to asbestos. The major histologic variants are the epithelioid malignant mesothelioma, desmoplastic malignant mesothelioma, and sarcomatoid malignant mesothelioma. Patients present with persistent cough and shortness of breath.

label: plasma protein metabolism disease
definition: An inherited metabolic disorder that involves plasma protein metabolism malfunction.

definition: A clonal proliferation of immunoglobulin-secreting plasma cells. This category includes plasma cell myeloma, plasma cell leukemia, plasmacytoma, monoclonal immunoglobulin deposition disease, and monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance.
synonyms: plasma cell tumour; plasma cell dyscrasia; plasma cell tumor, malignant; plasmacytic neoplasm; plasmacytic tumor; plasma cell tumor; plasma cell neoplasm; plasmacytic tumour

label: placenta praevia
definition: Abnormal placentation in which the placenta implants in the lower segment of the uterus (the zone of dilation) and may cover part or all of the opening of the cervix. It is often associated with serious antepartum bleeding and premature labor.

definition: A disease involving the pituitary gland.

definition: Proportionately decreased bodily growth due to failure of the pituitary gland to produce an adequate supply of growth hormone.

label: pineal parenchymal cell neoplasm
definition: A neoplasm arising from the pineocyte, a cell with photosensory and neuroendocrine functions. It may be composed of mature elements or primitive, immature cells. The cellular composition determines the biological behavior and clinical outcome. Three types are recognized: pineoblastoma, pineocytoma, and pineal parenchymal tumor of intermediate differentiation (Adapted from WHO.)

label: pilosebaceous hamartoma
definition: A hamartoma characterized by localized pilosebaceous apparatus malformation.
synonyms: pilosebaceous hamartoma

label: piedra
definition: Either of two diseases resulting from fungal infection of the hair shafts. Black piedra occurs mainly in and on the hairs of the scalp and is caused by Piedraia hortae; white piedra occurs in and on the hairs of the scalp, beard, mustache and genital areas and is caused by Trichosporon species.
synonyms: hair shaft fungal infectious disease

label: physiological sexual disorder
definition: Physiological disturbances in normal sexual performance in either the male or the female.
synonyms: physiological sexual disorder; physiological sexual dysfunction

label: physical urticaria
definition: A distinct subgroup of the urticaria that are induced by an exogenous physical stimulus rather than occurring spontaneously.

label: phyllodes tumor
definition: A benign, borderline, or malignant fibroepithelial neoplasm arising from the breast and rarely the prostate gland. It may recur following resection. The recurrence rates are higher for borderline and malignant phyllodes tumors. In borderline and malignant phyllodes tumors metastases to distant anatomic sites can occur. The incidence of metastases is higher in malignant phyllodes tumors.
synonyms: phyllodes neoplasm; cystosarcoma phyllodes; CSP; phyllodes tumor

label: photosensitivity disease
definition: Abnormal responses to sunlight or artificial light due to extreme reactivity of light-absorbing molecules in tissues. It refers almost exclusively to skin photosensitivity, including sunburn, reactions due to repeated prolonged exposure in the absence of photosensitizing factors, and reactions requiring photosensitizing factors such as photosensitizing agents and certain diseases. With restricted reference to skin tissue, it does not include photosensitivity of the eye to light, as in photophobia or photosensitive epilepsy.
synonyms: photodermatitides; photodermatitis; photosensitivity disorder; photosensitization; disorder, photosensitivity; disorders, photosensitivity; photodermatosis

label: phobic disorder
definition: An anxiety disorder characterized by an intense, irrational fear of an object, activity, or situation. The individual seeks to avoid the object, activity, or situation. In adults, the individual recognizes that the fear is excessive or unreasonable.
synonyms: phobia

label: phlebitis
definition: Inflammation of a vein.
synonyms: vein inflammation; inflammation of vein

label: pharynx neoplasm
definition: A neoplasm (disease) that involves the pharynx.

label: pharynx cancer

label: pharyngitis
definition: Inflammation of the throat most often caused by viral and bacterial infections. Other causes include allergens, chemical substances, and trauma.
synonyms: Sore throat; inflamed throat; inflammation of throat; throat inflammation

label: pharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma
definition: A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the pharynx.

label: phagocytic cell dysfunction

label: phagocyte bactericidal dysfunction
definition: Disorders in which phagocytic cells cannot kill ingested bacteria; characterized by frequent recurring infection with formulation of granulomas.

label: phacogenic glaucoma
definition: Secondary glaucoma caused by either excessive size or spheric shape of the lens.
synonyms: phacomorphic glaucoma

label: pervasive developmental disorder
definition: A category of developmental disorders characterized by impaired communication and socialization skills. The impairments are incongruent with the individual's developmental level or mental age. These disorders can be associated with general medical or genetic conditions.
synonyms: pervasive development disorder

label: personality disorder
definition: A diverse category of psychiatric disorders characterized by behavior that deviates markedly from the expectations of the individual's culture; this pattern of deviation is pervasive and inflexible and is stable over time. The behavioral pattern negatively interferes with relationships and work.
synonyms: personality disorder (disease); character disorder; personality disorder

label: persistent tachypnoe of infancy
definition: A interstial lung disease characterized by the presence of persistent or intermittent tachypnea (usually noticed in neonatal period or after an acute infection for the first time in first months of life), crackles in 86 %, retractions in 82%, failure to thrive in 66%, chest wall abnormalities in 22% and hypoxemia or desaturation in 88%.
synonyms: PTI

label: peroxisomal single enzyme/protein defect
definition: Any peroxisomal disease in which the cause of the disease is a defect in a single enyme or protein.
synonyms: peroxisomal single enzyme/protein defect

label: peroxisomal disease
definition: A group of congenital disorders of lipid metabolism, caused by loss of the normal peroxisomes. Signs and symptoms include developmental delays, intellectual disability, characteristic facial dysmorphic features, hepatomegaly, and hypotonia.
synonyms: peroxisomal disorder; peroxisomal disease; peroxisomal function disorder; disorder of peroxisomal function

label: permanent congenital hypothyroidism
definition: Permanent congenital hypothyroidism is a type of congenital hypothyroidism (CH), a thyroid hormone deficiency present from birth.
subsets: mondo:nord_rare; mondo:rare; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:otar; mondo:disease_grouping

label: peritonitis
definition: Inflammation of the peritoneum due to infection by bacteria or fungi. Causes include liver disease, perforation of the gastrointestinal tract or biliary tract, and peritoneal dialysis. Patients usually present with abdominal pain and tenderness, fever, chills, and nausea and vomiting. It is an emergency medical condition that requires prompt medical attention and treatment.
synonyms: retractile mesenteritis; peritoneum inflammation; primary bacterial peritonitis; acute generalised peritonitis; inflammation of peritoneum; acute generalized peritonitis

label: peritoneum cancer
definition: A malignant neoplasm involving the peritoneum
synonyms: malignant peritoneum neoplasm; peritoneum cancer; cancer of the peritoneum; malignant peritoneal neoplasm; malignant neoplasm of peritoneum; peritoneal cavity cancer; cancer of peritoneum; peritoneal cancer

label: peritoneal solitary fibrous tumor
definition: A rare, usually benign fibroblastic neoplasm that arises from the peritoneum. It is characterized by the presence of prominent hemangiopericytoma-like vessels.

label: peritoneal serous adenocarcinoma
definition: A rare, serous adenocarcinoma that arises from the lining of the peritoneum. It affects females. The clinical behavior and pathologic characteristics are similar to the serous adenocarcinoma that arises from the ovary.
synonyms: peritoneum serous adenocarcinoma

label: peritoneal neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the peritoneal cavity. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include adenomatoid tumor and disseminated peritoneal leiomyomatosis. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include primary peritoneal carcinoma, metastatic carcinoma to the peritoneum, and malignant mesothelioma.

label: peritoneal carcinoma

label: peritoneal benign neoplasm
definition: A non-metastasizing neoplasm that arises from the peritoneal cavity. Representative examples include adenomatoid tumor and disseminated peritoneal leiomyomatosis.
synonyms: benign peritoneal neoplasm; peritoneum benign neoplasm

label: peripheral vascular disease

synonyms: disease, peripheral vascular; arterial occlusive disease; vascular disease, peripheral; peripheral vascular disorder

label: peripheral resistance to thyroid hormones
definition: Peripheral resistance to thyroid hormones may be a cause of permanent congenital hypothyroidism, a permanent thyroid hormone deficiency that is present from birth.

label: peripheral nerve schwannoma
definition: A benign, usually encapsulated slow growing tumor of the peripheral nervous system composed of Schwann cells. It recurs infrequently and only rare cases associated with malignant transformation have been reported.

label: peripheral hypothyroidism
definition: Peripheral hypothyroidism is a type of permanent congenital hypothyroidism, a permanent thyroid hormone deficiency that is present from birth, that results from peripheral defects in thyroid hormone metabolism.

label: peripheral ganglioneuroblastoma
definition: A ganglioneuroblastoma arising from the peripheral nervous system.
synonyms: peripheral ganglioneuroblastoma; peripheral nervous system ganglioneuroblastoma (disease); PNS ganglioneuroblastoma; peripheral nervous system ganglioneuroblastoma; ganglioneuroblastoma (disease) of peripheral nervous system

label: peripheral arterial disease
definition: A disorder of the arteries supplying the upper and lower extremity and the visceral organs. This includes the mesenteric arteries, the renal arteries and the aorta and excludes cerebrovascular arterial disease. Patients experience cramping and pain usually in the calves and thighs while walking. The symptoms subside with rest.
synonyms: peripheral arterial disorder; pad

label: periostitis
definition: Inflammation of the periosteum. The condition is generally chronic, and is marked by tenderness and swelling of the bone and an aching pain. Acute periostitis is due to infection, is characterized by diffuse suppuration, severe pain, and constitutional symptoms, and usually results in necrosis. (Dorland, 27th ed)
synonyms: inflammation of periosteum; periosteum inflammation; periosteum; periostitis; periostitis (disease)

label: periodontal disorder
definition: An inflammatory process of the gingival tissues and/or periodontal membrane of the teeth, resulting in an abnormally deep gingival sulcus, possibly producing periodontal pockets and loss of alveolar bone support.
synonyms: periodontium disease or disorder; disorder of periodontium; disease or disorder of periodontium; periodontal disease; disease of periodontium; disease of supporting structures of teeth; periodontium disease; periodontal disorder; periodontium disorder

label: periodic paralysis
synonyms: periodic paralysis (disease); periodic paralysis

label: periodic fever syndrome
definition: Fevers of unknown etiology recurring over months or years.

label: perineurioma
definition: A usually benign perineurioma not associated with a nerve, arising from the soft tissues.
synonyms: perineurioma
subsets: mondo:nord_rare; mondo:otar; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:rare

label: perinatal disease
definition: A condition affecting an unborn or newly born individual, where the perinatal period is defined in humans as commencing at 22 completed weeks (154 days) of gestation and ending seven completed days after birth. Other, broader definitions of perinatal period cover five months before birth to one month after birth.
synonyms: perinatal disorder; perinatal condition

label: pericytic neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from the perivascular cells of the connective and soft tissues. It is characterized by the presence of pericytes that grow in a circumferential pattern around vessels.
synonyms: Pericytic tumour; Pericytic tumor; perivascular tumor; perivascular tumour; perivascular neoplasm; Pericytic neoplasm

label: perichondritis of auricle
definition: An otitis externa involving infection of the tissue surrounding the cartilage of the earlobe (pinna), ear canal, or both. It may be caused by injury, burns, insect bites, ear piercing, or a boil on the ear. The common bacterial causative agent is Pseudomonas aeruginosa. Symptoms include redness, pain, fever, swelling of the earlobe and pus accumulation between the cartilage and the layer of connective tissue around it.
synonyms: perichondritis of pinna, unspecified; perichondritis and chondritis of pinna; perichondritis of pinna

label: pericardium disorder
definition: A disease involving the pericardium.
synonyms: pericardium disease or disorder; disease or disorder of pericardium; disease of pericardium; pericardium disease; disorder of pericardium

label: pericardium cancer
definition: A malignant neoplasm involving the pericardium.
synonyms: malignant neoplasm of the pericardium; pericardium cancer; malignant pericardial neoplasm; malignant tumour of the pericardium; malignant pericardial tumour; malignant pericardium neoplasm; malignant tumor of pericardium; malignant tumour of pericardium; malignant neoplasm of pericardium; malignant tumor of the pericardium; malignant pericardial tumor; cancer of pericardium

label: pericarditis
definition: An inflammatory process affecting the pericardium.
synonyms: pericarditis (disease); inflammation of pericardium; pericardium inflammation; pericarditis

label: pericardial effusion
definition: Fluid collection within the pericardial sac, usually due to inflammation.
synonyms: pericardial effusion; pericardial fluid; fluid, pericardial; pericardial effusion (disease)

label: periapical periodontitis
definition: Inflammation of the periapical tissue. It includes general, unspecified, or acute nonsuppurative inflammation. Chronic nonsuppurative inflammation is periapical granuloma. Suppurative inflammation is periapical abscess.
synonyms: apical periodontitis

label: perceptual disorders
definition: Cognitive disorders characterized by an impaired ability to perceive the nature of objects or concepts through use of the sense organs. These include spatial neglect syndromes, where an individual does not attend to visual, auditory, or sensory stimuli presented from one side of the body.

label: peptic ulcer disease
definition: A digestive system disease characterized by discontinuation in the inner lining of the gastrointestinal (GI) tract because of gastric acid secretion or pepsin.
synonyms: acute peptic ulcer with haemorrhage and perforation; acute peptic ulcer with hemorrhage and perforation; acute peptic ulcer with haemorrhage; acute peptic ulcer without haemorrhage and without perforation; acute peptic ulcer with hemorrhage; acute peptic ulcer without hemorrhage and without perforation; peptic ulcer

label: pentasomy
definition: A chromosomal disorder consisting of the presence of three chromosomes of the same type in addition to the normal diploid number.

label: penis verrucous carcinoma
definition: A slow growing, locally recurring, very well differentiated papillary squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the penis. It is characterized by the presence of acanthosis and hyperkeratosis. The neoplastic infiltrate extends into the underlying stroma with a pushing border. Koilocytotic atypia is not present.
synonyms: verrucous carcinoma of the penis; verrucous squamous carcinoma of the penis; verrucous carcinoma of penis; penis verrucous carcinoma; squamous carcinoma of the penis, verrucous type; verrucous penile carcinoma; verrucous squamous carcinoma of penis; verrucous penile squamous carcinoma; squamous carcinoma of penis, verrucous type

label: penile neoplasm
definition: A benign, borderline, or malignant neoplasm that affects the penis. Representative examples include penile hemangioma, penile intraepithelial neoplasia, and penile carcinoma.
synonyms: tumour of penis; penile tumour; penile neoplasm; tumour of the penis; penile neoplasms; penis neoplasm; penis tumour; tumor of the penis; neoplasm of the penis; penile tumor; tumor of penis; neoplasm of penis; penis neoplasm (disease); penis tumor

label: penile disorder
definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the penis. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include phimosis, balanitis, and hypospadias. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include hemangioma, penile intraepithelial neoplasia, and penile carcinoma.
synonyms: disorder of penis; penile disorder; penis disease; disease of penis; penile disease; penis disease or disorder; disease or disorder of penis

label: penile carcinoma
definition: A carcinoma that arises from epithelial cells of the penis
synonyms: carcinoma of the penis; carcinoma of penis; penile carcinoma; penis carcinoma

label: penile cancer
definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm that affects the penis. Representative examples include penile carcinoma and penile sarcoma.
synonyms: Ca penis; malignant tumour of the penis; malignant penis neoplasm; malignant tumor of penis; malignant penile tumor; malignant tumour of penis; malignant tumor of the penis; penile Ca; cancer of penis; penis cancer; malignant penile neoplasm; malignant neoplasm of body of penis; malignant penile tumour; malignant neoplasm of penis; malignant neoplasm of the penis; penile cancer

label: pemphigus
definition: Pemphigus is a group of rare autoimmune diseases that cause blistering of the skin and mucous membranes (mouth, nose, throat, eyes, and genitals).This conditioncan occur at any age, but often strikes people in middle or older age. Studies have shown that some populations may be at greater risk for certain types of pemphigus. For instance, people of Jewish descent and those from India, Southeast Europe, and the Middle East are at greater risk for pemphigus vulargis, while pemphigus foliaceus is more common in North America, Turkey, and South America. Pemphigus is a chronic disease which is best controlled by early diagnosis and treatment.Treatment includes steroids to reduce inflammation,drugs that suppress the immune system responseand antibiotics to treat associated infections. There are four main types of pemphigus: Pemphigus vulgaris Pemphigus foliaceus IgA pemphigus Paraneoplastic pemphigus
crossreferences: MESH:D010392; ICD9:694.4; UMLS:C0030807; icd11.foundation:191659986; NCIT:C34909; DOID:9182; Wikipedia:Pemphigus; NANDO:1200228; EFO:1000749; ICD10CM:L10; GARD:7352; SCTID:65172003; MEDGEN:45369

label: pelvic inflammatory disease
definition: Pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) is an acute or chronic inflammation in the pelvic cavity. It is most commonly caused by sexually transmitted diseases, including chlamydia and gonorrhea that have ascended into the uterus, fallopian tubes, or ovaries as a result of intercourse or childbirth, or of surgical procedures, including insertion of IUDs or abortion. PID may be either symptomatic or asymptomatic. It may cause infertility and it may raise the risk of ectopic pregnancy. PID is a disease associated with HIV infection.
synonyms: pelvic inflammatory disease; PID

label: peeling skin syndrome
definition: Peeling skin syndrome (PSS) refers to a group of rare autosomal recessive forms of ichthyosis that is characterized clinically by superficial, asymptomatic, spontaneous peeling of the skin and histologically by a shedding of the outer layers of the epidermis. PSS presents with either an acral (acral PSS) or a generalized distribution (generalized PSS type A (non inflammatory) or B (inflammatory)). Some cases remain difficult to classify, suggesting that there could be additional subtypes of PSS.
synonyms: idiopathic deciduous skin; PSS; deciduous skin; peeling skin disease; keratosis exfoliativa congenita; familial continuous skin peeling syndrome
subsets: mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:rare; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:otar; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders

label: pediatric ovarian germ cell tumor
definition: A germ cell tumor that arises from the ovary and occurs in children.
synonyms: childhood ovarian germ cell tumor; ovarian germ cell tumour of childhood; childhood ovarian germ cell tumour; paediatric ovarian germ cell neoplasm; ovarian germ cell tumor of childhood; childhood ovarian germ cell neoplasm; pediatric ovarian germ cell neoplasm; pediatric ovarian germ cell tumor

label: pediatric osteosarcoma
definition: An osteosarcoma occurring in childhood.
synonyms: childhood osteosarcoma; childhood osteogenic sarcoma; childhood osteosarcoma (disease); osteosarcoma (disease) of childhood; pediatric osteosarcoma (disease); pediatric osteosarcoma; paediatric osteosarcoma (disease)

label: pediatric meningioma
definition: A meningioma that occurs during childhood.
synonyms: paediatric meningioma (disease); pediatric meningioma (disease); pediatric meningioma; childhood meningioma (disease); childhood meningioma; meningioma (disease) of childhood

label: pediatric lymphoma
definition: A Hodgkin or non-Hodgkin lymphoma that occurs during childhood.
synonyms: childhood lymphoma; pediatric lymphoma

label: pediatric fibrosarcoma
definition: A malignant neoplasm arising from the deep soft tissues in children. It is characterized by the presence of spindle-shaped fibroblasts and collagenous stroma formation in a herringbone growth pattern.
synonyms: pediatric fibrosarcoma; childhood fibrosarcoma

label: pediatric cerebral ependymoblastoma
definition: An embryonal tumor with multilayered rosettes, C19MC-altered that arises from the cerebral hemispheres and occurs in children.
synonyms: childhood cerebral ependymoblastoma; childhood cerebral embryonal tumour with Multilayered Rosettes, C19MC-altered; childhood cerebral embryonal tumor with Multilayered Rosettes, C19MC-altered

label: pediatric acute respiratory distress syndrome
definition: Acute respiratory distress syndromet that occurs in pediatric patients and includes findings of new infiltrates (unilateral or bilateral) consistent with acute parenchymal disease, edema not fully explained by fluid overload or cardiac failure, and may present as new acute lung disease in setting of chronic lung disease and/or heart disease, and perinatal lung disease is excluded.
synonyms: PARDS

label: pathologic nystagmus
definition: Involuntary movements of the eyeballs. The presence or absence of nystagmus is often used in the diagnosis of a variety of neurological and visual disorders.

label: partial trisomy of the long arm of chromosome 5
definition: Chromosome 5q duplication is a chromosome abnormality that occurs when there is an extra copy of genetic material on the long arm (q) of chromosome 5. The severity of the condition and the signs and symptoms depend on the size and location of the duplication and which genes are involved. Features that often occur in people with chromosome 5q duplication include developmental delay, intellectual disability, behavioral problems and distinctive facial features. Chromosome 5q duplication can be de novo or inherited from a parent with a chromosomal rearrangement such as a balanced translocation. Treatment is based on the signs and symptoms present in each person.
synonyms: partial trisomy of chromosome 5q; partial trisomy of the long arm of chromosome type 5; partial duplication of the long arm of chromosome 5; partial duplication of chromosome 5q

definition: Chromosome 8p duplication is a chromosome abnormality that occurs when there is an extra copy of genetic material on the short arm (p) of chromosome 8. The severity of the condition and the signs and symptoms depend on the size and location of the duplication and which genes are involved. Features that often occur in people with chromosome 8p duplication include developmental delay, intellectual disability, behavioral problems and distinctive facial features. Most cases are not inherited, but people can pass the duplication on to their children. Treatment is based on the signs and symptoms present in each person.

definition: Chromosome 6p duplication is a chromosome abnormality that occurs when there is an extra copy of genetic material on the short arm (p) of chromosome 6. Features that often occur in people with chromosome 6p duplication include developmental delay, intellectual disability, behavioral problems and distinctive facial features. Treatment is based on the signs and symptoms present in each person.
