label: partial duplication of the long arm of chromosome X
definition: Chromosome Xq duplication is a chromosome abnormality that affects many different parts of the body. People with this condition have an extra copy of the genetic material located on the long arm (q) of the X chromosome in each cell. The severity of the condition and the associated signs and symptoms vary based on the size and location of theduplication;the genes involved; and the sex of the affected person. In general, males are typically more severely affected than females and often experience intellectual disability, developmental delay, short stature, abnormalities of the reproductive organs, anddistinctive craniofacial features. Many females with this duplication do not have any symptoms or are only affected with short stature; however, some may be just as severely affected as males with the condition. Most cases are inherited in an X-linked manner, often from a mother with no signs or symptoms of the condition. Treatment is based on the signs and symptoms present in each person.
synonyms: partial trisomy of chromosome Xq; partial trisomy of the long arm of chromosome X; partial duplication of chromosome Xq; partial duplication of the long arm of chromosome type X

label: partial duplication of the long arm of chromosome 6
definition: Chromosome 6q duplication is a chromosome abnormality that occurs when there is an extra copy of genetic material on the long arm (q) of chromosome 6. The severity of the condition and the signs and symptoms depend on the size and location of the duplication and which genes are involved. Features that often occur in people with chromosome 6q duplication include developmental delay, intellectual disability, behavioral problems and distinctive facial features. In most cases, chromosome 6q duplication occurs de novo or is inherited from a parent with a chromosomal rearrangement such as a balanced translocation. Rarely, it is inherited from a parent with the same duplication. Treatment is based on the signs and symptoms present in each person.

label: partial duplication of the long arm of chromosome 4
definition: Chromosome 4q duplication is a chromosome abnormality characterized by an extra copy (duplication) of genetic material on the long arm (q) of chromosome 4. The severity and specific symptoms depend on the size and location of the duplication, and which genes are involved. Features that have been described in some people with chromosome 4q duplication include developmental delay, intellectual disability, behavioral problems, birth defects, and distinctive facial features. Most cases are inherited from an unaffected parent with a chromosomal rearrangement called a balanced translocation. Some cases are not inherited and occur sporadically. Treatment is based on the signs and symptoms present in each person.

label: partial duplication of the long arm of chromosome 15
definition: Chromosome 15q duplication is a chromosome abnormality that occurs when an extra (duplicate) copy of the genetic material located on the long arm (q) of chromosome 15 is present in each cell. The severity of the condition and the associated signs and symptoms vary based on the size and location of the duplication and which genes are involved. Common features shared by many people with this duplication include developmental delay; intellectual disability; hypotonia (low muscle tone); seizures ; high and/or cleft palate (roof of the mouth); scoliosis ; slow growth; communication difficulties; behavioral problems; and distinctive facial features. Most cases are not inherited, although affected people can pass the duplication on to their children. Treatment is based on the signs and symptoms present in each person.

label: paronychia
definition: An acute or chronic infection of the soft tissues around the nail. Symptoms include pain, tenderness, erythema, and swelling around the nail. Acute infection results from minor trauma to the fingertip and Staphylococcus aureus is usually the causative agent. Chronic infection is usually caused by Candida albicans.
synonyms: onychia and paronychia of finger; fungal nail infection; infected nailfold; paronychia (disease); paronychia; onychia and paronychia of toe

label: parneoplastic endocrine syndrome
definition: Paraneoplastic syndrome that involves the endocrine system.

label: parkinsonian disorder
definition: A group of disorders which feature impaired motor control characterized by bradykinesia, MUSCLE RIGIDITY; TREMOR; and postural instability. Parkinsonian diseases are generally divided into primary parkinsonism (see PARKINSON DISEASE), secondary parkinsonism (see PARKINSON DISEASE, SECONDARY) and inherited forms. These conditions are associated with dysfunction of dopaminergic or closely related motor integration neuronal pathways in the BASAL GANGLIA.

label: parathyroid gland adenoma
definition: A benign tumor arising from the parenchymal cells of the parathyroid glands. In the vast majority of cases, the tumor involves a single parathyroid gland. It is associated with the symptoms of primary hyperparathyroidism, resulting from the excessive production of parathyroid hormone. It is usually surrounded by a well-defined capsule. Capsular invasion, vascular invasion, and perineural invasion are absent.
synonyms: parathyroid gland adenoma; adenoma of parathyroid; adenoma of the parathyroid; adenoma of parathyroid gland; adenoma of the parathyroid gland; parathyroid adenoma

label: paratesticular lipoma
definition: A rare benign adipose tissue neoplasm of the paratesticular tissues. It is incidentally discovered and presents as a non-tender scrotal mass. It affects patients over a wide age range.
synonyms: paratesticular lipoma

label: paratenonitis
definition: Inflammation of the outer layer of the tendon (paratenon) alone, whether or not the paratenon is lined by synovium.

definition: A disease caused by infection with Ichthyosporea.

label: parapsoriasis
definition: Parapsoriasis describes a group ofskin diseases that can be characterized by scaly patches or slightly elevated papules and/or plaques (red, scaly patches) that have a resemblance to psoriasis. However, this description includes several inflammatory cutaneous diseases that are unrelated with respect to pathogenesis, histopathology, and response to treatment. Because of the variation in clinical presentation and a lack of a specific diagnostic finding on histopathology, a uniformly accepted definition of parapsoriasis remains lacking. There are 2 general forms: a small plaque type, which is usually benign, and a large plaque type, which is a precursor of cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (CTCL).Treatment of small plaque parapsoriasis is unnecessary but can include emollients, topical tar preparations or corticosteroids, and/or phototherapy. Treatment of large plaque parapsoriasis is phototherapy or topical corticosteroids.
crossreferences: DOID:9088; ICD10CM:L41; MESH:D010267; NCIT:C3312; SCTID:88233000; ICD9:696.2; UMLS:C0030491; Wikipedia:Parapsoriasis; MEDGEN:10579; EFO:1000747

label: paraplegia
definition: Complete paralysis of the lower half of the body including both legs, often caused by damage to the spinal cord.
synonyms: paraplegia, lower

label: paraphilic disorder
definition: Disorders that include recurrent, intense sexually arousing fantasies, sexual urges, or behaviors generally involving nonhuman objects, suffering of oneself or partners, or children or other nonconsenting partners. (from DSM-V)
synonyms: disorder, Paraphilic; paraphilic disorder; disorders, Paraphilic; paraphilia disorder; disorder of sexual preference

label: paraneoplastic syndrome
definition: A classification for rare disorders of diverse organ systems (endocrine, neuromuscular, gastrointestinal, renal, dermatologic, rheumatologic, hematologic) that are affected by substances secreted by a distant neoplasm but not by the action of the neoplasm itself metastasizing to that organ or tissue. Less than 1 % of neoplasms are associated with these syndromes. An immune-mediated response to neoplasm-elaborated proteins may be the cause of these syndromes. Additionally, their manifestation may signal the presence of an occult neoplasm, potentially at an earlier stage of disease thereby leading to a better clinical outcome. Constitutional signs may include fever, night sweats, anorexia and cachexia. Clinical course is usually progressive. Prognosis is variable depending on the effective treatment of the underlying neoplasm.
synonyms: paraneoplastic syndrome

label: paraneoplastic renal syndrome
definition: Paraneoplastic syndrome that involves the renal system.

label: paraneoplastic neurologic syndrome
definition: A paraneoplastic syndrome that involves the nervous system.
synonyms: paraneoplastic syndrome of nervous system; PCD; nervous system paraneoplastic syndrome; PNS
subsets: mondo:rare; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:otar; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:disease_grouping

label: paraneoplastic limbic encephalitis
definition: A rare disorder characterized by degenerative changes in the limbic area of the brain. Causes include infections and autoimmune conditions; it may also manifest as a paraneoplastic syndrome, most often caused by small cell lung carcinoma. Signs and symptoms include behavioral changes, hallucinations and dementia.

label: paraneoplastic hematological syndrome
definition: Paraneoplastic syndrome that involves the hematopoietic system.

label: paraneoplastic cutaneous syndrome
definition: Paraneoplastic syndrome that involves the integumental system.

definition: A rare adenoid cystic carcinoma that arises from the paranasal sinuses. It usually has an aggressive clinical course characterized by high recurrence rates and distant metastases.
synonyms: paranasal sinus adenoid cystic carcinoma; adenoid cystic carcinoma of the paranasal sinus; adenoid cystic carcinoma of the accessory sinus; accessory sinus adenoid cystic carcinoma; adenoid cystic carcinoma of accessory sinus; adenoid cystic carcinoma of paranasal sinus

label: paranasal sinus Schneiderian papilloma
definition: A papilloma that arises from the ciliated respiratory mucosa that lines the paranasal sinuses. It is classified as inverted papilloma and oncocytic papilloma.
synonyms: paranasal sinus Schneiderian papilloma

label: paralytic poliomyelitis
definition: A poliomyelitis that results in destruction located in motor neurons of central nervous system, has material basis in Human poliovirus 1, has material basis in Human poliovirus 2, or has material basis in Human poliovirus 3, which are transmitted by ingestion of food or water contaminated with feces, or transmitted by direct contact with the oral secretions. The infection has symptom loss of reflexes, has symptom muscle spasms, and has symptom acute flaccid paralysis.

label: parainfluenza virus type 3 infectious disease
definition: Parainfluenza virus type 3 is one of a group of common viruses known as human parainfluenza viruses (HPIV) that cause a variety of respiratory illnesses. Symptoms usually develop between 2 and 7 days from the time of exposure and typically resolve in 7-10 days. Symptoms may include fever, runny nose, and cough. HPIV-3 can also cause bronchiolitis, bronchitis, and pneumonia. Infants and young children are particularly susceptible to HPIV-3 infections, though older adults and those with a weakened immune system are also at risk for complications. HPIVs are usually spread from an infected person to others through coughing, sneezing, and/or touching. There is currently no vaccine to protect against parainfluenza virus infections. Most HPIV infections resolve on their own and do not require special treatment, though medical intervention may be necessary for severe breathing problems. Most adults have antibodies against parainfluenza but can get repeat infections.
synonyms: human respirovirus 3 infectious disease; human respirovirus 3 disease or disorder; infection due to human parainfluenza virus 3; human respirovirus 3 caused disease or disorder

label: parainfluenza infectious disease
definition: A disease caused by infection with parainfluenza virus. There are four serotypes which cause respiratory illnesses in children and adults.
synonyms: HPIV infectious disorder; parainfluenza infectious disorder; parainfluenza (disorder)

label: paraganglioma
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm arising from paraganglia located along the sympathetic or parasympathetic nerves. Infrequently, it may arise outside the usual distribution of the sympathetic and parasympathetic paraganglia. Tumors arising from the adrenal gland medulla are called pheochromocytomas. Morphologically, paragangliomas usually display a nesting (Zellballen) growth pattern. There are no reliable morphologic criteria to distinguish between benign and malignant paragangliomas. The only definitive indicator of malignancy is the presence of regional or distant metastases.
synonyms: tumor of paraganglion; paraganglion tumor; paragangliomas; tumor of the paraganglion; neoplasm of paraganglion; tumour of paraganglion; paraganglion neoplasm; Paraganglionic tumor; paraganglion tumour; Paraganglionic neoplasm; paraganglioma; tumour of the paraganglion; Paraganglionic tumour; neoplasm of the paraganglion
crossreferences: ONCOTREE:PGNG; OMIMPS:168000; MEDGEN:10571; ICD9:239.7; DOID:0050773; EFO:1000453; UMLS:C0030421; NCIT:C3308; MESH:D010235; SCTID:127027008; ICDO:8680/1

label: parachordoma
definition: A rare, usually benign myoepithelial tumor characterized by the presence of epithelioid, often vacuolated neoplastic cells. Most patients present with painless swelling in the subcutaneous or subfascial soft tissues of the extremities.
synonyms: parachordoma

label: papillomatosis
definition: Glandular or squamous cell neoplastic proliferations characterized by the formation of multiple papillary structures diffusely involving a specific anatomic site.
synonyms: papillomatosis

label: papilloma
definition: A benign epithelial neoplasm that projects above the surrounding epithelial surface and consists of villous or arborescent outgrowths of fibrovascular stroma.
synonyms: papilloma (except papilloma of bladder M-81201) (morphologic abnormality); papilloma; papilloma, benign

label: papillary urothelial neoplasm
definition: A neoplastic lesion of the urinary tract transitional cell epithelium characterized by papillary formations. -- 2003
synonyms: urinary tract papillary transitional cell neoplasm; papillary transitional cell neoplasm of the urinary tract; urothelium papillary epithelial neoplasm; papillary urothelial neoplasm

label: papillary transitional cell carcinoma
definition: A non-invasive or invasive transitional cell carcinoma characterized by a papillary growth pattern. It may occur in the bladder or the renal pelvis.
synonyms: papillary transitional carcinoma; papillary transitional cell carcinoma (morphologic abnormality); papillary transitional cell carcinoma

label: papillary squamous carcinoma
definition: A well differentiated squamous cell carcinoma characterized by a papillary, exophytic growth pattern and hyperkeratosis. The most commonly affected anatomic sites are the larynx, penis, cervix, vagina, and vulva.
synonyms: papillary squamous carcinoma; papillary epidermoid cell carcinoma; papillary epidermoid carcinoma; papillary squamous cell carcinoma

label: papillary meningioma
definition: A WHO grade III meningioma characterized by the predominance of a perivascular pseudopapillary pattern.
synonyms: papillary meningioma

label: papillary epithelial neoplasm
synonyms: papillary epithelial neoplasm

label: papillary eccrine carcinoma
synonyms: papillary eccrine carcinoma; papillary eccrine adenoma; tubular apocrine adenoma; papillary apocrine fibroadenoma

label: papillary cystic neoplasm
definition: A benign, malignant, or borderline neoplasm characterized by the presence of papillary mucinous, serous, or clear cell structures and cystic structures.
synonyms: papillary cystic tumor; papillary cystic tumour; papillary cystic neoplasm

label: papillary cystadenoma
definition: A serous or mucinous benign or low malignant potential cystic epithelial neoplasm. It is characterized by the presence of glandular epithelial cells forming papillary structures.
synonyms: papillary cystadenoma; cystadenoma, papillary, benign

label: papillary cystadenocarcinoma
definition: A malignant cystic serous or mucinous epithelial neoplasm characterized by the presence of malignant glandular epithelial cells forming papillary structures. Stromal invasion is present.
synonyms: cystadenocarcinoma, papillary, malignant; papillary cystadenocarcinoma; papillary cystadenocarcinoma (morphologic abnormality); papillary cystadenocarcinoma, NOS (morphologic abnormality)

label: papillary conjunctivitis
definition: Conjunctivitis that is characterized by the formation of papillae on the palpebral conjunctiva.

label: papillary carcinoma of the penis
definition: A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the penis and is characterized by the presence of a papillary growth pattern.
synonyms: papillary penile carcinoma; papillary squamous carcinoma of penis; squamous carcinoma of the penis, papillary type; papillary penile squamous carcinoma; papillary carcinoma of penis; penis papillary carcinoma; papillary carcinoma of the penis; squamous carcinoma of penis, papillary type; papillary squamous carcinoma of the penis

label: papillary carcinoma
definition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm characterized by a papillary growth pattern. A papillary carcinoma may be composed of glandular cells (papillary adenocarcinoma), squamous cells (papillary squamous cell carcinoma), or transitional cells (papillary transitional cell carcinoma). Bladder carcinoma is a representative example of papillary transitional cell carcinoma.
synonyms: papillary carcinoma (morphologic abnormality); papillary carcinoma; papillary carcinoma NOS (morphologic abnormality)

label: papillary adenoma
definition: An adenoma characterized by the presence of papillary epithelial patterns.
synonyms: adenoma, papillary, benign; papillary adenoma NOS (morphologic abnormality); papillary adenoma

label: papillary adenocarcinoma
definition: A morphologic variant of adenocarcinoma. It is characterized by the presence of a papillary growth pattern. Representative examples include thyroid gland papillary carcinoma, invasive papillary breast carcinoma, and ovarian serous surface papillary adenocarcinoma.
synonyms: papillary adenocarcinoma NOS (morphologic abnormality); papillary adenocarcinoma; adenocarcinoma, papillary, malignant; papillary adenocarcinoma (morphologic abnormality)
crossreferences: ICDO:8260/3; NCIT:C2853; DOID:3112; UMLS:C0001420; MEDGEN:123; MESH:D000231

label: panuveitis
definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation of the entire uvea which includes the iris, ciliary body, and choroid. Causes include systemic infections, sarcoidosis, and cancers.
synonyms: total uveitis; panuveitis (disease); panuveitis; diffuse uveitis

label: panniculitis
definition: Inflammation of the subcutaneous adipose tissue.
synonyms: Subcutaneous adipose tissue; Subcutaneous tissue; subcutaneous adipose tissue inflammation; subcutis; inflammation of subcutaneous adipose tissue
crossreferences: ICD9:729.39; UMLS:C0030326; ICD9:729.30; SCTID:22125009; NCIT:C33645; Wikipedia:Panniculitis; DOID:1526; ICD9:729.3; icd11.foundation:1056888958; EFO:1000746; MESH:D015434; MEDGEN:45301

label: panic disorder
definition: An anxiety disorder characterized by multiple unexpected panic attacks with persistent concern of recurring attacks. Panic disorder may or may not be accompanied by agoraphobia.
synonyms: panic anxiety syndrome

label: pancreatitis
definition: Inflammation of the pancreas.
synonyms: pancreas inflammation; inflammation of pancreas

label: pancreatic serous cystic neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant epithelial neoplasm that is usually cystic and arises from the exocrine pancreas. It is characterized by the presence of neoplastic epithelial cells that produce fluid similar to serum. Representative examples include serous cystadenoma and serous cystadenocarcinoma.
synonyms: pancreatic serous neoplasm; pancreatic serous cystic neoplasm

label: pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor G1
definition: A low grade well differentiated tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the pancreas. The mitotic count is less than 2 per 10 HPF and/or the Ki67 index is equal or less than 2%.
synonyms: pancreas carcinoid tumour; pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor G1; grade 1 neuroendocrine neoplasm of pancreas; pancreas neuroendocrine neoplasm G1; pancreas NET G1; pancreas carcinoid tumor; pancreas neuroendocrine tumor, well differentiated, low grade; pancreatic NET G1

label: pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor
definition: Pancreatic endocrine tumor, also known as pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor (PNET), describes a group of endocrine tumors originating in the pancreas that are usually indolent and benign, but may have the potential to be malignant. They can be functional, exhibiting a hormonal hypersecretion syndrome, but can be non-functional presenting with non-specific symptoms and include insulinoma, glucagonoma, VIPoma, somatostatinoma (SSoma), PPoma and Zollinger-Ellison syndrome (ZES, or gastrinoma) and other ectopic hormone producing tumors (such as GRFoma).

label: pancreatic neuroendocrine neoplasm
definition: A neoplasm with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the pancreas. It includes neuroendocrine tumors (low and intermediate grade) and neuroendocrine carcinomas (high grade).
synonyms: endocrine pancreas neoplasm; endocrine pancreas neoplasm (disease); malignant tumor of endocrine pancreas; endocrine pancreas tumor; endocrine pancreas tumour; tumour of endocrine pancreas; pancreatic neuroendocrine neoplasm; pancreatic endocrine neoplasm; tumor of endocrine pancreas; PNEN; pancreatic NEN; malignant tumour of endocrine pancreas; neoplasm of endocrine pancreas

label: pancreatic neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm involving the pancreas.
synonyms: pancreas neoplasm (disease); pancreas tumour; tumour of pancreas; tumor of the pancreas; tumour of the pancreas; pancreas tumor; neoplasm of the pancreas; pancreatic tumor; tumor of pancreas; neoplasm of pancreas; pancreas neoplasm; pancreatic tumour; pancreatic neoplasm
crossreferences: SCTID:126859007; UMLS:C0030297; NCIT:C3305; ONCOTREE:PANCREAS; MESH:D010190; MEDGEN:18279; EFO:0003860

label: pancreatic mucinous cystadenocarcinoma
definition: A mucinous cystadenocarcinoma that involves the pancreas.
synonyms: mucinous Cystadencarcinoma of pancreas; pancreatic colloidal Cystadencarcinoma; colloid Cystadencarcinoma of pancreas; colloid Cystadencarcinoma of the pancreas; pancreatic mucinous cystadenocarcinoma; colloidal Cystadencarcinoma of the pancreas; pancreatic colloid Cystadencarcinoma; colloidal Cystadencarcinoma of pancreas; mucinous Cystadencarcinoma of the pancreas

label: pancreatic intraductal papillary-mucinous neoplasm
definition: A usually slow-growing epithelial neoplasm with ductal differentiation that arises from the exocrine pancreas and grows mostly within the pancreatic ducts. Grossly, it is characterized by the presence of intraductal masses. Morphologically, there is proliferation of mucin-producing cells within the pancreatic ducts, intraductal accumulation of mucin, and a papillary growth pattern. It may be associated with the presence of an invasive carcinoma. It usually occurs in older patients. Signs and symptoms include epigastric pain, weight loss, jaundice, chronic pancreatitis, and diabetes mellitus.
synonyms: pancreatic intraductal papillary-mucinous tumour; pancreatic intraductal papillary-mucinous tumor; pancreatic IPMN; IPMN; pancreatic intraductal papillary-mucinous neoplasm

label: pancreatic gastrin-producing neuroendocrine tumor
definition: A usually malignant gastrin-producing neuroendocrine tumor arising from the pancreas. It may or may not be associated with inappropriate secretion of gastrin and an associated clinical syndrome.
synonyms: gastrin-producing neuroendocrine tumor of pancreas; pancreas gastrin-producing neuroendocrine tumour; pancreatic gastrin producing tumor; pancreas gastrin-producing neuroendocrine tumor; pancreatic gastrin-producing neuroendocrine tumor; pancreatic gastrin producing NET; pancreatic G-cell tumor; pancreatic gastrin producing tumour; gastrin-producing neuroendocrine tumour of pancreas; pancreatic G-cell tumour

label: pancreatic exocrine neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that arises from the epithelial cells of the exocrine pancreatic tissue.
synonyms: pancreatic exocrine neoplasm; exocrine pancreas neoplasm (disease); neoplasm of the exocrine pancreas; neoplasm of exocrine pancreas; pancreatic exocrine tumor; exocrine pancreas neoplasm; pancreatic exocrine tumour; tumor of the exocrine pancreas; tumour of the exocrine pancreas; exocrine pancreas tumor; exocrine pancreas tumour; tumor of exocrine pancreas; tumour of exocrine pancreas

label: pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma
definition: An infiltrating adenocarcinoma that arises from the epithelial cells of the pancreas. It affects males more often than females and the patients are usually over 50 years of age. Microscopically it is characterized by the presence of glandular (ductal) differentiation and desmoplastic stroma formation. Signs and symptoms include pain, loss of weight, and jaundice. It grows rapidly and is usually detected after it has metastasized to other anatomic sites. The prognosis is usually poor.
synonyms: pancreatic tubular adenocarcinoma; malignant neoplasm of duct of Wirsung; pancreas tubular adenocarcinoma; ductal adenocarcinoma of the pancreas; pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma; pancreatic duct cancer; pancreatic duct adenocarcinoma; ductal adenocarcinoma of pancreas; pancreatic ductal carcinoma; pancreas ductal adenocarcinoma

label: pancreatic delta cell neuroendocrine tumor
definition: A usually malignant neuroendocrine tumor arising from the delta cells of the pancreas. It may be associated with inappropriate secretion of somatostatin and an associated clinical syndrome, or it may be hormonally inactive (non-functioning).
synonyms: pancreatic delta cell neoplasm; pancreatic Delta cell NET; pancreatic Delta cell neoplasm; pancreatic Delta cell neuroendocrine tumour; pancreatic Delta cell tumor; pancreatic Delta cell tumour; pancreatic Delta cell neuroendocrine tumor

label: pancreatic cystadenoma
definition: A non-metastasizing cystic epithelial neoplasm arising from the exocrine pancreas.
synonyms: pancreatic cystadenoma; cystadenoma of pancreas; cystadenoma of the pancreas; exocrine pancreas cystadenoma

label: pancreatic cystadenocarcinoma
definition: A cystic adenocarcinoma that arises from the pancreas. It includes the acinar cell and serous cystadenocarcinoma subtypes.
synonyms: pancreatic cystadenocarcinoma; cystadenocarcinoma - pancreas; cystadenocarcinoma of pancreas; pancreas cystadenocarcinoma; cystadenocarcinoma of the pancreas

label: pancreatic adenocarcinoma
definition: A carcinoma that arises from glandular epithelial cells of the pancreas
synonyms: adenocarcinoma of the pancreas; pancreas adenocarcinoma; adenocarcinoma of pancreas; adenocarcinoma - pancreas; pancreatic adenocarcinoma
crossreferences: DOID:4074; SCTID:700423003; EFO:1000044; MEDGEN:83800; NCIT:C8294; ONCOTREE:PAAD; UMLS:C0281361

label: pancreas lymphoma
definition: A lymphoma that arises from the pancreas with the bulk of the tumor localized to this organ. The vast majority of cases are non-Hodgkin lymphomas of B-cell phenotype and include mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue lymphomas, follicular lymphomas, and diffuse large B-cell lymphomas.
synonyms: pancreas lymphoma; lymphoma of pancreas; pancreatic lymphoma; lymphoma of the pancreas

label: pancreas disorder
definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the pancreas. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include pancreatitis and pancreatic insufficiency. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include cystadenomas, carcinomas, lymphomas, and neuroendocrine neoplasms.
synonyms: disease or disorder of pancreas; disease of pancreas; pancreatic disorder; pancreas disease; pancreas disease or disorder; disorder of pancreas

label: palsy
definition: A general term most often used to describe severe or complete loss of muscle strength due to motor system disease from the level of the cerebral cortex to the muscle fiber. This term may also occasionally refer to a loss of sensory function. (From Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, p45)
synonyms: Plegias; Plegia
crossreferences: ICD10CM:G80-G83; MESH:D010243; EFO:1000631; UMLS:C3887651; MEDGEN:854494; Wikipedia:Palsy

label: palpebral nevus
definition: A melanocytic nevus that involves the skin of eyelid.
synonyms: melanocytic nevus of skin of eyelid; eyelid nevus; nevus of eyelid; nevus of the eyelid; skin of eyelid melanocytic nevus

label: palpebral epidermal tumor
definition: A neoplasm (disease) that involves the skin of eyelid.
synonyms: skin of eyelid neoplasm; tumor of skin of eyelid; tumour of skin of eyelid; skin of eyelid tumor; skin of eyelid tumour; neoplasm of skin of eyelid; skin of eyelid neoplasm (disease)

label: palmoplantar keratosis
definition: A group of autosomal dominant, autosomal recessive, X-linked inherited or acquired disorders characterized by the thickening of the palms and soles due to hyperkeratosis.
synonyms: keratosis palmaris et plantaris; palmoplantar keratoderma

label: palatal neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the hard palate, soft palate, or uvula.
synonyms: neoplasm of secondary palate; tumour of secondary palate; tumour of palate; palate tumour; tumor of the palate; tumor of palate; secondary palate tumour; palate tumor; neoplasm of the palate; palate neoplasm; tumor of secondary palate; secondary palate neoplasm; tumour of the palate; secondary palate tumor; secondary palate neoplasm (disease); neoplasm of palate

label: overnutrition
definition: An imbalanced nutritional status resulting from excessive intake of nutrients. Generally, overnutrition generates an energy imbalance between food consumption and energy expenditure leading to disorders such as obesity.

label: overgrowth syndrome
definition: A group of syndromes caused by genetic birth defects that may lead to the development of malignancies. It is characterized by a large body size or large body parts at birth, or excessive body growth early in childhood. Representative examples include neurofibromatosis, Beckwith-Wiedemann syndrome, and Sturge-Weber syndrome.
crossreferences: icd11.foundation:2113355045; MEDGEN:458929; GARD:19213; NCIT:C94828; UMLS:C2986703; Orphanet:93460

label: ovarian yolk sac tumor
definition: A usually rapidly growing malignant germ cell tumor arising from the ovary. It usually occurs in children and adolescents. Signs and symptoms include abdominal pain and a large abdominal or pelvic mass. The serum alpha-fetoprotein is almost always elevated preoperatively. Morphologically, there is marked heterogeneity due to numerous patterns of differentiation coexisting in the same tumor. The most common pattern is reticular.
synonyms: yolk Sac neoplasm of ovary; endodermal sinus neoplasm of the ovary; endodermal sinus tumor of the ovary; yolk Sac tumor of the ovary; ovarian yolk sac tumor; ovarian germ cell endodermal sinus neoplasm; endodermal sinus tumour of ovary; ovary yolk sac tumour; ovarian germ cell endodermal sinus tumour; germ cell endodermal sinus neoplasm of the ovary; germ cell endodermal sinus tumor of the ovary; ovarian germ cell endodermal sinus tumor; germ cell endodermal sinus tumor of ovary; ovary yolk sac tumor; ovarian endodermal sinus neoplasm; ovarian endodermal sinus tumour; germ cell endodermal sinus tumour of ovary; yolk Sac tumour of ovary; germ cell endodermal sinus tumour of the ovary; endodermal sinus tumour of the ovary; ovarian endodermal sinus tumor; endodermal sinus neoplasm of ovary; germ cell endodermal sinus neoplasm of ovary; ovarian yolk Sac neoplasm; yolk Sac tumour of the ovary; yolk Sac neoplasm of the ovary; endodermal sinus tumor of ovary; yolk Sac tumor of ovary
crossreferences: DOID:5350; UMLS:C0346188; EFO:1000437; SCTID:254876005; ONCOTREE:OYST; NCIT:C8107; MEDGEN:83415

label: ovarian teratoma
definition: A non-seminomatous germ cell tumor arising from the ovary. It is characterized by the presence of various tissues which correspond to the different germinal layers (endoderm, mesoderm, and ectoderm). According to the level of differentiation of the tissues which comprise the tumor, ovarian teratomas are classified as mature or immature. Mature teratomas are composed of well differentiated, adult-type tissues. Immature teratomas are composed of immature, fetal type-tissues. Mature ovarian teratomas without a fetal-type component have an excellent outcome. The prognosis of immature ovarian teratomas is related to the grade and stage of the tumor.
synonyms: ovarian germ cell teratoma; teratoma of ovary; germ cell teratoma of the ovary; germ cell teratoma of ovary; ovarian teratoma; teratoma of the ovary

label: ovarian squamous cell neoplasm
definition: A squamous cell tumor that arises from the ovary and is not associated with a germ cell tumor.
synonyms: ovarian squamous cell tumour; ovarian squamous cell neoplasm; ovary squamous cell neoplasm; ovarian squamous cell tumor

label: ovarian sex cord-stromal tumor
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that arises from the ovary and is composed of granulosa cells, Sertoli cells, Leydig cells, theca cells, and fibroblasts. Representative examples include thecoma, fibroma, Sertoli cell tumor, and granulosa cell tumor.
synonyms: Sex cord-stromal tumor of ovary; Sex cord-stromal tumour of the ovary; ovarian Sex cord-stromal tumor; ovarian Sex cord-stromal neoplasm; Sex cord-stromal tumour of ovary; sex cord-stromal tumour of ovary; sex cord-stromal tumor of ovary; ovary sex cord-stromal tumor; ovarian Sex cord-stromal tumour; Sex cord-stromal neoplasm of ovary; ovary sex cord-stromal tumour; Sex cord-stromal neoplasm of the ovary; Sex cord-stromal tumor of the ovary

label: ovarian sertoli-stromal cell tumor
definition: A sex cord-stromal tumor that arises from the ovary and is composed entirely of, or in various combinations of, Sertoli cells, Leydig cells, and fibroblast-like cells.
synonyms: Ovarian Sertoli-Stromal Tumor; Ovarian Sertoli-Stromal Cell Tumour; Ovarian Sertoli-Stromal Cell Tumor; Ovarian Sertoli-Stromal Tumour

label: ovarian serous tumor
definition: A benign, borderline, or malignant epithelial tumor of the ovary characterized by the presence of neoplastic epithelial cells that, in well differentiated tumors, resemble the epithelial cells of the fallopian tube and, in poorly differentiated tumors, show anaplastic features. Approximately thirty to fifty percent of the tumors are bilateral. Grossly, the better differentiated tumors consist of cystic masses, usually unilocular, containing a clear but sometimes viscous fluid. Papillary formations are often present. The more malignant tumors tend to be solid and invasive, with areas of necrosis and hemorrhage.
synonyms: serous tumour of the ovary; serous tumor of ovary; ovarian serous neoplasm; serous tumor of the ovary; serous neoplasm of the ovary; ovarian serous tumor; serous neoplasm of ovary; serous tumour of ovary

label: ovarian serous adenofibroma
definition: A benign neoplasm of the ovary characterized by the presence of glands with serous epithelial cells in a fibrotic stroma.
synonyms: ovarian serous adenofibroma; serous adenofibroma of ovary; ovary serous adenofibroma

label: ovarian serous adenocarcinoma
definition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the ovary and is characterized by the presence of malignant epithelial cells that, in well differentiated tumors, resemble the epithelium of the fallopian tube or, in poorly differentiated tumors, show anaplastic features and marked nuclear atypia.
synonyms: ovarian serous carcinoma; serous carcinoma of the ovary; ovarian serous adenocarcinoma; serous adenocarcinoma of ovary; ovary serous adenocarcinoma; serous carcinoma of ovary; serous adenocarcinoma of the ovary
crossreferences: DOID:0050933; DOID:5744; ONCOTREE:SOC; NCIT:C7550; UMLS:C1335177; EFO:0002917; MEDGEN:233278

label: ovarian seromucinous tumor
definition: A benign, borderline, or malignant mixed epithelial tumor of the ovary. It is characterized by the presence of more than one epithelial cell type, most often serous and endocervical-type mucinous.
synonyms: mixed epithelial tumor of the ovary; ovarian Seromucinous tumour; ovarian mixed epithelial tumor; mixed epithelial tumour of the ovary; ovarian mixed epithelial neoplasm; ovarian mixed epithelial tumour; mixed epithelial tumour of ovary; mixed epithelial neoplasm of ovary; mixed epithelial tumor of ovary; ovarian Seromucinous tumor; mixed epithelial neoplasm of the ovary

label: ovarian sarcoma
definition: A rare, aggressive malignant mesenchymal neoplasm that arises from the ovary. The prognosis is poor.
synonyms: sarcoma of ovary; ovarian sarcoma; ovary sarcoma; sarcoma of the ovary

label: ovarian primitive germ cell tumor
definition: A malignant tumor that arises from the ovary and is characterized by the presence of malignant germ cell components but lacks a teratoma component.
synonyms: ovarian primitive germ cell tumor

label: ovarian papillary tumor
definition: A benign, borderline, or malignant epithelial tumor that arises from the ovary and is characterized by the presence of papillary proliferations. Representative examples include surface papilloma, borderline serous surface papillary tumor, and serous surface papillary adenocarcinoma.
synonyms: ovarian papillary neoplasm; papillary tumour of ovary; ovarian papillary tumor; papillary tumor of ovary; papillary tumour of the ovary; papillary neoplasm of the ovary; papillary tumor of the ovary; papillary neoplasm of ovary; ovarian papillary tumour (morphologic abnormality); ovarian papillary tumor (morphologic abnormality)

label: ovarian neuroendocrine neoplasm
definition: An epithelial neoplasm with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the ovary. It includes carcinoid tumor, small cell carcinoma pulmonary type, and large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma.
synonyms: neuroendocrine neoplasm of ovary; neuroendocrine neoplasm of the ovary; ovary neuroendocrine tumour; ovary neuroendocrine neoplasm; ovarian neuroendocrine neoplasm; ovary neuroendocrine tumor, well differentiated, low or intermediate grade; neuroendocrine tumor of ovary; neuroendocrine tumour of ovary; ovary neuroendocrine tumor; ovary NET

label: ovarian neoplasm
definition: A benign, borderline, or malignant neoplasm involving the ovary.
synonyms: ovarian tumors; tumor of ovary; tumour of the ovary; neoplasm of the ovary; tumor of the ovary; ovary neoplasm; neoplasm of ovary; ovary tumor; ovarian tumor; ovarian tumours; tumour of ovary; ovarian tumour; ovary neoplasm (disease); ovary tumour; ovarian neoplasm

label: ovarian mucinous neoplasm
definition: A benign, borderline, or malignant epithelial tumor of the ovary characterized by the presence of neoplastic epithelial cells that contain intracytoplasmic mucin and may resemble the epithelial cells of the endocervix or gastrointestinal tract.
synonyms: ovarian mucinous neoplasm; mucinous tumor of the ovary; mucinous neoplasm of ovary; mucinous tumour of the ovary; mucinous neoplasm of the ovary; mucinous tumour of ovary; ovarian mucinous tumor; mucinous tumor of ovary; ovarian mucinous tumour

label: ovarian mucinous adenofibroma
definition: A benign neoplasm of the ovary characterized by the presence of glands with mucinous columnar epithelial cells in a fibrotic stroma.
synonyms: mucinous adenofibroma of ovary; ovary mucinous adenofibroma; ovarian mucinous adenofibroma

label: ovarian monodermal teratoma
definition: A teratoma that arises from the ovary and is characterized by the presence of tissues derived exclusively from one embryonic germ cell layer.
synonyms: monodermal teratoma (morphologic abnormality); ovarian monodermal teratoma; monodermal teratoma

label: ovarian monodermal and highly specialized teratoma
definition: A teratoma of the ovary composed exclusively or predominantly of a single type of tissue derived from the ectoderm or endoderm. A representative example is struma ovarii which is a teratoma composed exclusively or predominantly of thyroid tissue.
synonyms: ovarian germ cell monodermal and highly specialized teratoma; ovarian germ cell monodermal and highly specialised teratoma; ovarian monodermal and highly specialized teratoma

label: ovarian granulosa cell tumor
definition: A granulosa-stromal cell tumor that arises from the ovary. It is characterized by the presence of granulosa cells that comprise at least ten percent of the cellular population. The granulosa cells are often found in a background that contains theca and fibrous cells. There are two major subtypes recognized, adult and juvenile granulosa cell tumor. Clinically, patients may present with an abdominal mass. Symptoms depend on the patient's age. The most important indicator of prognosis is tumor stage. Age over forty years at the time of the initial diagnosis, large tumor size, bilaterality, cellular atypia, and increased mitotic activity are factors indicating a potentially aggressive clinical course and relative poor prognosis.
synonyms: granulosa cell neoplasm of ovary; ovary granulosa cell tumour; granulosa cell tumour of ovary; granulosa cell tumor of ovary; granulosa cell tumor of the ovary; ovarian granulosa cell neoplasm; granulosa cell neoplasm of the ovary; ovarian granulosa cell tumor; ovary granulosa cell tumor; granulosa cell tumour of the ovary

label: ovarian epithelial tumor
definition: A benign, borderline, or malignant tumor that originates from the surface epithelium of the ovary. It is composed of epithelial cells and stroma. Representative examples of benign tumors include serous cystadenoma, mucinous cystadenoma, and benign Brenner tumor. Representative examples of borderline tumors include serous surface papillary tumor, mucinous adenofibroma, and borderline Brenner tumor. Representative examples of malignant tumors include serous adenocarcinoma, mucinous adenocarcinoma, endometrioid adenocarcinoma, and malignant Brenner tumor.
synonyms: epithelial tumor of ovary; ovarian surface-epithelial stromal neoplasm; epithelial tumour of the ovary; epithelial neoplasm of the ovary; epithelial tumour of ovary; epithelial tumor of the ovary; epithelial neoplasm of ovary; ovary epithelial neoplasm; ovarian surface epithelial-stromal tumour; ovarian surface epithelial-stromal tumor; ovarian epithelial tumor
crossreferences: NCIT:C4381; MEDGEN:90969; DOID:2152; ONCOTREE:OVT; UMLS:C0341823; ICD9:239.5; SCTID:237057005

label: ovarian endometrioid adenofibroma
definition: A benign neoplasm of the ovary characterized by the presence of glandular structures with endometrial-type well-differentiated cells in a fibrotic stroma.
synonyms: ovarian endometrioid adenofibroma

label: ovarian endometrial cancer
definition: A benign, borderline, or malignant epithelial tumor of the ovary characterized by the presence of glands and/or cysts lined by neoplastic cells that resemble endometrial cells.
synonyms: ovary female reproductive endometrioid cancer; ovary endometrioid tumor; malignant ovarian endometrioid tumor; endometrioid neoplasm of ovary; ovary endometrioid tumour; endometrioid tumor of ovary; malignant ovarian endometrioid tumour; endometrioid tumour of ovary; ovarian endometrioid neoplasm

label: ovarian embryonal carcinoma
definition: An embryonal carcinoma arising from the ovary. Signs and symptoms include the presence of an abdominal mass and abdominal pain.

label: ovarian dysfunction
definition: The inability of the ovaries to function.
synonyms: ovarian hypofunction; ovarian failure; ovarian insufficiency

label: ovarian disorder
definition: A disease involving the ovary.
synonyms: ovarian disorder; disease or disorder of ovary; ovarian disease; disorder of ovary; ovary disease; ovary disease or disorder; disease of ovary

label: ovarian cystic teratoma
definition: A teratoma that arises from the ovary and is characterized by the presence of cystic structures. Representative example is the dermoid cyst.
synonyms: ovary cystic teratoma

label: ovarian cystadenoma
definition: A benign ovarian surface epithelial-stromal tumor characterized by the presence of cystic structures lined by serous epithelial cells, mucinous columnar epithelial cells, or endometrial-type well-differentiated cells.
synonyms: simple ovarian cystoma; benign cystadenoma of ovary; benign ovarian cystadenoma; cystoma serosum simplex; benign cystadenoma of the ovary; simple cystoma of ovary; simple cystoma of the ovary; ovarian cystadenoma; cystadenoma of the ovary; ovary cystadenoma; cystadenoma of ovary

label: ovarian cystadenocarcinoma
definition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the ovary and is characterized by the presence of cystic structures. It includes the serous cystadenocarcinoma, mucinous cystadenocarcinoma, and clear cell cystadenocarcinoma.
synonyms: cystadenocarcinoma of ovary; cystadenocarcinoma of the ovary; ovary cystadenocarcinoma; ovarian cystadenocarcinoma

label: ovarian cyst
synonyms: ovarian cyst (disease); ovarian cyst

label: ovarian clear cell tumor
definition: A benign, borderline, or malignant epithelial tumor of the ovary that is characterized by a predominance of clear and hobnail cells.
synonyms: ovarian clear cell tumor; ovarian clear cell neoplasm

label: ovarian clear cell cancer
definition: An invasive malignant neoplasm that arises from the ovary and is characterized by a predominance of clear and hobnail malignant epithelial cells.
synonyms: malignant ovarian clear cell neoplasm; malignant ovarian clear cell tumor; clear-cell ovarian carcinoma; malignant ovarian clear cell tumour

label: ovarian clear cell adenofibroma
definition: An uncommon benign neoplasm of glandular epithelium characterized by the presence of clear or hobnail cells within a dense fibrous stroma.
synonyms: clear cell adenofibroma of ovary; ovary clear cell adenofibroma; ovarian clear cell adenofibroma

label: ovarian carcinoma
definition: A malignant neoplasm originating from the surface ovarian epithelium. It accounts for the greatest number of deaths from malignancies of the female genital tract and is the fifth leading cause of cancer fatalities in women. It is predominantly a disease of older white women of northern European extraction, but it is seen in all ages and ethnic groups. Adenocarcinomas constitute the vast majority of ovarian carcinomas. The pattern of metastatic spread in ovarian carcinoma is similar regardless of the microscopic type. The most common sites of involvement are the contralateral ovary, peritoneal cavity, para-aortic and pelvic lymph nodes, and liver. Lung and pleura are the most common sites of extra-abdominal spread. The primary form of therapy is surgical. The overall prognosis of ovarian carcinoma remains poor, a direct result of its rapid growth rate and the lack of early symptoms. --2002
synonyms: ovarian carcinoma; carcinoma of the ovary; carcinoma of ovary; epithelial ovarian cancer; ovary carcinoma

label: ovarian biphasic or triphasic teratoma
definition: A germ cell tumor that arises from the ovary and is composed of tissues that originate from two or three of the following germ layers, endoderm, ectoderm, or mesoderm.
synonyms: ovarian biphasic or triphasic teratoma

label: ovarian benign neoplasm
definition: A non-metastasizing neoplasm that arises from the ovary. Representative examples include serous cystadenoma, mucinous cystadenoma, clear cell adenofibroma, benign Brenner tumor, thecoma, and fibroma.
synonyms: benign neoplasm of ovary; benign ovarian tumor; benign tumour of ovary; benign neoplasm of the ovary; benign ovarian tumour; benign tumour of the ovary; benign tumor of the ovary; ovary benign neoplasm; benign ovarian neoplasm; benign tumor of ovary

label: ovarian adenoma benign
definition: A benign adenoma of ovary

label: ovarian Sertoli-Leydig cell tumor
definition: A benign or malignant sex cord-stromal tumor arising from the ovary. It is characterized by the presence of neoplastic Leydig cells. Signs and symptoms include hirsutism, menorrhagia and metrorrhagia. It may be associated with trisomy 8.
synonyms: Sertoli-Leydig cell tumour of the ovary; Sertoli-Leydig cell tumor of the ovary; ovarian Sertoli-Leydig cell neoplasm; androblastoma; Sertoli-Leydig neoplasm of the ovary; arrhenoblastoma; Sertoli-Leydig cell tumor of ovary; Sertoli-Leydig cell tumour of ovary; Sertoli-Leydig neoplasm of ovary; ovarian Sertoli-Leydig cell tumor

label: ovarian Brenner tumor
definition: A benign, borderline, or malignant transitional cell neoplasm arising from the ovary. It constitutes between 1% and 2% of all ovarian neoplasms. The average age at presentation is about 50 years. Grossly it is usually unilateral, firm and white or yellowish. Microscopically it consists of solid and cystic nests of epithelial cells resembling transitional epithelium surrounded by an abundant stromal component of dense, fibroblastic nature.
synonyms: Brenner neoplasm of ovary; Brenner tumour of ovary; Brenner tumour of the ovary; ovarian Brenner neoplasm; ovary Brenner tumor; Brenner tumor of the ovary; ovary Brenner tumour; Brenner tumor of ovary; Brenner neoplasm of the ovary; ovarian Brenner tumor

label: otosclerosis
definition: Formation of spongy bone in the labyrinth capsule which can progress toward the stapes (stapedial fixation) or anteriorly toward the cochlea leading to conductive, sensorineural, or mixed hearing loss. Several genes are associated with familial otosclerosis with varied clinical signs.
synonyms: otosclerosis (disease); otosclerosis

label: otorhinolaryngologic disease
definition: Pathological processes of the ear, the nose, and the throat, also known as the ENT diseases.
synonyms: ear, nose and throat disorder; otorhinolaryngologic disease; otolaryngologic disorder; ear, nose or throat disorder; ear/nose/throat disease

label: otopalatodigital syndrome spectrum disorder
definition: Otopalatodigital syndrome spectrum disorder is a primary bone dysplasia and encompasses a group of congenital anomalies that are characterized by skeletal dysplasia of varying clinical severity and an X linked dominant pattern of inheritance. This group include otopalatodigital syndrome type 1 and 2 (OPD1, OPD2) which are characterized in affected males by cleft palate, conductive hearing loss, craniofacial abnormalities and skeletal dysplasia; Melnick-Needles syndrome (MNS) which displays skeletal deformities in females and embryonic or perinatal lethality in most males; frontometaphyseal dysplasia (FMD); and terminal osseous dysplasia - pigmentary defects.
synonyms: OPSD; OPD spectrum disorder
subsets: mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:otar; mondo:rare; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:nord_rare

label: otopalatodigital syndrome
definition: A form of frontootopalatodigital syndrome, characterized by deafness, cleft palate, and characteristic digital anomalies. OPD syndrome is divided into two forms based on severity: the milder form designated OPD type 1 (OPD1), and the more severe and often lethal form designated OPD type 2 (OPD2). OPD is an X-linked disorder. Two other genetic disorders with features overlapping OPD, frontometaphyseal dysplasia (FMD) and osteodysplasty, Melnick-Needles type (MNS) have been described; thus OPD1, OPD2, FMD, and MNS are allelic disorders.
synonyms: oto-palatal-digital syndrome; oto-palato-digital syndrome
crossreferences: SCTID:767130007; UMLS:C5779873; GARD:7293; Orphanet:669; MEDGEN:1843451; icd11.foundation:1506946342

label: otomycosis
definition: Fungus infection of the external ear, usually by aspergillus species
synonyms: external ear fungal infectious disease

label: otitis media
definition: Inflammation of the anatomical structures of the middle ear, which is most often caused by an infectious process. Symptoms include erythema and edema of the tympanic membrane, pain, and possibly fever.
synonyms: middle Ear Inflammation; otitis Media; middle ear inflammation; otitis media (disease); medial otitis; inflammation of middle ear

label: otitis externa
definition: Inflammation of the anatomical structures of the outer ear and ear canal secondary to an infectious process. Bacterial etiology is most common, but fungal infection is also possible. Symptoms include erythema, edema, and pain.
synonyms: external Ear infection; swimmer's ear; swimmer's Ear; outer Ear infection; otitis externa; infectious otitis externa

label: osteosclerosis
definition: Abnormally high bone density.

label: osteosarcoma
definition: A usually aggressive malignant bone-forming mesenchymal neoplasm, predominantly affecting adolescents and young adults. It usually involves bones and less frequently extraosseous sites. It often involves the long bones (particularly distal femur, proximal tibia, and proximal humerus). Pain with or without a palpable mass is the most frequent clinical symptom. It may spread to other anatomic sites, particularly the lungs.
synonyms: osteoid sarcoma; osteosarcoma; osteosarcoma (disease); sarcoma of osteoid; osteosarcoma, malignant; osteogenic sarcoma
crossreferences: UMLS:C0029463; NCIT:C9145; DOID:3347; NANDO:2200048; ICDO:9180/3; EFO:0000637; MEDGEN:10501; ONCOTREE:OS; MESH:D012516; HP:0002669

label: osteoradionecrosis
definition: Necrosis of bone following radiation injury.
synonyms: osteoradionecrosis

label: osteopoikilosis
definition: A rare autosomal dominant inherited disorder characterized by the presence of small areas of increased density throughout the bones.
synonyms: osteopoikilosis (disease); osteopoikilosis

label: osteopetrosis
definition: Osteopetrosis, also known as marble bone disease, is a descriptive term that refers to a group of rare, heritable disorders of the skeleton characterized by increased bone density on radiographs.
synonyms: marble bone disease; osteopetrosis; Albers-Schonberg disease; osteopetrosis (disease); marble bones; marble bone
subsets: mondo:nord_rare; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:otar; mondo:rare

definition: A none disease characterized by death of bone tissue due to a lack of blood supply.

subsets: mondo:rare; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:otar; mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders

label: osteomyelitis
definition: An acute or chronic inflammation of the bone and its structures due to infection with pyogenic bacteria.
synonyms: osteomyelitis (disease); osteomyelitis

label: osteomalacia
definition: A metabolic bone disease that results from either a deficiency in vitamin D, or an abnormality in the metabolism of vitamin D, or a deficiency of calcium in the diet. The most common symptoms are bone pain and muscle weakness. When it occurs in children it is commonly referred to as rickets. (Diagnostic Surgical Pathology, 3rd ed.) --2003
synonyms: osteomalacia; osteomalacia (disease)

label: osteoma
definition: A benign, well-circumscribed, bone-forming neoplasm predominantly composed of lamellar bone. It usually arises from the calvarial, facial, or jaw bones. It is usually asymptomatic but it may cause local swelling or obstruction of the paranasal sinuses. Asymptomatic cases have an indolent clinical course.

label: osteogenic neoplasm
definition: A benign, intermediate, or malignant bone-forming neoplasm. Representative examples include osteoma, osteoblastoma, and osteosarcoma.

label: osteochondrosis
definition: A condition that is characterized by defective bone growth that affects the growth centers of bone.

label: osteoarthritis

It is accompanied by pain and stiffness, particularly after prolonged activity.

label: ossifying fibroma
definition: A well circumscribed lesion of the bone, most frequently arising from the posterior mandible. It is characterized by the presence of fibrous tissue and a mineralized component which may be woven bone, lamellar bone, or cementum-like material. Complete removal is recommended, since it continues to enlarge if left untreated.
synonyms: Cementifying fibroma; fibroma, ossifying, benign; ossifying fibroma; cemento-ossifying fibroma; ossifying fibroma (disease); fibro-osteoma

synonyms: Oral-Facial-Digital Syndrome; oral-facial-digital syndrome; OFD; orofaciodigital syndrome

label: oral mucosa leukoplakia
definition: A white patch or plaque on the oral mucosa that cannot be characterized clinically or pathologically as any other disease. The diagnosis of leukoplakia is one of exclusion; other conditions such as candidiasis, lichen planus, leukoedema, etc., must be ruled out before a diagnosis of leukoplakia can be made. Leukoplakia may be a premalignant condition.

definition: A neoplasm (disease) that involves the oral cavity.

label: oral cavity mucoepidermoid carcinoma
definition: A mucoepidermoid carcinoma arising from the minor salivary glands in the oral cavity. It is often asymptomatic and detected during a routine dental examination.
synonyms: oral cavity mucoepidermoid cancer; oral cavity mucoepidermoid carcinoma; mucoepidermoid carcinoma of oral cavity; mucoepidermoid carcinoma of the oral cavity

definition: A in situ carcinoma that involves the oral cavity.

synonyms: carcinoma of oral cavity; carcinoma of mouth; oral cavity carcinoma; mouth carcinoma; carcinoma of the oral cavity

label: oral cavity cancer
definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm involving the oral cavity. The majority are squamous cell carcinomas.

definition: An astrocytoma that affects the optic tract. This condition can be seen in association with neurofibromatosis 1. It is most commonly seen in the pediatric age group.

label: optic papillitis
definition: Swelling of the optic disk, usually in association with increased intracranial pressure, characterized by hyperemia, blurring of the disk margins, microhemorrhages, blind spot enlargement, and engorgement of retinal veins. Chronic papilledema may cause optic atrophy and visual loss. (Miller et al., Clinical Neuro-Ophthalmology, 4th ed, p175)
synonyms: increased intracranial pressure associated papilledema; optic nerve papillitis; inflammation of optic disk; edema, optic disc; Edemas, optic disc; optic papilla oedema; papillitis, optic nerve; papillitis, optic; papilloedema; Choked discs; papilledema associated with decreased intraocular pressure; decreased intraocular pressure-associated papilledema; oedema of the optic disc; decreased intraocular pressure associated papilledema; increased intracranial pressure-associated papilledema; Choked disk; optic discitis; optic disk inflammation; edema, optic papilla; optic papillitis; edema, optic disk; disk, Choked; Edemas, optic disk; edema of the optic disk; papilledema associated with increased intracranial pressure; inflammation of optic disc; Choked disks; optic disk edema; optic disc oedema; optic disc inflammation; Choked disc; papillitis; optic papilla edema; papilledema; disks, Choked

label: optic neuritis
definition: Optic neuritis is inflammation of the optic nerve, the nerve that carries the visual signal from the eye to the brain.The conditionmay cause sudden, reduced vision in the affected eye(s). While the cause of optic neuritis is unknown, it has been associated with autoimmune diseases, infections, multiple sclerosis, drug toxicity and deficiency of vitamin B-12. Vision often returns to normal within 2-3 weeks without treatment. In some cases, corticosteroids are given to speed recovery. If known, the underlying cause should be treated.

label: optic nerve neoplasm
definition: Benign and malignant neoplasms which arise from or metastasize to the optic or second cranial nerve which extends from the optic disk of the eye and joins the optic chiasm. Clinical features may include visual loss, proptosis, and local pain. The majority of optic nerve tumors or optic gliomas.

definition: A mycosis that arises from infection in an immunologically compromised host.

label: opiate dependence
definition: Disorders related or resulting from abuse or mis-use of opioids.

definition: Weakness or paralysis of at least one of the muscles controlling the movement of the eye. It results from degeneration of the muscles or the neural pathways involved in the eye movement. Representative disorders causing ophthalmoplegia include ocular myopathies and multiple sclerosis.

label: omphalitis

These tumors are classified according to their grade (low grade oligodendrogliomas: grade II of the WHO classification and anaplastic oligodendrogliomas: grade III of the WHO classification) and according to their pure or mixed histology (oligoastrocytomas).

definition: A neoplasm involving a oculomotor nerve.
synonyms: oculomotor nerve tumor; oculomotor nerve tumour; IIIrd cranial nerve tumor; neoplasm of oculomotor nerve; tumour of oculomotor nerve; oculomotor nerve neoplasm; IIIrd cranial nerve tumour; tumor of oculomotor nerve; oculomotor nerve neoplasm (disease)

label: oculocutaneous albinism
definition: Oculocutaneous albinism (OCA) describes a group of inherited disorders of melanin biosynthesis characterized by a generalized reduction in pigmentation of hair, skin and eyes and variable ocular findings including nystagmus, reduced visual acuity and photophobia. Variants include OCA1A (the most severe form), OCA1B, OCA1-minimal pigment (OCA1-MP), OCA1-temperature sensitive (OCA1-TS), OCA2, OCA3, OCA4, OCA5, OCA6 and OCA7.
synonyms: non-syndromic oculocutaneous albinism; nonsyndromic oculocutaneous albinism; OCA
subsets: mondo:gard_rare; mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:rare; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:otar
