synonyms: chorioretinitis; retinochoroiditis; chorioretinitis (disease)

label: choriocarcinoma of testis
definition: A malignant germ cell tumor arising from the testis. It represents the rarest of the testicular germ cell tumors. Histologically it is characterized by the presence of syncytiotrophoblasts and cytotrophoblasts.
synonyms: testis choriocarcinoma (disease); testicular choriocarcinoma; choriocarcinoma of the testis; choriocarcinoma of testis
crossreferences: UMLS:C0238449; icd11.foundation:1972827817; MEDGEN:65969; DOID:5551; ONCOTREE:TCCA; EFO:1000564; NCIT:C7733

label: choriocarcinoma of ovary
definition: A choriocarcinoma arising from the ovary. When it appears before puberty is of germ cell origin. In children and young adults signs and symptoms include precocious pseudopuberty and vaginal bleeding. Serum human chorionic gonadotropin is elevated. Germ cell derived ovarian choriocarcinoma should be differentiated from primary or metastatic gestational choriocarcinoma affecting the ovary. The prognosis of germ cell derived choriocarcinoma is less favorable and requires more aggressive chemotherapy treatment regimens compared to gestational choriocarcinoma.
synonyms: ovarian germ cell choriocarcinoma; germ cell choriocarcinoma of ovary; choriocarcinoma of ovary; ovarian choriocarcinoma; ovary choriocarcinoma (disease); choriocarcinoma of the ovary; germ cell choriocarcinoma of the ovary

label: choriocarcinoma
definition: An aggressive malignant tumor arising from trophoblastic cells. The vast majority of cases arise in the uterus and represent gestational choriocarcinomas that derive from placental trophoblastic cells. Approximately half of the cases develop from a complete hydatidiform mole. A minority of cases arise in the testis or the ovaries. There is often marked elevation of human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG) in the blood. Choriocarcinomas disseminate rapidly through the hematogenous route; the lungs are most frequently affected.
synonyms: choriocarcinoma, malignant; chorion carcinoma; choriocarcinoma (disease); chorioblastoma; chorioepithelioma; choriocarcinoma; chorionic carcinoma
crossreferences: UMLS:C0008497; ICDO:9100/3; EFO:0002893; HP:0100768; NANDO:2200070; NCIT:C2948; SCTID:188188009; GARD:6059; DOID:3594; MESH:D002822; MEDGEN:40278; ONCOTREE:BCCA

label: chondroma
definition: A benign well circumscribed neoplasm of hyaline cartilage arising from bone or soft tissue. It is characterized by the presence of chondrocytes.
synonyms: chondroma; chondroma, benign; central chondroma

label: chondroid chordoma
definition: A slow-growing malignant bone tumor arising from the remnants of the notochord and occurring in the base of the skull. The tumor is characterized by a lobulated growth pattern, myxoid stroma formation, and the presence of physaliphorous cells and cartilage.
synonyms: chondroid chordoma (morphologic abnormality); chondroid chordoma

label: chondrogenic neoplasm
definition: A benign, intermediate, or malignant cartilaginous matrix-producing neoplasm. Representative examples include osteochondroma, chondroblastoma, and chondrosarcoma.

label: chondrodysplasia
synonyms: chondrodysplasia

label: chondrocalcinosis
definition: An acute episode of pain, swelling, and redness, sometimes associated with fever. It is caused by the deposition of calcium pyrophosphate crystals in the joints.

label: cholesterol metabolism disease
definition: A disease that has its basis in the disruption of cholesterol metabolic process.
synonyms: disorder of cholesterol metabolic process; disorder of cholesterol metabolism; cholesterol metabolism disease; cholesterol metabolic process disease

label: cholesterol embolism
definition: Blocking of a blood vessel by cholesterol-rich atheromatous deposits, generally occurring in the flow from a large artery to small arterial branches. It is also called arterial-arterial embolization or atheroembolism which may be spontaneous or iatrogenic. Patients with spontaneous atheroembolism often have painful, cyanotic digits of acute onset.
synonyms: warfarin blue toe syndrome; atheroembolism; cholesterol crystal embolism; purple toe syndrome; trash foot

label: cholesterol catabolic process disease
definition: A disease that has its basis in the disruption of cholesterol catabolic process.

label: cholesterol biosynthetic process disease
definition: A disease that has its basis in the disruption of cholesterol biosynthetic process.

label: cholesteatoma of middle ear
definition: A non-neoplastic lesion characterized by the proliferation of keratinizing squamous epithelium in the middle ear that results in the accumulation of keratin and cells. It is usually caused by repeated infections. If left untreated, it may increase in size and destroy the adjacent delicate bones of the middle ear.

label: cholesteatoma
definition: A pathologic process characterized by the proliferation of keratinizing squamous epithelium resulting in the accumulation of keratin and cells in the middle ear and/or mastoid. It may be congenital or acquired. If left untreated, it may increase in size and destroy adjacent structures.
synonyms: cholesteatoma (disease); cholesteatoma

definition: An uncommon hematologic malignancy occurring during childhood. Many of the morphologic, immunophenotypic, and genetic changes seen in adult myelodysplastic syndromes are also observed in the childhood variants of the disease. Children present with neutropenia and thrombocytopenia more often than adults, and bone marrow hypocellularity is more often seen in children than adults.

definition: A tear within the wall of any of the arteries of the neck (carotid artery or vertebral artery) and that allows blood to separate the wall layers. label: cerebral palsy
definition: A group of disorders affecting the development of movement and posture, often accompanied by disturbances of sensation, perception, cognition, and behavior. It results from damage to the fetal or infant brain.

definition: A neuroblastoma arising from the cerebral hemispheres.

label: cerebral degeneration
definition: A neurodegenerative disease that involves the telencephalon.

label: cerebral creatine deficiency syndrome
definition: Creatine deficiency syndrome (CDS) comprises a group of inborn errors of creatine metabolism, characterized by a global developmental delay, intellectual disability and associated neurological (seizures, movement disorders, myopathy) and behavioral manifestions. CDS includes two creatine biosynthesis disorders; guanidinoacetate methyltransferase deficiency and L- Arginine: glycine amidinotransferase deficiency, as well as X-linked creatine transporter deficiency.
synonyms: cerebral creatine deficiency syndrome; CDS; CCDS; creatine deficiency syndrome

label: cerebral cortical dysplasia
definition: Abnormalities in the development of the cerebral cortex. These include malformations arising from abnormal neuronal and glial cell proliferation or apoptosis (Group I); abnormal neuronal migration (Group ii); and abnormal establishment of cortical organization (Group iii). Many inborn metabolic brain disorders affecting cns formation are often associated with cortical malformations. They are common causes of epilepsy and developmental delay.
synonyms: cortical dysplasia; brain cortical dysplasia

definition: A meningioma that affects the cerebral sulcus.

label: cerebral cavernous malformation
definition: A disorder characterized by malformations in the structure of the capillaries in the brain. It is caused by mutations in the CCM2, KRIT1 and PDCD10 genes. The capillaries fill with blood and stretch, thereby creating cavernous spaces. Some patients experience headaches, seizures, or visual and hearing disturbances. Cerebral hemorrhage may also occur.

label: cerebral arterial disease
definition: Pathological conditions of intracranial arteries supplying the cerebrum. These diseases often are due to abnormalities or pathological processes in the anterior cerebral artery; middle cerebral artery; and posterior cerebral artery.

definition: A neoplasm that affects the cerebellopontine angle. Representative examples include vestibular schwannoma and meningioma.

label: cerebellar neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant (primary or metastatic) tumor involving the cerebellum. -- 2003

label: cerebellar disorder
definition: Diseases that affect the structure or function of the cerebellum. Cardinal manifestations of cerebellar dysfunction include dysmetria, gait ataxia, and muscle hypotonia.
synonyms: cerebellum disease or disorder; disease of cerebellum; disorder of cerebellum; cerebellum disease; disease or disorder of cerebellum

label: cerebellar degeneration
definition: Degeneration of the cerebellum. It may be an inherited condition, a paraneoplastic syndrome, or secondary to autoimmune disorders.
synonyms: cerebellar degeneration; neurodegenerative disease of cerebellum; cerebellar Degeneration; cerebellum neurodegenerative disease; Brain degeneration

label: cerebellar astrocytoma
definition: Benign and malignant neoplasms of the cerebellum that arise from astrocytes. During childhood the majority are benign pilocytic astrocytomas. In adults both benign and relatively higher grade forms may occur. The most common presenting symptoms are headache, nausea, vomiting, ataxia of gait or limb, paresis, diplopia, and dizziness. Objective signs include weakness, long tract signs, dysmetria, gait ataxia, papilledema, and nystagmus. Surgical resection is often curative.
synonyms: cerebellar astrocytoma; cerebellum astrocytoma (excluding glioblastoma); astrocytoma (excluding glioblastoma) of cerebellum; cerebellum astrocytoma; astrocytoma of cerebellum; astrocytoma of the cerebellum; astrocytoma, cerebellar

label: cephalocele
definition: A congenital neural tube closure defect resulting in the protrusion of the brain through a skull opening. When the protrusion includes the meninges, the term encephalomeningocele is used.
synonyms: encephalocele; cephalocele (disease); cephalocele; cranium bifidum

label: central sleep apnea syndrome
definition: A broad classification of disorders which includes 6 subtypes (primary central sleep apnea, central sleep apnea due to Cheyne-Stokes breathing pattern, central sleep apnea due to medical condition not Cheyne-Stokes, central sleep apnea due to high-altitude periodic breathing, central sleep apnea due to drug or substance and primary sleep apnea of infancy) that are each characterized by interruptions in breathing while asleep. It is caused by improper signaling from the brainstem to respiratory muscles and is triggered by either hypoventilation or hyperventilation. In adults, this disorder may arise following a stroke, congestive heart failure, trauma, infection or the use of narcotic medications. It is more common in older males and may present as a co-morbid condition to obesity. Clinical signs include snoring, insomnia or hypersomnia, difficulty concentrating and fatigue. Recurrent episodes of hypoxia/hypoxemia have long-term detrimental effects on cardiovascular health.
synonyms: central sleep apnea syndrome

label: central precocious puberty
definition: Central precocious puberty (CPP), also referred to as gonadotropin dependent precocious puberty, is an endocrine-related developmental disease characterized by the onset of pubertal changes, with development of secondary sexual characteristics and accelerated growth and bone maturation, before the normal age of puberty (8 years in girls and 9 years in boys).
synonyms: gonadotropin-dependant precocious puberty; precocious puberty, central; gonadotropin-dependent precocious puberty; CPP

label: central nervous system vasculitis
definition: Vasculitis affecting the blood vessels of the brain and/or spinal cord.

definition: A sarcoma that arises from the central nervous system.

label: central nervous system neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant, primary or metastatic neoplasm that affects the brain, meninges, or spinal cord. Representative examples of primary neoplasms include astrocytoma, oligodendroglioma, ependymoma, and meningioma. Representative examples of metastatic neoplasms include carcinoma and leukemia.

label: central nervous system mesenchymal non-meningothelial tumor
definition: A benign or malignant mesenchymal neoplasm originating in the central nervous system or the meninges and showing fibrous, fibrohistiocytic, adipose, myoid, endothelial, chondroid or osseous, but not meningothelial differentiation. Depending on the histological features and clinical behavior of these neoplasms, their grade ranges from benign (WHO grade I) to highly malignant (WHO grade IV). (Adapted from WHO)

label: central nervous system melanocytic neoplasm
definition: A primary tumor of the central nervous system that arises from leptomeningeal melanocytes. It may present as a diffuse proliferative leptomeningeal process (often as a component of the neurocutaneous melanosis complex) or as a distinct mass lesion.

label: central nervous system mature teratoma
definition: A teratoma composed exclusively of fully differentiated, 'adult-type' tissue elements that are sometimes arranged in a pattern resembling normal tissue relationships. Mitotic activity is low or absent. The more common ectodermal components present in a mature teratoma include skin, brain and choroid plexus. The more common mesodermal components include cartilage, bone, fat and muscle (both smooth and striated). And the most common endodermal components are cysts lined by epithelia of respiratory or enteric type and in some cases pancreatic or hepatic tissue. (Adapted from WHO)
synonyms: mature teratoma of central nervous system; mature teratoma of CNS; mature teratoma of the central nervous system; central nervous system mature teratoma; CNS mature teratoma; mature teratoma of the CNS

label: central nervous system lipoma
definition: A rare benign adipose tissue neoplasm of the central nervous system frequently found in midline locations such as the corpus callosum, the quadrigeminal plate, the hypothalamus, the spinal canal or the cauda equina. Some contain Schwann cells, bone, cartilage or hamartomatous blood vessels.

definition: A primary or metastatic neoplasm of hematopoietic origin that affects the brain, meninges, or spinal cord. Representative examples include Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, histiocytic tumors, and leukemias.

label: central nervous system germinoma
definition: A malignant germ cell tumor arising from the central nervous system. It is composed of uniform cells resembling primitive germ cells. These cells have large, vesicular nuclei, prominent nucleoli and a clear, glycogen-rich cytoplasm. Additional features are lymphoid or lymphoplasmacytic infiltrates and, less frequently, scattered syncytiotrophoblastic giant cells. (Adapted from WHO)
synonyms: germinoma of the CNS; germinoma of central nervous system; central nervous system germinoma (disease); germinoma of CNS; germinoma of the central nervous system; central nervous system germinoma

label: central nervous system germ cell tumor
definition: A unique group of rare tumors of the central nervous system that affect mainly children and adolescents. Their morphologic and biologic profile corresponds to that of homologous germ cell tumors that arise in the gonads and in other extragonadal sites. Representative examples include: germinoma, embryonal carcinoma, yolk sac tumor, choriocarcinoma, and teratoma.

definition: A neoplasm that arises from the glandular epithelium of the cecal mucosa. It is characterized by a villous architectural pattern. The neoplastic glandular cells have dysplastic features.

definition: A well differentiated, low grade neuroendocrine tumor (carcinoid tumor) that arises from the cecum. The mitotic count is less than 2 per 10 HPF and/or the Ki67 index is equal to or less than 2 percent.

Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma. Cecal adenomas always exhibit epithelial dysplasia and are considered premalignant neoplasms.

label: cavernous hemangioma of face

definition: A hemangioma characterized by the presence of cavernous vascular spaces.

label: caudal regression-sirenomelia spectrum
definition: Caudal regression-sirenomelia spectrum is a group of rare genetic developmental defect during embryogenesis disorders characterized by varying degrees of caudal abdomen, pelvic, renal, anorectal, urogenital and/or lumbosacral spine malformations, with or without lower limb fusion. Phenotype is highly variable ranging from minor forms with isolated coccygeal agenesis to severe forms presenting with a single rudimentary limb. Central nervous system anomalies have also been reported.

label: cauda equina neoplasm
definition: A neoplasm involving a cauda equina.

label: catatonia
definition: A psychiatric disorder featuring stupor, posturing, and echophenomena.

label: cataracts, hearing impairment, nephrotic syndrome, and enterocolitis
cataract
definition: Partial or complete opacity of the crystalline lens of one or both eyes that decreases visual acuity and eventually results in blindness. Some cataracts appear in infancy or in childhood, but most develop in older individuals. (Sternberg Diagnostic Surgical Pathology, 3rd ed.)
synonyms: opacity of the lens; cataract; cataract (disease)

label: carotid artery disorder

label: cardiovascular neoplasm

definition: Cardioectodermal syndromes are those in which phenotypic manifestations occur in the heart, skin, and/or hair. label: carcinoma ex pleomorphic adenoma
definition: A carcinoma arising in a pre-existing pleomorphic adenoma. It most often occurs in the parotid gland and less often in the submandibular gland and minor salivary gland. Patients usually present with a history of a long-standing mass which recently had undergone rapid growth. The prognosis depends on the invasiveness of the malignant component. Patients with non-invasive or minimally invasive tumors usually have a good prognosis following surgical resection. Invasive tumors are usually aggressive and are associated with recurrences and metastases.
synonyms: carcinoma ex pleomorphic adenoma (morphologic abnormality); carcinoma ex pleomorphic adenoma; carcinoma in pleomorphic adenoma

label: carcinoma
definition: A malignant tumor arising from epithelial cells. Carcinomas that arise from glandular epithelium are called adenocarcinomas, those that arise from squamous epithelium are called squamous cell carcinomas, and those that arise from transitional epithelium are called transitional cell carcinomas. Morphologically, the malignant epithelial cells may display abnormal mitotic figures, anaplasia, and necrosis. Carcinomas are graded by the degree of cellular differentiation as well, moderately, or poorly differentiated. Carcinomas invade the surrounding tissues and tend to metastasize to other anatomic sites. Lung carcinoma, skin carcinoma, breast carcinoma, colon carcinoma, and prostate carcinoma are the most frequently seen carcinomas.
synonyms: carcinoma, malignant; epithelial carcinoma; malignant epithelial tumor; malignant epithelial tumour; malignant epithelioma; carcinoma; epithelioma malignant; Other carcinoma; malignant epithelial neoplasm

label: carcinoid tumor
definition: A slow growing neuroendocrine tumor, composed of uniform, round, or polygonal cells having monotonous, centrally located nuclei and small nucleoli, infrequent mitoses, and no necrosis. The tumor may show a variety of patterns, such as solid, trabecular, and acinar. Electron microscopy shows small secretory granules. Immunohistochemical studies reveal NSE, as well as chromogranin immunoreactivity. Malignant histology (cellular pleomorphism, hyperchromatic nuclei, prominent nucleoli, necrosis, and mitoses) can occasionally be seen. Such cases may have an aggressive clinical course. Gastrointestinal tract and lung are common sites of involvement.
synonyms: carcinoid tumor; neuroendocrine tumor G1; carcinoid tumor (disease); neuroendocrine neoplasm G1; carcinoid tumour (disease); NET G1; neuroendocrine tumour G1; carcinoid

label: cancer or benign tumor

label: cancer affecting bone of limb skeleton
definition: A cancer that involves the limb bone.
synonyms: cancer of limb bone; malignant neoplasm of limb bone; limb bone cancer; malignant limb bone neoplasm

label: cancer
definition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

label: breast phyllodes tumor
definition: A benign, malignant, or borderline circumscribed biphasic neoplasm that arises from the breast. It usually affects middle-aged women. It is characterized by the presence of a double layer of epithelial cells that are arranged in clefts, surrounded by a spindle cell mesenchymal (stromal) component.

label: breast myoepitheliosis
definition: A multifocal neoplastic process characterized by the proliferation of spindle to cuboidal myoepithelial cells within and/or around small breast ducts.

label: breast myoepithelial tumor
definition: A benign or malignant tumor that arises from the breast and originates from or is composed of myoepithelial cells. Representative examples include adenomyoepithelioma, myoepitheliosis, and malignant myoepithelioma.
synonyms: breast myoepithelial neoplasm; breast myoepithelial tumor

label: breast mucinous carcinoma
definition: An invasive adenocarcinoma of the breast characterized by the presence of islands of small and uniform cells, surrounded by large amounts of mucin. Pure mucinous breast carcinomas generally have a favorable prognosis.
synonyms: colloid carcinoma of breast; mucinous carcinoma of the breast; mucinous breast carcinoma; infiltrating mucinous breast carcinoma; invasive colloid breast carcinoma; invasive mucinous breast carcinoma; colloid carcinoma of the breast; breast mucinous carcinoma; colloid breast carcinoma; mucinous breast cancer; mucinous carcinoma of breast; infiltrating colloid breast carcinoma

label: breast lymphoma
definition: A lymphoma that arises from the breast. There is no history of extramammary breast lymphoma and ipsilateral axillary lymph node involvement does not exclude the diagnosis of primary breast lymphoma. Most patients present with a painless breast lump. The vast majority of cases are B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphomas. Diffuse large B-cell lymphoma, follicular lymphoma, and extranodal marginal zone B-cell lymphoma of mucosa associated lymphoid tissue are the most common types of primary non-Hodgkin lymphoma of the breast. Primary Hodgkin lymphoma of the breast is rare.
synonyms: malignant lymphoma of breast; lymphoma of the breast; breast lymphoma; lymphoma of breast; primary breast lymphoma

label: breast lobular carcinoma
definition: An adenocarcinoma of the breast arising from the lobules. This is a relatively uncommon carcinoma, represents approximately 10% of the breast adenocarcinomas and is often bilateral or multifocal.
synonyms: lobular carcinoma of the breast; lobular adenocarcinoma; lobule of mammary gland carcinoma; lobular carcinoma; lobular breast carcinoma; lobular carcinoma of breast; carcinoma of lobule of mammary gland

label: breast intraductal proliferative lesion
definition: A group of non-invasive epithelial proliferations that occur in the ductal system of the breast. The vast majority of cases arise in the terminal ductal lobular units. This category includes atypical ductal hyperplasia, usual ductal hyperplasia, flat epithelial atypia, and ductal carcinoma in situ. There is an increased risk for subsequent development of invasive breast carcinoma.
synonyms: intraductal proliferative lesion of the breast; DIN; intraductal proliferative lesion; mammary intraepithelial neoplasia, ductal type; ductal intraepithelial neoplasia

label: breast hemangioma
definition: A capillary or cavernous hemangioma arising from the breast.
synonyms: breast hemangioma; breast angioma; angioma of the breast; hemangioma of the breast; hemangioma of breast; angioma of breast

label: breast fibroepithelial neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant biphasic neoplasm that arises from the breast parenchyma. It is characterized by the presence of an epithelial and a mesenchymal (stromal) component. The typical examples are fibroadenoma and phyllodes tumor.
synonyms: breast fibroepithelial neoplasm; breast fibroepithelial tumour; breast fibroepithelial tumor

label: breast fibrocystic disease
definition: Fibrosis associated with cyst formation in the breast parenchyma.
synonyms: fibrocystic disease; fibrocystic disease of the breast; fibrocystic mastopathy; cystic disease of the breast; breast fibrocystic change; fibrocystic breast; mammary dysplasia; fibrocystic disease of breast; fibrocystic breast changes; benign breast disease; fibrocystic change of breast; fibrocystic change of the breast; diffuse cystic mastopathy; fibrocystic breast disease; cystic disease of breast

label: breast fibrocystic change, proliferative type
definition: Breast fibrocystic change characterized by the presence of epithelial cell hyperplasia. Epithelial atypia may be present or absent.
synonyms: breast fibrocystic change, proliferative type; proliferating lesion of the breast without atypia; proliferative type fibrocystic change of the breast; proliferative breast lesion; proliferative breast disease; benign proliferative breast disease; fibrocystic change, proliferative type with atypia; fibrocystic disease, proliferative type with atypia; proliferating lesion of breast without atypia; proliferative type fibrocystic change of breast

label: breast fibroadenoma
definition: A benign tumor of the breast characterized by the presence of stromal and epithelial elements. It presents as a painless, solitary, slow growing, firm, and mobile mass. It is the most common benign breast lesion. It usually occurs in women of childbearing age. The majority of fibroadenomas do not recur after complete excision. A slightly increased risk of developing cancer within fibroadenomas or in the breast tissue of patients previously treated for fibroadenomas has been reported.
synonyms: fibroadenoma of breast; juvenile fibroadenoma; juvenile fibroadenoma (morphologic abnormality); fibroadenoma, benign; cellular fibroadenoma; fibroadenoma; juvenile fibroadenoma of breast; Complex fibroadenoma of breast; breast fibroadenoma; fibroadenoma of the breast

label: breast ductal adenocarcinoma
definition: A breast carcinoma arising from the ducts. While ductal carcinomas can arise at other sites, this term is universally used to refer to carcinomas of the breast. Ductal carcinomas account for about two thirds of all breast cancers. Two types of ductal carcinomas have been described: ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) and invasive ductal carcinoma. The latter often spreads to the axillary lymph nodes and other anatomic sites. The two forms of ductal carcinoma often coexist.
synonyms: ductal carcinoma of breast; mammary duct adenocarcinoma; breast ductal carcinoma; ductal carcinoma of the breast; ductal breast carcinoma; ductal breast adenocarcinoma

label: breast disorder
definition: A disease involving the breast.

label: breast carcinoma

definition: A usually benign tumor arising from the breast. It is characterized by the proliferation of cells with myoepithelial differentiation around spaces which are lined by epithelial cells. Rarely, the epithelial and/or myoepithelial cells may undergo malignant transformation. Cases with malignant transformation may follow an aggressive clinical course, including recurrences and local and distant metastases.

Damage may be temporary, permanent, selective or pan-necrosis.

label: bladder urachal carcinoma
definition: Urachal cancer is a type of bladder cancer, making up less than 1% of all bladder cancers. The urachus is a structure normally only present during development in the womb that connects the bellybutton and the bladder. This connection normally disappears before birth, but in some people remains. Urachalcancers are usually diagnosed in adults in their 50's and 60's and may develop at the dome or anterior wall of the bladder, along the midline of the body (including the belly button), and between the pubis symphasis and the bladder.Most urachal cancersare adenocarcinomas (cancers that develop from gland cells).Others may besarcomas (which develop from connective tissue -such as leiomyosarcoma, rhabdomyosarcoma, and malignant fibrous histiocytoma), small cell carcinomas, transitional cell cancer, and mixed neoplasias. Most individuals with urachal cancer have symptoms of with hematuria (blood in urine). Other symptoms may include abdominal pain, a palpable abdominal mass, mucinuria, and bacteriuria. Treatment usually involved surgery to remove the cancer.
synonyms: bladder urachal cancer; bladder urachal carcinoma

label: bladder transitional cell carcinoma

It most often affects males in their sixth and seventh decades of life. Hematuria is the most common symptom at presentation. Pathologic stage is the strongest predictor of survival.

label: bladder squamous cell carcinoma
definition: A squamous cell carcinoma of the bladder arising from metaplastic epithelium. It represents less than 10% of bladder carcinomas. The exception is the Middle East along the Nile Valley, where it represents the most common form of carcinoma because of the endemic nature of schistosomiasis. Bladder squamous cell carcinoma is often associated with long-standing chronic inflammation of the bladder and usually has a poor prognosis. The diagnosis of squamous cell carcinoma of the bladder should be reserved for those tumors that are predominantly keratin forming.

label: beriberi
definition: Beriberi is a condition that occurs in people who are deficient in thiamine (vitamin B1). There are two major types of beriberi: wet beriberi which affects the cardiovascular system and dry beriberi which affects the nervous system. People with wet beriberi may experience increased heart rate, shortness of breath, and swelling of the lower legs. Signs and symptoms of dry beriberi include difficulty walking; loss of feeling in the hands and/or feet; paralysis of the lower legs; mental confusion; speech difficulty; pain; and/or vomiting. Beriberi is rare in the United States since many foods are now vitamin enriched; however, alcohol abuse, dialysis and taking high doses of diuretics increases the risk of developing the condition. In most cases,beriberi occurs sporadically in people with no family history of the condition. A rare condition known as genetic beriberi is inherited (passed down through families) and is associated with an inability to absorb thiamine from foods. Treatment generally includes thiamine supplementation, given by injection or taken by mouth.
synonyms: vitamin B1 deficiency; Beri Beri; thiamine deficiency

label: benign spiradenoma
definition: A benign epithelial neoplasm with eccrine or apocrine differentiation, arising from the sweat glands. It usually presents as a solitary, well circumscribed, firm nodule in the face and upper trunk. It is characterized by the presence of basaloid cells forming nodules in the dermis. Cases of carcinoma arising from long standing spiradenomas have been reported.

label: benign reproductive system neoplasm
definition: A non-metastasizing neoplasm that arises from the male or female reproductive system. Representative examples include benign prostate phyllodes tumor, benign Sertoli cell tumor, uterine corpus leiomyoma, and benign ovarian serous tumor.

label: benign phyllodes tumor
definition: A benign, circumscribed fibroepithelial neoplasm arising from the breast and rarely the prostate gland. It is characterized by the presence of epithelial structures which are arranged in clefts and by a hypercellular mesenchymal stroma which is organized in leaf-like structures. There is no evidence of cellular atypia or sarcomatous features.

label: benign perivascular tumor

label: benign glioma
definition: A form of glioma without malignant characteristics.
synonyms: glioma, benign

label: benign fibrous histiocytoma
definition: A benign neoplasm composed of fibroblastic spindle cells in a whorled storiform pattern. It is characterized by the presence of foam cells, inflammatory cells, hemosiderin deposition and stromal hemorrhage.
synonyms: benign fibrous histiocytoma; histiocytoma, fibrous, benign; fibrous histiocytoma NOS (morphologic abnormality); benign fibrous histiocytoma (morphologic abnormality); fibroxanthoma NOS (morphologic abnormality); fibrous histiocytoma; fibroxanthoma
crossreferences: ICDO:8830/0; MEDGEN:60199; NCIT:C3739; UMLS:C0206644; MESH:D018219; DOID:4415

label: benign female reproductive system neoplasm
definition: A non-metastasizing neoplasm that arises from the female reproductive system. Representative examples include uterine corpus leiomyoma, endocervical polyp, and benign ovarian germ cell tumor.
synonyms: benign female reproductive system neoplasm; benign female reproductive system tumor; benign gynecologic neoplasm; benign gynecologic tumor; benign gynecologic tumour; benign female reproductive system tumour; female reproductive organ benign neoplasm

definition: A non-metastasizing neoplasm that arises from the upper or lower eyelid.

label: benign epithelial neoplasm
definition: A neoplasm arising from the epithelial cells. It is characterized by the absence of morphologic features associated with malignancy (severe cytologic atypia, tumor cell necrosis, and high mitotic rate). Benign epithelial neoplasms remain confined to the original site of growth and only rarely metastasize to other anatomic sites.

definition: A non-metastasizing, functioning or non-functioning neoplasm that arises from an endocrine organ. Representative examples include thyroid gland follicular adenoma and parathyroid gland adenoma.

definition: A non-metastasizing eccrine appendage sweat gland neoplasm. Representative examples include hidrocystoma, syringoma, and syringofibroadenoma.

label: benign connective and soft tissue neoplasm
definition: A non-metastasizing neoplasm that arises from the connective and soft tissue. Representative examples include lipoma, leiomyoma, fibroma, and osteoma.
synonyms: benign neoplasm of the soft tissue and bone; benign tumor of the soft tissue and bone; benign connective and soft tissue neoplasm; benign connective and soft tissue tumour; connective and soft tissue neoplasm, benign; connective tissue benign neoplasm; benign tumour of the soft tissue and bone; benign mesenchymal cell neoplasm; benign connective and soft tissue tumor

label: benign conjunctival neoplasm
definition: Abnormal growth of the cells of the conjunctiva without malignant characteristics.
synonyms: benign tumour of conjunctiva; benign tumor of the conjunctiva; benign tumour of the conjunctiva; conjunctiva benign neoplasm; benign neoplasm of the conjunctiva; benign conjunctiva tumour; benign conjunctiva tumor; benign neoplasm of conjunctiva; benign conjunctival tumor; benign conjunctival neoplasm; benign tumor of conjunctiva; benign conjunctival tumour; benign conjunctiva neoplasm

label: benign colon neoplasm
definition: A non-metastasizing neoplasm arising from the wall of the colon.
synonyms: colon benign neoplasm; colonic Mass; benign tumour of the colon; benign colonic neoplasm; benign colon tumor; benign tumor of colon; benign colonic tumor; benign colon neoplasm; benign neoplasm of the colon; benign tumour of colon; benign neoplasm of colon; benign colon tumour; benign colonic tumour; benign tumor of the colon

label: benign chondrogenic neoplasm
definition: A non-metastasizing cartilaginous matrix-producing neoplasm characterized by the presence of neoplastic chondrocytes. Representative examples include osteochondroma and chondroma.
synonyms: benign chondrogenic tumor; benign tumor of cartilage; benign tumor of the cartilage; benign cartilaginous tumor; benign neoplasm of the cartilage; chondrogenic neoplasm, benign; benign chondrogenic neoplasm; benign tumour of the cartilage; benign chondrogenic tumour; benign cartilaginous neoplasm; benign cartilaginous tumour; benign tumour of cartilage; benign neoplasm of cartilage

label: benign blood vessel neoplasm
definition: A benign neoplasm arising from arteries or veins.
synonyms: benign blood vessel tumor; benign blood vessel neoplasm; benign blood vessel tumour

label: benign axillary neoplasm
definition: A non-metastasizing neoplasm that arises from the structures of the axilla.
synonyms: benign axillary neoplasm; axillary neoplasm, benign

label: benign PEComa
definition: A tumor with perivascular epithelioid cell differentiation characterized by the absence of pleomorphism and scarcity or absence of mitotic figures.
synonyms: benign PEComa, not otherwise specified; benign neoplasm with perivascular epithelioid cell differentiation; typical PEComa; benign PEComa, nos; benign PEComa; neoplasm with perivascular epithelioid cell differentiation, benign

label: basidiobolomycosis
definition: A disease caused by infection with Basidiobolus.
synonyms: Basidiobolus caused disease or disorder; infection caused by Basidiobolus; Basidiobolus infectious disease; Basidiobolus disease or disorder; basidiobolomycosis; infection by Basidiobolus

label: basaloid squamous cell carcinoma
definition: A squamous cell carcinoma characterized by the presence of cells with hyperchromatic nuclei, scant amount of cytoplasm, and peripheral nuclear palisading.
synonyms: basaloid squamous cell carcinoma (morphologic abnormality); basaloid squamous cell carcinoma

label: basaloid carcinoma
definition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm characterized by the presence of neoplastic cells with hyperchromatic nuclei, small amount of cytoplasm, and peripheral nuclear palisading.
synonyms: basaloid carcinoma

label: basal ganglia disorder
definition: A disease involving the basal ganglia.
synonyms: collection of basal ganglia disease or disorder; collection of basal ganglia disease; disease of collection of basal ganglia; disease of basal ganglia; disease or disorder of collection of basal ganglia; basal ganglia disease; disorder of collection of basal ganglia

label: basal cell neoplasm
definition: A neoplastic proliferation of basal cells in the epidermis (part of the skin) or other anatomic sites (most frequently the salivary glands). The basal cell neoplastic proliferation in the epidermis results in basal cell carcinomas. The basal cell neoplastic proliferation in the salivary glands can be benign, resulting in basal cell adenomas or malignant, resulting in basal cell adenocarcinomas.
synonyms: basal cell tumor; basal cell tumour

label: basal cell carcinoma
definition: A carcinoma involving the basal cells.
synonyms: malignant basal cell neoplasm; epithelioma, basal cell; basal cell cancer

label: bartonellosis
definition: An infectious disease produced by bacteria of the genus Bartonella.
synonyms: Bartonella caused disease or disorder; Bartonella infectious disease; Rochalimaea infection (disorder); bartonelliasis; Bartonella disease or disorder; Bartonella infection

label: bartholin gland squamous cell carcinoma
definition: A carcinoma that arises from the Bartholin gland and is characterized by the presence of malignant squamous epithelial cells.
synonyms: major vestibular gland squamous cell carcinoma; Bartholin's gland squamous cell carcinoma; bartholin gland squamous cell carcinoma

label: bartholin gland carcinoma
definition: A carcinoma that arises from the Bartholin gland. It usually affects women over fifty and presents with enlargement of the Bartholin gland. Various histologic subtypes have been identified and include adenocarcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma, adenoid cystic carcinoma, adenosquamous carcinoma, transitional cell carcinoma, and small cell carcinoma.
synonyms: Bartholin gland cancer; major vestibular gland carcinoma; carcinoma of major vestibular gland; bartholin gland carcinoma; Bartholin gland carcinoma (disease); carcinoma of the Bartholin's gland; Bartholin's gland cancer; carcinoma of Bartholin's gland; Bartholin's gland carcinoma

label: bacterial urinary tract infection
definition: A bacterial infectious process affecting any part of the urinary tract, most commonly the bladder and the urethra. Symptoms include urinary urgency and frequency, burning sensation during urination, lower abdominal discomfort, and cloudy urine.
synonyms: bacterial urinary tract infection (disease)

label: bacterial sexually transmitted disease
definition: Bacterial diseases that are potentially transmitted or propagated by sexual conduct.

label: bacterial pneumonia
definition: Acute infection of the lung parenchyma caused by bacteria (e.g., Streptococcus pneumoniae, Haemophilus influenzae, Chlamydia pneumoniae, Mycoplasma pneumoniae, and Legionella pneumophila). Signs and symptoms include productive cough, fever, chills, shortness of breath, and chest pain.
synonyms: Bacteria pneumonia; pneumonia due to other gram-negative bacteria; gram-negative pneumonia; Bacteria caused pneumonia

label: bacterial meningitis caused by gram-negative bacteria
synonyms: bacterial meningitis caused by gram-negative bacteria; bacterial meningitis due to gram-negative bacteria

label: bacterial meningitis
definition: Inflammation of the membranes surrounding the brain and spinal cord due to a bacterial infection.
synonyms: Bacteria infectious meningitis; Bacteria caused infectious meningitis

label: bacterial infectious disease with sepsis
definition: An infectious disease caused by bacteria causing sepsis.
synonyms: symptomatic bacteremia
crossreferences: MEDGEN:482; EFO:0003033; SCTID:5758002; DOID:0040085; ICD9:790.7; MESH:D016470; UMLS:C0004610; Wikipedia:Bacteremia

label: bacterial infectious disease
definition: An acute infectious disorder that is caused by gram positive or gram negative bacteria; representative examples include pneumococcal, streptococcal, salmonella, and meningeal infections.
synonyms: Bacteria caused disease or disorder; Bacteria infectious disease; bacterial infection; bacterial infectious disease; Bacteria disease or disorder; bacterial disorder; bacterial disease; infection, bacterial

label: bacterial hemorrhagic fever
definition: A hemorrhagic fever caused by bacteria. Bacterial hemorrhagic disease is rare. One example of a bacterial hemorrhagic disease is scrub typhus.
synonyms: haemorrhagic fever, bacterial; bacterial haemorrhagic fever

label: bacterial conjunctivitis
definition: Inflammation of the conjunctiva caused by a variety of bacterial agents.
synonyms: purulent conjunctivitis; Bacteria conjunctival disease; Bacteria caused conjunctival disease

label: bacterial arthritis
definition: The inflammation of one or more joints caused by a bacterial infection within the joint space. Symptoms include pain, stiffness, and decreased range of motion in the affected joint.
synonyms: septic arthritis; pyogenic arthritis

label: background diabetic retinopathy
definition: An early stage of diabetic retinopathy that is characterized by retinal hemorrhage and exudate, but without proliferation of the blood vessels.
synonyms: non-proliferative diabetic retinopathy; non proliferative diabetic retinopathy

label: axonal neuropathy
definition: Any nerve disorder affecting the axon of a nerve.
synonyms: peripheral neuropathy of axon; axon peripheral neuropathy; axonal neuropathy

label: axillary neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the structures of the axilla. Representative examples include axillary lipoma, axillary lymph node lymphoma, and metastatic carcinoma to the axillary lymph nodes.
synonyms: neoplasm of axilla; axilla tumor; axilla neoplasm; axillary neoplasm; tumor of axilla; tumour of axilla; axilla tumour

label: avascular necrosis
definition: Necrotic changes in the bone tissue due to interruption of blood supply. Most often affecting the epiphysis of the long bones, the necrotic changes result in the collapse and the destruction of the bone structure.
synonyms: avascular necrosis of bone; AVN

definition: Autosomal recessive form of ocular albinism (disease).
synonyms: autosomal recessive ocular albinism (disease); ocular albinism (disease), autosomal recessive; autosomal recessive ocular albinism

label: autosomal recessive disease
definition: Autosomal recessive form of disease.
synonyms: autosomal recessive inherited disorder; autosomal recessive inherited disease; disease, autosomal recessive; autosomal recessive disease or disorder; disease or disorder, autosomal recessive; autosomal recessive hereditary disorder; autosomal recessive hereditary disease

label: autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis
definition: Autosomal recessive form of inherited ichthyosis.
synonyms: inherited ichthyosis, autosomal recessive; ARCI; autosomal recessive inherited ichthyosis; ichthyosis, congenital, autosomal recessive

label: autosomal recessive cerebellar ataxia
definition: Autosomal recessive cerebellar ataxias (ARCA) are a heterogeneous group of rare neurological disorders involving both the central and peripheral nervous system (and in some cases other systems and organs), and characterized by degeneration or abnormal development of the cerebellum and spinal cord and, in most cases, early onset occurring before the age of 20 years.
synonyms: cerebellar ataxia, autosomal recessive; arca
subsets: mondo:gard_rare; mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:rare; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:otar

label: autosomal genetic disease
definition: A monogenic disease that is has material basis in a mutation in a single gene on one of the non-sex chromosomes.
synonyms: autosomal inherited disorder; autosomal inherited disease; autosomal hereditary disorder

label: autosomal dominant osteopetrosis
definition: Autosomal dominant form of osteopetrosis (disease).
synonyms: osteopetrosis (disease), autosomal dominant; autosomal dominant osteopetrosis (disease); OPTA

label: autosomal dominant disease
definition: Autosomal dominant form of disease.
synonyms: autosomal dominant inherited disorder; disease or disorder, autosomal dominant; autosomal dominant disease or disorder; disease, autosomal dominant; autosomal dominant hereditary disorder

label: autosomal dominant cerebellar ataxia
definition: A clinically and genetically heterogeneous group of neurodegenerative diseases characterized by a slowly progressive ataxia of gait, stance and limbs, dysarthria and/or oculomotor disorder, due to cerebellar degeneration in the absence of coexisting diseases. The degenerative process can be limited to the cerebellum (ADCA type 3) or may additionally involve the retina (ADCA type 2), optic nerve, ponto-medullary systems, basal ganglia, cerebral cortex, spinal tracts or peripheral nerves (ADCA type 1). In ACDA type 4, a cerebellar syndrome is associated with epilepsy.
synonyms: Autosomal Dominant Hereditary Ataxia; autosomal dominant spinocerebellar ataxia; cerebellar ataxia, autosomal dominant; ADCA
subsets: mondo:gard_rare; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:rare; mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:otar

label: autosomal anomaly
definition: Chromosomal disorder in which the chromosomal anomaly involves an autosome.
synonyms: autosome chromosomal anomaly; chromosomal anomaly of autosome

label: autonomic neuropathy
definition: An inherited or acquired peripheral neuropathy affecting the autonomic nervous system. It results in disruption of the involuntary body functions. Inherited causes include Fabry disease and porphyrias. Acquired causes include diabetes, uremia, hepatic disorders, vitamin deficiencies, toxins, and drug toxicities.
synonyms: autonomic peripheral neuropathy; peripheral neuropathy of autonomic nervous system; autonomic nervous system peripheral neuropathy

label: autonomic nervous system neoplasm
definition: Benign and malignant neoplasms which arise from or directly involve the central or peripheral elements of the autonomic nervous system.
synonyms: autonomic nervous system neoplasm (disease); tumor of the autonomic nervous system; tumour of the autonomic nervous system; autonomic nervous system tumor; autonomic nervous system neoplasm; autonomic nervous system neoplasms; tumour of autonomic nervous system; tumor of autonomic nervous system; neoplasm of autonomic nervous system; autonomic nervous system tumour; neoplasm of the autonomic nervous system

label: autonomic nervous system disorder
definition: A disease involving the autonomic nervous system.
synonyms: disorder of peripheral autonomic nervous system; disorder of autonomic nervous system; disease or disorder of autonomic nervous system; autonomic nervous disease; disorder of the autonomic nervous system; autonomic nervous system disorder; autonomic nervous system disease or disorder; disease of autonomic nervous system; autonomic nervous system disease

label: autoinflammatory syndrome
definition: A group of disorders of the innate immune system characterized by attacks of seemingly unprovoked inflammation without significant levels of either autoantibodies or autoreactive T cells more characteristic of autoimmune disease.
crossreferences: ICD10CM:M04-M04; MEDGEN:855741; NANDO:2100156; NCIT:C119050; UMLS:C3890737; Orphanet:93665; GARD:19234; MedDRA:10072220

label: autoimmune vasculitis
definition: An autoimmune form of vasculitis.

label: autoimmune thyroid disease
definition: Inflammatory disease of the thyroid gland due to autoimmune responses leading to lymphocytic infiltration of the gland. It is characterized by the presence of circulating thyroid antigen-specific T-cells and thyroid autoantibodies. The clinical signs can range from hypothyroidism to thyrotoxicosis depending on the type of autoimmune thyroiditis.
synonyms: autoimmune thyroid gland inflammation

label: autoimmune thrombocytopenia
definition: An autoimmune form of thrombocytopenia.
subsets: mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:rare; mondo:otar; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders

label: autoimmune pancreatitis
definition: Autoimmune pancreatitis (AIP) is a rare pancreatic disease characterized by chronic non-alcoholic pancreatitis that presents with abdominal pain, steatorrhea, obstructive jaundice and responds well to steroid therapy and is seen in two subforms: type 1 AIP which affects elderly males, involves other organs and has increased immunoglobin G4 (IgG4) levels and type 2 AIP which affects both sexes equally but presents at a younger age and has no other organ involvement or increased IgG4 levels.
synonyms: AIP

label: autoimmune hemolytic anemia, cold type
definition: Cold autoimmune hemolytic anemia comprises two types of autoimmune hemolytic anemia (AIHA) defined by the presence of cold autoantibodies (autoantibodies which are active at temperatures below 30B0C): cold agglutinin disease (CAD), which is the more common, and paroxysmal cold hemoglobinuria (PCH).
synonyms: cAHA; cAIHA; cold AIHA
subsets: mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:rare; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:otar; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders

label: autoimmune enteropathy
definition: Severe-immune mediated enteropathy describes a variety of intestinal disorders that can range from a serious, early-onset systemic disease (IPEX) to a mild isolated gastrointestinal disease. In children it manifests with severe diarrhea and dehydration in the presence of characteristic antibodies (anti-enterocyte and anti-goblet cell) and in adults with chronic diarrhea, malabsorption and weight loss.
synonyms: severe immune-mediated enteropathy; immune-mediated protracted diarrhea of infancy; immune-mediated protracted diarrhoea of infancy
subsets: mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:otar; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:rare

label: autoimmune encephalitis
definition: Inflammation of the brain secondary to an immune response triggered by the body itself.
synonyms: autoimmune encephalitis
crossreferences: NANDO:2100248; icd11.foundation:241281019; GARD:11979; Orphanet:622014; SCTID:95643007; NANDO:2200902; NCIT:C122414

label: autoimmune disorder of the nervous system
definition: A disorder characterized by the degeneration of the nervous system due to autoimmunity. Representative examples include multiple sclerosis, Guillain-Barre syndrome, and myasthenia gravis.
synonyms: immune disorders, nervous system; neurologic autoimmune diseases; autoimmune nervous system diseases; autoimmune diseases, neurologic; nervous system immune diseases; nervous system immune disorders; neurologic autoimmune disease; autoimmune disorders of the nervous system; autoimmune disease, neurologic; nervous system hypersensitivity reaction type II disease; immune diseases, nervous system; disease, neurologic autoimmune; autoimmune disease of nervous system; autoimmune disorders, nervous system; nervous system autoimmune disease; autoimmune nervous system disorder; autoimmune diseases, nervous system; nervous system autoimmune diseases; diseases, neurologic autoimmune

label: autoimmune disorder of peripheral nervous system
definition: A hypersensitivity reaction type II disease that involves the peripheral nervous system.
synonyms: peripheral nervous system hypersensitivity reaction type II disease; peripheral nervous system autoimmune disease

label: autoimmune disorder of musculoskeletal system
definition: A hypersensitivity reaction type II disease that involves the musculoskeletal system.
synonyms: musculoskeletal system autoimmune disease; musculoskeletal system hypersensitivity reaction type II disease

label: autoimmune disorder of gastrointestinal tract
definition: A hypersensitivity reaction type II disease that involves the alimentary part of gastrointestinal system.
synonyms: alimentary part of gastrointestinal system autoimmune disease; autoimmune disease of alimentary part of gastrointestinal system; alimentary part of gastrointestinal system hypersensitivity reaction type II disease

label: autoimmune disorder of exocrine system
definition: A hypersensitivity reaction type II disease that involves the exocrine system.
synonyms: exocrine system autoimmune disease; exocrine system hypersensitivity reaction type II disease

label: autoimmune disorder of endocrine system
definition: A hypersensitivity reaction type II disease that involves the endocrine system.
synonyms: endocrine system hypersensitivity reaction type II disease; endocrine system autoimmune disease

label: autoimmune disorder of central nervous system
definition: A hypersensitivity reaction type II disease that involves the central nervous system.
synonyms: central nervous system hypersensitivity reaction type II disease; central nervous system autoimmune disease

label: autoimmune disorder of cardiovascular system
definition: A hypersensitivity reaction type II disease that involves the cardiovascular system.
synonyms: cardiovascular system hypersensitivity reaction type II disease; cardiovascular system autoimmune disease

label: autoimmune disorder of blood
definition: A hypersensitivity reaction type II disease that involves the blood.
synonyms: blood autoimmune disease; blood hypersensitivity reaction type II disease

label: autoimmune disease of ear, nose and throat
definition: An autoimmune form of otorhinolaryngologic disease.
synonyms: autoimmune otorhinolaryngologic disease

label: autoimmune cardiomyopathy
definition: An autoimmune form of cardiomyopathy.

label: autoimmune bullous skin disease
definition: An autoimmune disease characterized by blisters on the skin.

label: auditory system disorder
definition: A disease involving the auditory system.
synonyms: disease of auditory system; disorder of auditory system; ear and mastoid disease; auditory disease; disease or disorder of auditory system; auditory system disease; auditory system disease or disorder

label: auditory system cancer
definition: A malignant neoplasm involving the auditory system
synonyms: cancer of auditory system; malignant auditory system neoplasm; auditory system cancer; malignant neoplasm of auditory system

label: auditory perceptual disorders
definition: Acquired or developmental cognitive disorders of AUDITORY PERCEPTION characterized by a reduced ability to perceive information contained in auditory stimuli despite intact auditory pathways. Affected individuals have difficulty with speech perception, sound localization, and comprehending the meaning of inflections of speech.
synonyms: sensory perception of sound disease; disorder of sensory perception of sound

label: auditory agnosia
definition: An agnosia that is a loss of the ability to distinguishing environmental and non-verbal auditory cues including difficulty distinguishing speech from non-speech sounds even though hearing is usually normal.

label: atypical polypoid adenomyoma
definition: An adenomyoma characterized by the presence of marked glandular architectural complexity.
synonyms: atypical polypoid adenomyoma (morphologic abnormality); atypical polypoid adenomyoma

label: atypical lipomatous tumor
definition: An intermediate, locally aggressive lipomatous neoplasm. Microscopically, the adipose tissue contains large and pleomorphic lipoblasts, and is dissected by fibrous septa containing spindle cells. It requires a wide local excision, may recur locally, but never metastasizes.
synonyms: lipoma-like liposarcoma; superficial well differentiated liposarcoma; liposarcoma, well differentiated (morphologic abnormality); well differentiated liposarcoma of superficial soft tissue; ALT; Atypical lipoma

label: attention deficit-hyperactivity disorder
definition: A disorder characterized by a marked pattern of inattention and/or hyperactivity-impulsivity that is inconsistent with developmental level and clearly interferes with functioning in at least two settings (e.g. at home and at school). When present, the symptoms of hyperactivity are most often present before the age of 7 years. There are three recognized presentations or subtypes from most to least common: combined type, inattentive/distractible type, hyperactive/impulsive type.
synonyms: attention deficit-hyperactivity disorder; attention deficit hyperactivity disorder; attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder

label: atrioventricular block
definition: A heart block that is initiated in the atrioventricular node.
synonyms: AV nodal block; AV block; atrioventricular block (disease); AVB; atrioventricular block

label: atrial tachycardia
definition: A disorder characterized by an electrocardiographic finding of an organized, regular atrial rhythm with atrial rate between 101 and 240 beats per minute. The P wave morphology must be distinct from the sinus P wave morphology. (CDISC)

label: atrial flutter
definition: A disorder characterized by an electrocardiographic finding of an organized, regular atrial rhythm with atrial rate of 240-340 beats per minute. Multiple P waves typically appear in the inferior leads in a saw tooth-like pattern between the QRS complexes. (CDISC)
synonyms: atrial flutter (disease); atrial flutter

label: atrial fibrillation
definition: A disorder characterized by an electrocardiographic finding of a supraventricular arrhythmia characterized by the replacement of consistent P waves by rapid oscillations or fibrillatory waves that vary in size, shape and timing and are accompanied by an irregular ventricular response. (CDISC)
synonyms: AF; AFib; atrial fibrillation (disease); A-fib; atrial fibrillation

label: atopic eczema
definition: A chronic inflammatory genetically determined disease of the skin marked by increased ability to form reagin (IgE), with increased susceptibility to allergic rhinitis and asthma, and hereditary disposition to a lowered threshold for pruritus. It is manifested by lichenification, excoriation, and crusting, mainly on the flexural surfaces of the elbow and knee. In infants it is known as infantile eczema.
synonyms: eczema; Atopic dermatitis; eczematous dermatitis; allergic form of dermatitis; Atopic neurodermatitis; atopic eczema; Besnier's prurigo; allergic dermatitis

label: atopic conjunctivitis
definition: Conjunctivitis due to hypersensitivity to various allergens.
synonyms: Atopic conjunctivitis; allergic form of conjunctivitis (disease); allergic conjunctivitis (disease); allergic conjunctivitis

label: atherosclerosis
definition: Build-up of fatty material and calcium deposition in the arterial wall resulting in partial or complete occlusion of the arterial lumen.
synonyms: atherosclerosis of artery; atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease

label: ataxic cerebral palsy
definition: A form of cerebral palsy caused by damage to cerebellar structures.

label: ataxia-telangiectasia-like disorder
definition: An autosomal recessive condition caused by mutation(s) in the MRE11A gene, encoding double-strand break repair protein MRE11. It is characterized by progressive cerebellar degeneration resulting in ataxia and oculomotor apraxia.
synonyms: ataxia-telangiectasia-like disorder type 1; ataxia - telangiectasia-like disorder; ATLD

label: atactic disorder
definition: A central nervous system disease that consists of gait impairment, unclear (“scanning”) speech, visual blurring due to nystagmus, hand incoordination, and tremor with movement.
synonyms: ataxic disorder

label: astrocytoma (excluding glioblastoma)
definition: A tumor of the brain or spinal cord showing astrocytic differentiation. It includes the following clinicopathological entities: pilocytic astrocytoma, diffuse astrocytoma, anaplastic astrocytoma, pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma, and subependymal giant cell astrocytoma.
synonyms: astrocytoma
crossreferences: SCTID:147101000119108; EFO:0000272; UMLS:C0004114; ICDO:9400/3; MESH:D001254; ONCOTREE:ASTR; NCIT:C60781; MEDGEN:438

label: astrocytic tumor
definition: A glial tumor of the brain or spinal cord showing astrocytic differentiation. It includes the following clinicopathological entities: pilocytic astrocytoma, diffuse astrocytoma, anaplastic astrocytoma, pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma, subependymal giant cell astrocytoma, and glioblastoma.
synonyms: astrocytic neoplasm; astrocytoma of brain; astroglioma; astrocytic tumor; astrocytoma, no ICD-O subtype

label: asthma

The symptoms appear due to a variety of triggers such as allergens, irritants, respiratory infections, weather changes, exercise, stress, reflux disease, medications, foods and emotional anxiety.

label: appendix adenoma
definition: A circumscribed neoplasm arising from the glandular epithelium of the appendix. Morphologically, it is characterized by a proliferation of neoplastic glandular cells and it is associated with dysplasia. According to the growth pattern, it may be classified as tubular, villous, or tubulovillous. The dysplasia is classified as mild, moderate, or severe.

label: apocrine adenoma
definition: A benign epithelial neoplasm arising from the apocrine sweat glands. Representative examples include tubular apocrine adenoma and external auditory canal ceruminous adenoma.

label: apocrine adenocarcinoma
definition: A carcinoma with apocrine differentiation arising from the sweat glands. It presents as single or multiple nodular lesions which may be ulcerated or hemorrhagic and is usually in the axilla and less often in the anogenital region. It grows in the dermis and infiltrates subcutaneous tissues. It is characterized by the presence of large cells with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm and large often vesicular nuclei. Most cases are slow growing tumors and have a prolonged course.
synonyms: carcinoma of apocrine gland; apocrine adenocarcinoma (morphologic abnormality); carcinoma of the apocrine gland; apocrine carcinoma; apocrine gland carcinoma; apocrine gland adenocarcinoma

label: aplastic anemia
definition: Anemia resulting from bone marrow failure (aplastic or hypoplastic bone marrow). The production of erythroblasts and red cells is markedly decreased, and it may be associated with decreased production of granulocytes (granulocytopenia) and platelets (thrombocytopenia) as well. Aplastic anemia may be idiopathic or secondary due to bone marrow damage by toxins, radiation, or immunologic factors.

label: aortic arch defects
definition: Congenital abnormalities of the aortic arch result from aberrant development of one or more components of the embyronic pharangeal arch system. Any component of this system can regress or persist abnormally, resulting in an extensive array of aortic arch anomalies. Clinically, they are classified by those that cause (or are likely to cause) physiolgogical abnormalities and those that do not. Physiologic abnormalities include tracheobronchial compression, esophageeal compression, and abnormal blood flow patteren.

label: aortic aneurysm

label: anxiety disorder
definition: A category of psychiatric disorders which are characterized by anxious feelings or fear often accompanied by physical symptoms associated with anxiety.
synonyms: anxiety disorder; anxiety state

label: anus sarcoma

synonyms: anus tumor; anal neoplasms, benign and malignant; tumour of anus; tumor of the anus; anal neoplasm; anus neoplasm (disease); neoplasm of anus; anal tumors; tumour of the anus; tumor of anus; anal tumours; anus tumour; anus neoplasm; anal tumor; neoplasm of the anus; anal tumour

label: antibody mediated epilepsy

label: anti-neutrophil cytoplasmic antibody-associated vasculitis
definition: Group of systemic vasculitis with a strong association with anca. The disorders are characterized by necrotizing inflammation of small and medium size vessels, with little or no immune-complex deposits in vessel walls.

label: anthrax infection
definition: An infection caused by Bacillus anthracis bacteria. It may affect the lungs, gastrointestinal tract, or skin. Patients with lung infection present with fever, headaches, cough, chest pain and shortness of breath. Patients with gastrointestinal infection present with nausea, vomiting and bloody diarrhea. Patients with skin infection develop blisters and ulcers.
synonyms: Bacillus anthracis infectious disease; anthrax; Bacillus anthracis caused disease or disorder; Bacillus anthracis disease or disorder

label: anterolateral myocardial infarction
definition: Myocardial infarction in which the anterior wall of the heart is involved. Anterior wall myocardial infarction is often caused by occlusion of the left anterior descending coronary artery. It can be categorized as anteroseptal or anterolateral wall myocardial infarction.
synonyms: anterolateral myocardial infarction

label: anterior ischemic optic neuropathy
definition: Anterior ischemic optic neuropathy (AION) is an eye disease characterized by infarction of the optic disk leading to vision loss. It can be nonarteritic (nonarteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy or NAION) or arteritic, the latter being associated with giant cell arteritis (GCA; often termed temporal arteritis). Vision loss with both varieties is typically rapid (over minutes, hours, or days) and painless. Symptoms such as a general feeling of being unwell (malaise), muscle aches and pains, headaches over the temple, pain when combing hair, pain in the jaw after chewing, and tenderness over the temporal artery (one of the major arteries of the head) may be present with giant cell arteritis. At exam, visual acuity is reduced and the optic disk is swollen. In both subtypes, visual field examination is often reduced in the inferior and central visual fields. The visual loss is usually permanent, with some recovery possibly occurring within the first weeks or months. The arteritic variety is treated with corticosteroids. Treatment of the nonarteritic variety withaspirinor corticosteroids has not been helpful.
synonyms: ischemic optic neuropathy; ischaemic optic neuropathy

label: anterior horn disorder
definition: Anterior horn disease is one of a number of medical disorders affecting the anterior horn of the spinal cord. Anterior horn diseases include spinal muscular atrophy, poliomyelitis and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.
synonyms: ventral horn of spinal cord disease or disorder; disease of ventral horn of spinal cord; ventral horn of spinal cord disease; disorder of ventral horn of spinal cord; disease or disorder of ventral horn of spinal cord

label: anosmia
definition: Loss of or impaired ability to smell. This may be caused by olfactory nerve diseases; paranasal sinus diseases; viral respiratory tract infections; craniocerebral trauma; smoking; and other conditions.

label: angiomyolipoma
definition: A neoplasm with perivascular epithelioid cell differentiation often associated with tuberous sclerosis. It is characterized by a mixture of epithelioid cells, smooth muscle, vessels, and mature adipose tissue. The kidney is the most common site of involvement. Other sites of involvement include the liver, lung, lymph nodes, and retroperitoneum. The vast majority of cases follow a benign clinical course. However, cases of metastatic angiomyolipomas with sarcomatoid features have been described.
synonyms: angiomyolipoma (morphologic abnormality)

label: angiomatosis
definition: A benign diffuse vascular proliferation usually occurring in young adults. It is characterized by the formation of capillary-sized and cavernous vascular spaces. Patients present with diffuse persistent swelling.
synonyms: multiple hemangiomas; angiomatosis; diffuse angiomatosis; diffuse hemangioma

label: angiolipoma
definition: A lipoma with prominent vascularity. The vascular tissue is more abundant at the periphery of the tumor and contains fibrin thrombi. It occurs more frequently in younger individuals as a painful subcutaneous nodule, often on the arms.
synonyms: angiolipoma, benign

label: angioleiomyoma
definition: A benign, slow-growing neoplasm that arises from the dermis or subcutaneous tissue. It is characterized by the presence of well-differentiated smooth muscle cells which are arranged around numerous vessels.
synonyms: angioleiomyoma; angiomyoma; angiomyoma (morphologic abnormality); vascular leiomyoma

label: angiokeratoma of Fordyce
definition: An angiokeratoma that is located on the scrotum or vulva.
synonyms: Fordyce's spot; Fordyce angiokeratoma

label: angiokeratoma
definition: A vascular lesion in the papillary dermis resulting from ectasia of pre-existing vessels. It is associated with secondary proliferative changes in the overlying epidermis (hyperkeratosis). It can present with widespread lesions (angiokeratoma corporis diffusum, often associated with inborn errors of metabolism) or as a localized lesion (angiokeratoma of Fordyce, angiokeratoma circumscriptum, and angiokeratoma of Mibelli).
synonyms: skin angiokeratoma; angiokeratoma of skin; cutaneous angiokeratoma; angiokeratoma (morphologic abnormality); angiokeratoma of the skin

label: angioedema

label: angiodysplasia
definition: Acquired degenerative dilation or expansion (ectasia) of normal blood vessels, often associated with aging. They are isolated, tortuous, thin-walled vessels and sources of bleeding. They occur most often in mucosal capillaries of the gastrointestinal tract leading to gastrointestinal hemorrhage and anemia.

label: aneuploidy
definition: Chromosomal disorder consisting of the presence a chromosomal abnormality in which there is an addition or loss of chromosomes within a set.

definition: Any form of anemia that results from the absence of, or the defective action of, any enzyme involved in erythropoiesis.

label: anemia due to enzyme disorder
definition: Any form of anemia that results from the absence of, or the defective action of, any enzyme.
synonyms: anemia due to enzyme disorder

label: anemia
definition: A reduction in the number of red blood cells, the amount of hemoglobin, and/or the volume of packed red blood cells. Clinically, anemia represents a reduction in the oxygen-transporting capacity of a designated volume of blood, resulting from an imbalance between blood loss (through hemorrhage or hemolysis) and blood production. Signs and symptoms of anemia may include pallor of the skin and mucous membranes, shortness of breath, palpitations of the heart, soft systolic murmurs, lethargy, and fatigability.
synonyms: anemia; anaemia (disease); anemia (disease)

label: androgenetic alopecia
synonyms: alopecia androgenetica, male pattern baldness; androgenetic alopecia

label: anaplastic pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma
definition: A malignant astrocytoma that is characterized by the presence of five or more mitoses per 10 high-power fields.

label: anaplastic cancer
synonyms: anaplastic malignant neoplasm

label: anaplasmosis
definition: A disease or disorder caused by infection with Anaplasma.
synonyms: anaplasma caused disease or disorder; human anaplasmosis; anaplasma disease or disorder; anaplasmoses; anaplasma infectious disease

label: anaphylaxis
definition: An acute hypersensitivity reaction that occurs from exposure to an allergen. It results from the release of histamine and histamine-like substances from mast cells, and can present with breathing difficulty due to narrowed airways, dizziness and hypotension, skin rash, weak pulse, nausea and vomiting.
synonyms: anaphylactic shock; systemic anaphylaxis

label: anal squamous cell carcinoma
definition: A squamous cell carcinoma (SCC) arising from the anal canal or the anal margin (perianal skin). Human papillomavirus is detected in the majority of cases. Homosexual HIV-positive men have an increased risk of developing anal squamous cell carcinoma in comparison to the general male population. Symptoms include anal pruritus, discomfort when sitting, pain, change in bowel habit, and bleeding. The prognosis is generally better for anal margin SCC than for anal canal SCC.

label: anal polyp

label: anal margin squamous cell carcinoma

synonyms: cancer of anal canal; malignant neoplasm of anal canal; malignant anal canal neoplasm; anal canal cancer

label: anal Paget disease
definition: A slowly spreading, erythematous eczematoid plaque in the anal region. Histologically, the basal part or whole thickness of the squamous epithelium is infiltrated by large cells with abundant pale cytoplasm and large nuclei. Half of the cases are associated with an internal malignancy, most often a colorectal adenocarcinoma. The other half of the cases, have a high local recurrence rate and they may become invasive (WHO).
synonyms: anal Paget's disease; anus Paget disease; anus mammary Paget's disease; anal Paget disease; Paget disease of the anus; Paget's disease of anus; Paget's disease of the anus

label: amyloidosis
definition: A disorder characterized by the localized or diffuse accumulation of amyloid protein in various anatomic sites. It may be primary, due to clonal plasma cell proliferations; secondary, due to long standing infections, chronic inflammatory disorders, or malignancies; or familial. It may affect the nerves, skin, tongue, joints, heart, liver, spleen, kidneys and adrenal glands.
synonyms: amyloidosis; amyloidosis (disease); amyloid; amyloidoses; amyloid disease

label: allergic rhinitis
definition: Inflammation of the nasal mucous membranes caused by an IgE-mediated response to external allergens. The inflammation may also involve the mucous membranes of the sinuses, eyes, middle ear, and pharynx. Symptoms include sneezing, nasal congestion, rhinorrhea, and itching. It may lead to fatigue, drowsiness, and malaise thus causing impairment of the quality of life.

label: allergic disease

It can be associated with the overproduction of glucocorticoids (Cushing's syndrome), androgenic or estrogenic steroids (adrenogenital syndrome), or mineralocorticoids (Conn's syndrome). (Sternberg Diagnostic Surgical Pathology, 3rd ed.)

definition: A carcinoma composed of malignant glandular cells and malignant squamous cells.

definition: An adenosquamous carcinoma that arises from the bile ducts.
