label: Littre gland carcinoma
definition: A carcinoma involving a male urethral gland.
synonyms: carcinoma of LittrC) glands; carcinoma of Littré glands; male urethral gland carcinoma; carcinoma of Littre glands; carcinoma of male urethral gland

label: Leydig cell tumor
definition: A sex cord-stromal tumor occurring in the testis and rarely in the ovary. It is predominantly or completely composed of Leydig cells which may contain crystals of Reinke. In males it usually presents as a painless testicular enlargement and it may be associated with gynecomastia and decreased libido. The majority of the cases have a benign clinical course. Approximately 10% of the cases have a malignant clinical course and metastasize. In females it may be associated with androgenic manifestations and it follows a benign clinical course.
synonyms: interstitial cell neoplasm; Leydig cell tumor; interstitial cell tumor; interstitial cell tumour; Leydig cell neoplasm

label: Leber hereditary optic neuropathy, autosomal recessive
synonyms: LHONAR; Leber hereditary optic neuropathy, autosomal recessive

label: Langerhans cell histiocytosis specific to childhood
definition: Langerhans cell histiocytosis that occurs during childhood.
synonyms: histiocytosis X specific to childhood; childhood Langerhans cell histiocytosis; Langerhans cell granulomatosis specific to childhood

label: Langerhans cell histiocytosis specific to adulthood
definition: Langerhans cell histiocytosis that occurs during adulthood.
synonyms: adult Langerhans cell histiocytosis; Langerhans cell granulomatosis specific to adulthood; histiocytosis X specific to adulthood

label: LTBP2-related ocular dysgenesis
definition: Any ocular dysgenesis disorder in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the LTBP2 gene.

label: L-cell glucagon-like peptide-producing neuroendocrine tumor
definition: A neuroendocrine tumor that arises from the gastrointestinal tract and produces glucagon-like peptides. Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of neoplastic cells forming tubular or trabecular patterns.
synonyms: L-cell glucagon-like peptide-producing NET; L-cell glucagon-like peptide-producing neuroendocrine tumor

label: Klebsiella infectious disease
definition: Infections with bacteria of the genus KLEBSIELLA.
synonyms: Klebsiella disease or disorder; Klebsiella caused disease or disorder

label: KIZ-related retinopathy
definition: Any retinopathy caused by variants in the KIZ gene.
synonyms: KIZ-related retinopathy

label: KIF7-related ciliopathy
definition: A spectrum of ciliopathy disorders that typically show autosomal recessive inheritance and includes Al-Gazali-Bakalinova syndrome, hydrolethalus syndrome 2, acrocallosal syndrome, Joubert syndrome 12.
synonyms: KIF7-related ciliopathy

label: KIF1A related neurological disorder
definition: KIF1A-associated neurological disorder (KAND) encompasses a group of rare neurodegenerative conditions caused by variants in KIF1A
synonyms: KIF1A neurological disorder; KAND; neurological disorder caused by variation in KIF1A; neurological disorder caused by mutation in KIF1A

label: Joubert syndrome and related disorders
definition: Joubert syndrome (JS) and related disorders (JSRD) are a group of developmental delay/multiple congenital anomaly syndromes in which the mandatory feature is the \molar tooth sign'' (MTS), a complex midbrain-hindbrain malformation recognizable on brain imaging. The MTS is characterized by cerebellar vermis hypodysplasia, thickening and malorientation of the superior cerebellar peduncles and abnormally deep interpeduncular fossa."
synonyms: JSRD; Joubert syndrome and related disorders
subsets: mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:rare; mondo:otar; mondo:gard_rare

label: IgG4-related disease
definition: A recently described mass-forming lesion that occurs in the pancreas, submandibular glands, lacrimal glands, lymph nodes, and hepatobiliary tract. It is characterized by the presence of marked tissue sclerosis and infiltration by numerous plasma cells. The plasma cells show immunohistochemical staining for IgG4 and the serum IgG4 levels are often increased.
synonyms: IgG4-RD; IgG4-related systemic disease; IgG4-related sclerosing disease; Immunoglobulin G4-related sclerosing disease
subsets: mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:orphanet_rare; mondo:ordo_disorder; mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:rare; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:otar
crossreferences: UMLS:C3203653; NANDO:1200924; NANDO:1200923; Orphanet:284264; MEDGEN:473761; GARD:12521; MedDRA:10071569; DOID:0080356; Orphanet:596448; icd11.foundation:99883782; NCIT:C95992

label: IRF6-related condition
definition: Van der Woude syndrome, popliteal pterygium syndrome, cleft lip with or without palate, or a spectrum of one or two of those conditions in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the IRF6 gene.

label: IMPG2-related recessive retinopathy
definition: Any retinopathy caused by bi-allelic variants in the IMPG2 gene.
synonyms: IMPG2-related recessive retinopathy

label: IMPG2-related dominant retinopathy
definition: Any retinopathy caused by a heterozygous variant in the IMPG2 gene.
synonyms: IMPG2-related dominant retinopathy

label: IFIH1-related type 1 interferonopathy
definition: Any type 1 interferonopathies in which the cause of the disease is a variation in the IFIH1 gene. Individuals with variants in IFIH1 can present with a variety of phenotypes, including Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome and singleton-Merten syndrome.

label: IDH-mutant and 1p/19q-codeleted oligodendroglioma
definition: An anaplastic oligodendroglioma that has material basis in IDH gene family mutation and combined whole-arm losses of 1p and 19q (1p/19q codeletion).

label: IDH-mutant anaplastic astrocytoma
definition: An anaplastic astrocytoma carrying IDH mutations.

label: Huntington disease-like syndrome
synonyms: Huntington disease phenocopy syndrome

label: Huntington disease and related disorders
definition: A grouping for Huntington disease and similar diseases.

label: Horner syndrome
definition: Horner's syndrome is a rare condition characterized by miosis (constriction of thepupil), ptosis (drooping of the upper eyelid), and anhidrosis (absence of sweating of the face). It iscaused by damage to the sympathetic nerves of the face. The underlying causes of Horner's syndrome vary greatly and may include a tumor, stroke, or other damage to a part of the brain called the brain stem ; injury to the carotid artery ;and trauma to the brachial plexus. In rare cases, Horner's syndrome is congenital (present from birth) and associated with a lack of pigmentation of the iris (colored part of the eye). Treatment of Horner's syndrome depends on the underlying cause.
synonyms: cervical sympathetic paralysis; Horner syndrome; Horner's syndrome; Bernard Horner syndrome

label: Hodgkins lymphoma
definition: Hodgkin lymphoma (HL) is a heterogeneous group of malignant lymphoid neoplasms of B-cell origin characterized histologically by the presence of Hodgkin and Reed-Sternberg (HRS) cells in the vast majority of cases. There are two distinct subtypes: nodular lymphocyte predominant Hodgkin lymphoma and classical Hodgkin lymphoma. Hodgkin lymphoma involves primarily lymph nodes.
synonyms: Hodgkin's disease; Hodgkin's Disease; Hodgkin disease; HL; Hodgkin lymphoma; Hodgkin's lymphoma; Hodgkins lymphoma
subsets: mondo:otar; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:rare; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:disease_grouping

label: Histoplasma capsulatum infectious disease
definition: An disease or disorder caused by infection with Histoplasma capsulatum.
synonyms: Histoplasma capsulatum disease or disorder; Histoplasma capsulatum caused disease or disorder; infection by Histoplasma capsulatum

label: Herpesviridae infectious disease
definition: Virus diseases caused by the herpesviridae.
synonyms: Herpesviridae infections; Herpesviridae caused disease or disorder; Herpesviridae disease or disorder; herpesvirus infection

label: Hepadnaviridae infectious disease
definition: Virus diseases caused by the hepadnaviridae.
synonyms: Hepadnaviridae caused disease or disorder; Hepadnaviridae disease or disorder

label: HIV infectious disease
definition: An infection caused by the human immunodeficiency virus.
synonyms: Human immunodeficiency virus caused disease or disorder; HIV infection; Human immunodeficiency virus infectious disease; Human immunodeficiency virus disease or disorder

label: HER2 positive breast carcinoma
definition: A biologic subset of breast carcinoma defined by high expression of HER2, GRB7, and TRAP100, and by lack of expression of estrogen receptor (ER).
synonyms: ERBB2 Overexpressing subtype of breast carcinoma; Her2-receptor positive breast cancer; HER2 positive breast carcinoma; HER2 Overexpressing breast carcinoma; HER2 Overexpressing subtype of breast carcinoma; HER2 Positive breast cancer

label: Graves disease
definition: Graves' disease is an autoimmune disorder that leads to overactivity of the thyroid gland (hyperthyroidism).It is caused by an abnormal immune system response that causes the thyroid gland to produce too much thyroid hormones. Graves disease is the most common cause of hyperthyroidism andoccurs mostoften in women over age 20. However, the disorder may occur at any age and may affect males as well.Treatmentmayinclude radioiodine therapy, antithyroid drugs, and/or thyroid surgery.
synonyms: exophthalmic goiter; grave's disease; exophthalmic goitre; Graves disease

label: GUCY2D retinopathy
definition: Any inherited retinal dystrophy in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the GUCY2D gene.
synonyms: retinopathy caused by mutation in GUCY2D

label: GATA6-related congenital heart disease with or without pancreatic agenesis or neonatal diabetes
definition: A congenital heart disease that is present at birth. Representative examples include atrial septal defect 9, conotruncal heart malformations, tetralogy of Fallot, ventricular septal defect, atrioventricular septal defect, bicuspid aortic valve, transposition of the great arteries, persistent truncus arteriosus, congenital heart disease with pancreatic agenesis, and congenital heart disease with neonatal diabetes.
synonyms: GATA6 related congenital heart disease with or without pancreatic agenesis or neonatal diabetes

label: GATA5-related congenital heart defects
definition: A congenital heart disease that is present at birth. Representative examples include tetralogy of fallot, bicuspid aortic valve, atrial septal defect, double outlet right ventricle, ventricular septal defect, and coarctation of the aorta, and atrioventricular canal.
synonyms: GATA5 related congenital heart defects

label: Fusobacteriaceae infectious disease
definition: Infections with bacteria of the family Fusobacteriaceae, in the order Fusobacterales, phylum fusobacteria.
synonyms: Fusobacteriaceae caused disease or disorder; Fusobacteriaceae disease or disorder

label: Flaviviridae infectious disease
definition: Infections with viruses of the family flaviviridae.
synonyms: Flaviviridae caused disease or disorder; Flaviviridae disease or disorder

label: Filoviridae infectious disease
definition: Infections with viruses of the family filoviridae. The infections in humans consist of a variety of clinically similar viral hemorrhagic fevers but the natural reservoir host is unknown.
synonyms: Filoviridae disease or disorder; Filoviridae caused disease or disorder

label: Fanconi renotubular syndrome
definition: A genetic or acquired disorder characterized by impairment of the function of the proximal tubules of the kidney. It results in decreased reabsorption of electrolytes, glucose, amino acids, and other nutrients.
synonyms: Fanconi's syndrome; De toni-Fanconi syndrome; Fanconi-de toni syndrome; De toni-debre-Fanconi syndrome; Fanconi-de-toni syndrome; Lignac-Fanconi syndrome; deToni Fanconi syndrome; Fanconi syndrome

label: FHL1-related myopathy
definition: A group of myopathies that includes Emery-Dreifuss muscular dystrophy (EDMD), and two allelic disorders characterized by the presence of reducing body on histopathology, namely reducing body myopathy (RBM) and scapuloperoneal myopathy.
synonyms: FHL1-related myopathy

label: FGFR3-related chondrodysplasia
subsets: mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:otar; mondo:rare; mondo:nord_rare; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders

label: FG syndrome
definition: FG syndrome (FGS) is a genetic condition that affects many parts of the body and occurs almost exclusively in males. 'FG' represents the surname initials of the firstindividuals diagnosed with the disorder.People withFG syndrome frequently have intellectual disability ranging from mild to severe, hypotonia, constipation and/or anal anomalies, a distinctive facial appearance, broad thumbs and great toes,alarge head compared to body size (relative macrocephaly), and abnormalities of the corpus callosum. Medical problems including heart defects, seizures, undescended testicle, and an inguinal hernia have also been reported in some affected individuals. Researchers have identified five regions of the X chromosome that are linked to FG syndrome in affected families. Mutations in the MED12 gene appears to be the most common cause of this disorder, leading to FG syndrome 1. Other genes involved with FG syndrome include FLNA (FGS2), CASK (FGS4), UPF3B (FGS6), and BRWD3 (FGS7).FGS is inherited in an X-linked recessive pattern.Individualized early intervention and educational services are important so that each child can reach their fullest potential.
synonyms: Keller syndrome
crossreferences: UMLS:C0220769; SCTID:49984004; icd11.foundation:156523187; MEDGEN:113106; OMIMPS:305450; DOID:14711; ICD9:759.89; Orphanet:323; EFO:0009297

label: Ewing sarcoma/peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor of bone
definition: A spectrum of malignant tumors arising from the bone and characterized morphologically by the presence of small round cells. Ewing sarcoma and peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor represent the ends of a spectrum, with Ewing sarcoma lacking evidence of neural differentiation and the markers that characterize the peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor. Ewing sarcoma and peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor may share cytogenetic abnormalities, proto-oncogene expression, cell culture and immunohistochemical abnormalities. Pain and the presence of a mass are the most common clinical symptoms.
synonyms: bone tissue Ewing sarcoma/peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumour; Ewing's sarcoma/peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor of bone; bone tissue Ewing sarcoma/peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor; Ewing's sarcoma/peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumour of bone; Ewing sarcoma/peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor of bone

label: Ewing sarcoma/peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor
definition: A spectrum of malignant tumors, affecting mostly males under age 20, characterized morphologically by the presence of small round cells. Ewing sarcoma and peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor represent the ends of a spectrum, with Ewing sarcoma lacking evidence of neural differentiation and the markers that characterize the peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor. Ewing sarcoma and peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor may share cytogenetic abnormalities, proto-oncogene expression, cell culture and immunohistochemical abnormalities. These tumors may occur in the soft tissues or the bones. Pain and the presence of a mass are the most common clinical symptoms.
synonyms: Ewing sarcoma family of tumours; tumors of Ewing's family; Ewing family of tumours; tumours of the Ewing's family; Ewing's sarcoma/peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumour; Ewing sarcoma/peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor; tumors of the Ewing's family; Ewing's family of tumours; Ewing's family of tumors; Ewing sarcoma/peripheral PNET; Ewing sarcoma family of tumors; Ewing's sarcoma/peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor; Ewing family of tumors; tumours of Ewing's family; EFTs

label: Erysipelothrix infectious disease
definition: Infections with bacteria of the genus erysipelothrix.
synonyms: Erysipelothrix disease or disorder; Erysipelothrix caused disease or disorder

label: Epstein-Barr virus-related tumor
synonyms: EBV-related tumour; EBV-related tumor

label: Epstein-Barr virus-associated mesenchymal tumor
synonyms: EBV-associated mesenchymal tumour; EBV-associated mesenchymal tumor

label: Epstein-Barr virus-associated malignant lymphoproliferative disorder
synonyms: EBV-associated lymphoproliferative disorder

label: Epstein-Barr virus-associated carcinoma
synonyms: EBV-associated carcinoma

label: Epstein-Barr virus infection
definition: An infection that is caused by Epstein-Barr virus.
synonyms: Human gammaherpesvirus 4 disease or disorder; EBV infection; Human gammaherpesvirus 4 infectious disease; Epstein-Barr Virus infection; Human gammaherpesvirus 4 caused disease or disorder

label: Enterococcus infectious disease
definition: A bacterial disease caused by infection with Enterococcus.
synonyms: Enterococcus caused disease or disorder

label: Enoplea infectious disease
definition: Infections with nematodes of the order enoplida.
synonyms: Enoplea disease or disorder; Enoplea caused disease or disorder

label: EZB diffuse large B-cell lymphoma
definition: A diffuse large B-cell lymphoma that is categorized as EZB with high probability by the LymphGen algorithm. This is based on a combination of genetic features and EZB DLBCLs often, but do not always, have hot spot mutations in EZH2 and/or a BCL2 translocation. This class can be further subdivided into two sub-classes EZB-MYC+ and EZB-MYC- using the double hit gene expression signature (DHITsig). This subgroup also commonly has mutations due to aberrant somatic hypermutation affecting IRF8, which can be coding or non-coding.

label: EWSR1-negative small round cell tumor
definition: A small cell sarcoma that is characterized by the absence of EWSR1 rearrangement and the presence of small round malignant cells with a small amount of cytoplasm.

label: EN1-related dorsoventral syndrome
definition: A human mesomelic and rhizo-mesomelic dysplasia characterized by marked mesomelic shortening of the lower limbs, cutaneous syndactyly and nail abnormalities (placed on the palmar side of the finger, dysplastic or absent) in hands and feet due mutations in EN1 gene. Other clinical features may include genitourinary abnormalities (including bilateral cryptorchidism, vesicoureteral reflux, hydronephrosis, hypoplastic labia majora), spasticity and seizures.
synonyms: ENDOVES; ENDOVE syndrome

label: ELOVL4-related maculopathy
definition: Any maculopathy caused by a variant in the ELOVL4 gene.
synonyms: ELOVL4-related maculopathy

label: EBV-positive T-cell lymphoproliferative disorder of childhood
definition: An Epstein-Barr virus-associated mature T-cell lymphoproliferative group of disorders affecting children. It occurs with increased frequency in Asians and Native Americans. It includes the systemic EBV-positive T-cell lymphoma of childhood and the hydroa vacciniforme-like lymphoma.
synonyms: EBV-positive T-cell lymphoproliferative disease of childhood; EBV-positive T-cell lymphoproliferative disorder of childhood

label: Dengue hemorrhagic fever
definition: A serious condition caused by Dengue virus infection. Patients present with an acute febrile illness followed by restlessness, irritability, and bleeding. It may lead to hemorrhagic shock and death.
synonyms: DHF

label: DNA repair disease
definition: A disease that has its basis in the disruption of DNA repair.
synonyms: deficiency of DNA repair; DNA repair disorder; disorder of DNA repair

label: Cushing syndrome
definition: Cushing's syndrome (CS) encompasses a group of hormonal disorders caused by prolonged and high exposure levels to glucocorticoids that can be of either endogenous (adrenal cortex production) or exogenous (iatrogenic) origin.
synonyms: hyperadrenocorticism; cortisol Excess; pituitary basophilism; suprarenogenic syndrome; Cushing syndrome; Cushing's syndrome
crossreferences: MEDGEN:3681; icd11.foundation:1654321425; NCIT:C2969; MedDRA:10020610; MESH:D000308; EFO:0003099; GARD:6224; UMLS:C0010481; ICD9:255.0; MESH:D003480; MedDRA:10020564; MedDRA:10020562; ICD10CM:E24; MedDRA:10011652; Orphanet:553

label: Creutzfeldt Jacob disease
definition: A rare transmittable degenerative disorder of the brain caused by prions. Morphologically it is characterized by spongiform degeneration of the cerebral and cerebellar cortex. Signs and symptoms include sleep disturbances, personality changes, aphasia, ataxia, muscle atrophy and weakness, visual loss, and myoclonus. It usually leads to death within a year from the onset of the disease.
synonyms: Subacute spongiform encephalopathy; Jakob-Creutzfeldt disease; Creutzfeldt Jakob Disease; CJD (Creutzfeldt Jakob disease); classic Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease; Creutzfeldt-Jacob disease; transmissible virus dementia; CJD; Creutzfeldt Jacob syndrome; Creutzfeldt Jakob disease

label: Coronaviridae infectious disease
definition: Virus diseases caused by coronaviridae.

label: Clostridium infectious disease
definition: Infections with bacteria of the genus clostridium.

label: Ciliophora infectious disease
definition: Infections with protozoa of the phylum ciliophora.
synonyms: Ciliophora caused disease or disorder; Ciliophora disease or disorder

label: Chiari malformation
definition: A rare genetic brain malformation characterized by displacement of the brain stem and cerebellum through the foramen magnum. It may result in hydrocephalus.
synonyms: Chiari malformation; Arnold-Chiari malformation; (Arnold) Chiari malformation

label: Cestode infectious disease
definition: Infections with true tapeworms of the helminth subclass Cestoda.
synonyms: Cestoda caused disease or disorder; Cestoda disease or disorder; Cestoda infectious disease; cestode infection

label: Caliciviridae infectious disease
definition: Virus diseases caused by caliciviridae. They include hepatitis E; vesicular exanthema of swine; acute respiratory infections in felines, rabbit hemorrhagic disease, and some cases of gastroenteritis in humans.

label: CYP1B1-related glaucoma with or without anterior segment dysgenesis
definition: Any primary congenital glaucoma in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the CYP1B1 gene.

label: CTNNB1-related neurodevelopmental disorder and/or vitreoretinopathy
definition: Any neurodevelopmental disorder and/or exudative vitreoretinopathy caused by a monoallelic variant in the CTNNB1 gene. Variants in CTNNB1 are related to a neurodevelopmental condition with a broad spectrum of presentations ranging from isolated vitreoretinopathy to a complex neurodevelopmental disorder with mild to severe intellectual disability, microcephaly, spasticity, autism spectrum disorder, and visual defects, including retinal detachment, and abnormal retinal vascularization.

label: COL4A1-related disorder
definition: The spectrum of COL4A1-related disorders includes small-vessel brain disease of varying severity including porencephaly, variably associated with eye defects (retinal arterial tortuosity, Axenfeld-Rieger anomaly, cataract) and systemic findings (kidney involvement, muscle cramps, cerebral aneurysms, Raynaud phenomenon, cardiac arrhythmia, and hemolytic anemia).
synonyms: COL4A1-related disorders

label: CNS demyelinating autoimmune disease
definition: Conditions characterized by loss or dysfunction of myelin (see myelin sheath) in the brain, spinal cord, or optic nerves secondary to autoimmune mediated processes. This may take the form of a humoral or cellular immune response directed toward myelin or oligodendroglia associated autoantigens.

label: CACNA2D4-related retinopathy
definition: Any retinopathy caused by variants in the CACNA2D4 gene.
synonyms: CACNA2D4-related retinopathy

label: CACNA1F-related retinopathy
definition: Any retinopathy caused by a variant in the CACNA1F gene.
synonyms: CACNA1F-related retinopathy

label: CACNA1A-related complex neurodevelopmental disorder
definition: A progressive complex neurodevelopmental condition caused by variants in the CACNA1A gene. Phenotypic onset (usually) occurs around age 1 and most often includes intellectual disability but can also include epileptic encephalopathy, benign paroxysmal torticollis of infancy and paroxysmal tonic upgaze psychomotor delay, learning difficulties, absence epilepsy, episodic ataxia, and hemiplegic migraines.

label: Buschke Lowenstein tumor
definition: A verrucous carcinoma of the skin or mucosa that occurs in the anogenital region.
synonyms: Buschke Lowenstein tumor

label: Bunyaviridae infectious disease
definition: Virus diseases caused by the bunyaviridae.
synonyms: Bunyaviridae infectious disease; Bunyaviridae caused disease or disorder; Bunyaviridae disease or disorder; disease due to Bunyaviridae

label: Brenner tumor
definition: A usually benign tumor composed of solid and cystic nests of epithelial cells resembling transitional epithelium; it is surrounded by an abundant stromal component that is dense and fibroblastic in nature.
synonyms: Brenner tumor
crossreferences: MEDGEN:1645498; UMLS:C4551593; NCIT:C39954; MESH:D001948; ICDO:9000/0; ONCOTREE:BTOV

label: Borrelia infectious disease
definition: Infections with bacteria of the genus borrelia.
synonyms: Borrelia caused disease or disorder; Borrelia disease or disorder

label: Birt-Hogg-Dube syndrome
synonyms: BHD

label: Bifidobacteriales infectious disease
definition: Infections with BACTERIA of the order Bifidobacteriales. This includes infections in the genera BIFIDOBACTERIUM and GARDNERELLA, in the family Bifidobacteriaceae.
synonyms: Bifidobacteriales caused disease or disorder; Bifidobacteriales disease or disorder

label: Bartonellaceae infectious disease
definition: Infections with bacteria of the family bartonellaceae.
synonyms: Bartonellaceae caused disease or disorder; Bartonellaceae disease or disorder

label: Bartholin gland neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the Bartholin gland. Representative examples include adenoma, adenomyoma, adenocarcinoma, and squamous cell carcinoma.
synonyms: neoplasm of the Bartholin's gland; major vestibular gland tumor; neoplasm of major vestibular gland; tumor of major vestibular gland; major vestibular gland neoplasm; tumour of the Bartholin's gland; tumour of Bartholin's gland; Bartholin's gland tumor; Bartholin's gland tumour; tumor of Bartholin's gland; major vestibular gland tumour; Bartholin's gland neoplasm; major vestibular gland neoplasm (disease); neoplasm of Bartholin's gland; Bartholin gland neoplasm; tumour of major vestibular gland; tumor of the Bartholin's gland

label: Bartholin gland benign neoplasm
definition: A benign neoplasm that affects the Bartholin gland. Representative examples include adenoma, adenomyoma, adenocarcinoma, and squamous cell carcinoma.
synonyms: major vestibular gland benign neoplasm

label: Bartholin gland adenocarcinoma
definition: A carcinoma that arises from glandular epithelial cells of the major vestibular gland.
synonyms: major vestibular gland adenocarcinoma; adenocarcinoma of the Bartholin's gland; Bartholin gland adenocarcinoma

label: Bacteroidaceae infectious disease
definition: Infections with bacteria of the family BACTEROIDACEAE.
synonyms: Bacteroidaceae caused disease or disorder; Bacteroidaceae disease or disorder

label: Bacillaceae infectious disease
definition: Infections with bacteria of the family bacillaceae.
synonyms: Bacillaceae caused disease or disorder; Bacillaceae disease or disorder

label: BRCA2-related cancer predisposition
definition: Hereditary cancer predisposition due to variation(s) in the BRCA2 gene. Germline pathogenic or likely pathogenic variants in the BRCA2 gene confer an autosomal dominant predisposition to hereditary breast and ovarian cancer. Tumor formation at other sites, including pancreatic and prostate cancer, have been described.

label: BRCA1-related cancer predisposition
definition: Hereditary cancer predisposition due to variation(s) in the BRCA1 gene. Germline pathogenic or likely pathogenic variants in the BRCA1 gene confer an autosomal dominant predisposition to hereditary breast and ovarian cancer. Tumor formation at other sites, including pancreatic cancer have been described.

label: BEST1-related vitreoretinochoroidopathy
definition: Any vitreoretinochoroidopathy caused by a heterozygous variant in the BEST1 gene.
synonyms: BEST1-related vitreoretinochoroidopathy; ADVRIC

label: BEST1-related recessive retinopathy
definition: Any retinopathy caused by bi-allelic variants in the BEST1 gene.
synonyms: BEST1-related recessive retinopathy

label: BEST1-related dominant retinopathy
definition: Any retinopathy caused by a heterozygous variant in the BEST1 gene.
synonyms: BEST1-related dominant retinopathy

label: BBS9-related ciliopathy
definition: Any ciliopathy caused by variants in the BBS9 gene.
synonyms: BBS9-related ciliopathy

label: BBS10-related ciliopathy
definition: Any ciliopathy caused by variants in the BBS10 gene.
synonyms: BBS10-related ciliopathy

label: BAFopathy
definition: Disorder caused by mutations in the various subunits composing the BAF complex.

label: B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma
definition: The most common type of non-Hodgkin lymphoma. It includes the most frequently seen morphologic variants which are: diffuse large B-cell lymphoma, follicular lymphoma, small lymphocytic lymphoma and marginal zone B-cell lymphoma. -- 2003
synonyms: B-cell NHL; B-cell non-Hodgkin's lymphoma; B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma; lymphomas non-Hodgkin's B-cell; non-Hodgkin's lymphoma B-cell; non-Hodgkin's B-cell lymphoma; B-cell lymphoma; B-cell non Hodgkin's lymphoma
subsets: mondo:nord_rare; mondo:gard_rare; mondo:ordo_group_of_disorders; mondo:disease_grouping; mondo:rare; mondo:otar

label: B-cell neoplasm
definition: A group of heterogeneous lymphoid tumors generally expressing one or more B-cell antigens or representing malignant transformations of B-lymphocytes.
synonyms: B-cell neoplasm; B-cell lymphocytic neoplasm
crossreferences: NCIT:C27907; MEDGEN:86953; GARD:5877; MESH:D016393; UMLS:C0079731; DOID:707

label: B-cell lymphoma, unclassifiable, with features intermediate between diffuse large b-cell lymphoma and classical Hodgkin lymphoma
definition: A group of lymphomas displaying molecular, morphologic, immunophenotypic, and clinical overlap between classical Hodgkin lymphoma and diffuse large B-cell lymphoma. This term particularly applies to mediastinal lymphomas with overlapping features of mediastinal (thymic) large B-cell lymphoma and classical Hodgkin lymphoma.
synonyms: Hodgkin-like anaplastic large cell lymphoma; Grey zone lymphoma; large B-cell lymphoma with Hodgkin features; B-cell lymphoma, unclassifiable, with features Intermediate between diffuse large B-cell lymphoma and Classic Hodgkin lymphoma; B-cell lymphoma, unclassifiable, with features Intermediate between diffuse large B-cell lymphoma and classical Hodgkin lymphoma; Gray zone lymphoma

label: B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia
definition: A neoplasm of lymphoblasts committed to the B-cell lineage, typically composed of small to medium-sized blast cells. When the neoplasm involves predominantly the bone marrow and the peripheral blood, it is called B acute lymphoblastic leukemia. When it involves nodal or extranodal sites, it is called B lymphoblastic lymphoma. (WHO, 2001)
synonyms: precursor B lymphoblastic leukemia/lymphoma; B lymphoblastic leukemia/lymphoma; precursor B-lymphoblastic lymphoma/leukemia

label: Ascaridida infectious disease
definition: Infections with nematodes of the order ascaridida.
synonyms: Ascaridida caused disease or disorder; Ascaridida disease or disorder

label: Arenaviridae infectious disease
definition: Virus diseases caused by the arenaviridae.
synonyms: disease due to arenavirus; arenavirus infectious disease; Arenaviridae caused disease or disorder; Arenaviridae disease or disorder

label: Anaplasmataceae infectious disease
definition: Infections with bacteria of the family anaplasmataceae.
synonyms: Anaplasmataceae disease or disorder; Anaplasmataceae caused disease or disorder

label: Alzheimer disease
definition: A progressive, neurodegenerative disease characterized by loss of function and death of nerve cells in several areas of the brain leading to loss of cognitive function such as memory and language.
synonyms: Alzheimer dementia; presenile and senile dementia; Alzheimer's disease; Alzheimers dementia; Alzheimer disease; Alzheimer's dementia; Alzheimers disease; AD
crossreferences: MESH:D000544; ICD10CM:G30; ICD9:290.1; MEDGEN:1853; NCIT:C2866; icd11.foundation:1611724421; SCTID:142811000119104; ICD9:331.0; Orphanet:238616; NIFSTD:birnlex_2092; UMLS:C0002395; HP:0002511; DOID:10652

label: Alphavirus infectious disease
definition: Virus diseases caused by members of the alphavirus genus of the family togaviridae.
synonyms: Alphavirus caused disease or disorder; Alphavirus disease or disorder

label: Aeromonas hydrophila infectious disease
definition: Aeromonas hydrophila infection is a bacterial disease caused by infection from the Aeromonas hydrophila bacteria.
synonyms: Aeromonas hydrophila caused disease or disorder; Aeromonas hydrophila disease or disorder

label: Actinomycetales infectious disease
definition: Infections with bacteria of the order actinomycetales.
synonyms: actinomycetales disease or disorder; infection, actinomycetales; infection, actinomycete; actinomycotic infectious disease; actinomycetales caused disease or disorder; infections, actinomycete; actinomycotic infection; infections, actinomycetales; actinomycete infection; actinomycetales infection; actinomycete infections; actinomycetales infections

label: Acanthamoeba infectious disease
definition: An infectious disease involving the Acanthamoeba.
synonyms: Acanthamoeba infection; infection by Acanthamoeba

label: ASAH1-related sphingolipidosis
definition: A spectrum of disorders that includes Farber disease and spinal muscular atrophy with progressive myoclonic epilepsy. Both disorders are caused by mutations in the ASAH1 gene that encodes the lysosomal hydrolase that breaks down the bioactive lipid, ceramide.

label: ASAH1-related disorders
definition: The spectrum of ASAH1-related disorders ranges from Farber disease (FD) to spinal muscular atrophy with progressive myoclonic epilepsy (SMA-PME). The diagnosis of an ASAH1-related disorder is established in a proband with suggestive clinical findings by identification of biallelic pathogenic variants in ASAH1 and/or decreased activity of the enzyme acid ceramidase in peripheral blood leukocytes or cultured skin fibroblasts.
synonyms: ASAH1-related disorders

label: ALG14-congenital disorder of glycosylation
definition: Deficiency in the ALG14 enzyme results in incomplete assembly of the lipid linked oligosaccharide (LLO), leading to insufficient N-glycosylation of glycoproteins.
synonyms: ALG14-CDG

label: AKT3-related overgrowth spectrum
definition: Any overgrowth syndrome where the cause of the disease is a gain-of-function variant in the AKT3 gene.

label: AIDS-related disorder
definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder arising as a result of the immunologic defects caused by Autoimmune deficiency Syndrome.
synonyms: AIDS-related complications; AIDS/HIV - relatedDisease associated with AIDS; AIDS-related disorder; disease associated with AIDS

label: ADAR-related type 1 interferonopathy
definition: Any type 1 interferonopathies in which the cause of the disease is a variation in the ADAR gene. Individuals with variants in ADAR can present with a variety of phenotypes, including Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome and dyschromatosis symmetrica hereditaria.

label: ACTH-producing pituitary gland neoplasm
definition: An adenoma or carcinoma of the pituitary gland that produces corticotropin.
synonyms: pituitary corticotropin secreting tumour; ACTH-producing pituitary tumor; ACTH-producing pituitary neoplasm; adrenocorticotropin secreting tumor of pituitary; ACTH-secreting tumor of the pituitary; adrenocorticotropin secreting neoplasm of the pituitary; adrenocorticotropin secreting tumor of the pituitary; adrenocorticotropin secreting tumour of the pituitary; adrenocorticotropin secreting neoplasm of pituitary; adrenocorticotropin producing pituitary gland tumor; ACTH-secreting tumor of pituitary; pituitary corticotropin secreting tumor; ACTH-producing pituitary gland neoplasm; ACTH-secreting tumour of pituitary; adrenocorticotropin producing pituitary gland tumour; adrenocorticotropin secreting pituitary gland tumor; ACTH producing pituitary gland neoplasm; pituitary corticotropin secreting neoplasm; adrenocorticotropin secreting tumour of pituitary; ACTH-producing pituitary tumour; adrenocorticotropin secreting pituitary gland tumour; corticotropin secreting pituitary gland neoplasm; ACTH-secreting tumour of the pituitary

label: ACTH-independent Cushing syndrome
definition: Adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) independent Cushing syndrome is a form of endogenous Cushing syndrome (CS) that may result from excess secretion of cortisol by either a unilateral and benign (adrenocortical adenoma: 55-60%) or malignant (adrenocortical carcinoma: 35-40 %) adrenocortical tumor or by bilateral adrenal secretion by macronodular adrenal hyperplasia (AIMAH), as an isolated disease or as part of McCune-Albright syndrome (MAS), or by primary pigmented nodular adrenocortical disease (PPNAD), as an isolated disease or as part of Carney complex (CNC).
synonyms: adrenocorticotropic hormone-independent Cushing syndrome; adrenal Cushing syndrome; corticotropin-independent Cushing syndrome

label: ACD-related telomere biology disorder
definition: A complex set of inherited conditions caused by a pathogenic variant(s) in the ACD gene that results in aberrant telomere biology.
synonyms: ACD-related telomeropathy

label: ACD-related short telomere syndrome
definition: A spectrum of conditions, including dyskeratosis congenita, Hoyeraal-Hreidarsson syndrome, hereditary aplastic anemia, and pulmonary fibrosis, typically characterized by shortened telomeres due to a pathogenic variant(s) in ACD that results in impaired telomere maintenance.

label: ABeta2M amyloidosis
synonyms: Beta2-microglobulinic amyloidosis
crossreferences: GARD:21829; UMLS:C5680053; Orphanet:439246; DOID:0080928; icd11.foundation:448754119; MEDGEN:1842860

label: 46,XY disorder of sex development
definition: Differences of sex development in individuals with 46,XY karyotype.
synonyms: 46,XY differences of Sex development; 46,XY disorders of Sex development; 46,XY DSD
crossreferences: UMLS:C2751824; MEDGEN:414114; Orphanet:98085; SCTID:8234004; GARD:8538; NCIT:C127171; NANDO:2200393; MESH:D058490

label: 46,XX disorder of sex development
definition: Conditions affecting individuals with 46,XX karyotype characterized by atypical development of one or more of the following: the gonads, the internal reproductive structures, the external reproductive/genital structures.
synonyms: female pseudohermaphroditism; 46,XX disorders of Sex development; 46,XX differences of Sex development; 46,XX DSD
crossreferences: MESH:D058489; Orphanet:2982; NCIT:C127169; GARD:18783; SCTID:8800006; MEDGEN:424728; UMLS:C2936403

label: 3-phosphoglycerate dehydrogenase deficiency
crossreferences: UMLS:C0580190; Orphanet:422519; icd11.foundation:460538363; ICD9:270.7; MEDGEN:663158; SCTID:303098002

label: 2-hydroxyglutaric aciduria
definition: 2-Hydroxyglutaric aciduria is a group of neurometabolic disorders with a wide clinical spectrum ranging from severe neonatal presentations to progressive forms, and asymptomatic cases, characterized biochemically by increased levels of 2-hydroxyglutaric acid in the plasma, cerebrospinal fluid and urine.
synonyms: 2-hydroxyglutaric acidemia; 2-hydroxyglutaric aciduria

crossreferences: MEDGEN:412535; UMLS:C2746066; NCIT:C128187; DOID:0050573; Orphanet:19; ICD9:270.8; MESH:C535306; GARD:10761; SCTID:698870008; icd11.foundation:896211058
